English: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was blameless and upright, and one who feared God and shunned evil.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm dêh char Usa đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo anăn sư Jop, sư đei đon 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng weh ataih đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: And seven sons and three daughters were born to him.
Bahnar: Sư pơjing tơpơh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng pêng 'nu kon drŏ-kăn.

English: Also, his possessions were seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen, five hundred female donkeys, and a very large household, so that this man was the greatest of all the people of the East.
Bahnar: Jop đei tơpơh-rơbâu tŏ triu, pêng-rơbâu tŏ aseh lăk-đa, pơđăm-hrĕng hơgrop rơmo choh, pơđăm-hrĕng tŏ aseh iĕ akăn păng đei đĭch đam lơ; sư mơdrŏng hloh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lăm dêh char gah Hơlĕch.

English: And his sons would go and feast in their houses, each on his appointed day, and would send and invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo sư juăt kơ et sa, hơpong băl dăr tơ rim hnam lu sư; păng wơ̆n pêng 'nu mai oh drŏ-kăn sŏng sa hơdai lu sư.

English: So it was, when the days of feasting had run their course, that Job would send and sanctify them, and he would rise early in the morning and offer burnt offerings according to the number of them all. For Job said, “It may be that my sons have sinned and cursed God in their hearts.” Thus Job did regularly.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ dôm năr et sa đang bơih, Jop wơh krao lu kon sư brŏk wă pơm giĕng ôp 'nhao rơgoh. Sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih, wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh tôm kơ lu kon sư; sư tơchĕng khan: “Băt lu kon inh pơm yoch păng băt lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư blei hiap Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.” Jop juăt kơ pơm thoi noh.

English: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan also came among them.
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr ei lu linh jang năm akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng Satanb kư̆m năm hăm lu sư mơ̆n.

English: And the LORD said to Satan, “From where do you come?” So Satan answered the LORD and said, “From going to and fro on the earth, and from walking back and forth on it.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet Satan: “E đơ̆ng yơ?” Satan tơl Kră Yang: “Inh chă nơnăm juang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.”

English: Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job, that there is none like him on the earth, a blameless and upright man, one who fears God and shuns evil?”
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet dơ̆ng Satan, “E hăm 'bôh Jop bơngai hli yom kơ Inh? Lăm teh đak ưh kơ đei bu thoi sư, đei đon 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, băt hli yom kơ Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng weh ataih đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆.”

English: So Satan answered the LORD and said, “Does Job fear God for nothing?
Bahnar: Satan tơl Kră Yang: “Jop hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei yua kiơ hă?”

English: Have You not made a hedge around him, around his household, and around all that he has on every side? You have blessed the work of his hands, and his possessions have increased in the land.
Bahnar: “Yua kơ Ih war dur tăp dăr wei-lăng sư, hnam dơnŏ sư păng dôm tơmam sư đei. Ih tuh ăn pŭn kơ tơdrong jang sư păng ăn kơ sư tơmam rai lơ lăm teh.

English: But now, stretch out Your hand and touch all that he has, and he will surely curse You to Your face!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei dah Ih yơ̆r ti pơrăm dôm tơmam sư đei, lei sư gô hiap Ih hloi.”

English: And the LORD said to Satan, “Behold, all that he has is in your power; only do not lay a hand on his person.” So Satan went out from the presence of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Satan: “Âu dôm tơmam sư đei pơjao đĭ lăm tơpang ti e; mă-lei e 'nĕ hơtŭt 'bơm akâu sư.” Na Satan weh hloi đơ̆ng anăp Kră Yang.

English: Now there was a day when his sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr ei, kơplah lu kon drŏ-nglo păng kon drŏ-kăn Jop oei et sa lăm hnam 'nhŏng kơdră lu sư

English: and a messenger came to Job and said, “The oxen were plowing and the donkeys feeding beside them
Bahnar: minh 'nu bơngai jang năm roi ăn kơ Jop thoi âu: “Rơmo oei choh, aseh iĕ oei sa jê̆ kiơ̆ ei.

English: when the Sabeans raided them and took them away—indeed they have killed the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to tell you!”
Bahnar: Blư bla đei lu bơngai Sêba năm blah, tơgar rôp iŏk đĭ hloi rơmo, aseh iĕ păng koh pơlôch lu đĭch đam ih hăm đao; lăp minh 'nu inh đĕch hlôi tơ âu năm roi ăn kơ ih.”

English: While he was still speaking, another also came and said, “The fire of God fell from heaven and burned up the sheep and the servants, and consumed them; and I alone have escaped to tell you!”
Bahnar: Bơngai âu oei pơma, na blư kơ minh 'nu bơngai nai truh roi: “Glaih đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh taih, ŭnh sa đĭ lu triu păng lu bơngai wei triu ih, lăp minh 'nu inh đĕch klaih năm roi ăn kơ ih.”

English: While he was still speaking, another also came and said, “The Chaldeans formed three bands, raided the camels and took them away, yes, and killed the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to tell you!”
Bahnar: Bơngai âu oei pơma, na 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng truh roi: “Lu bơngai Kalđê đei pêng khŭl, wang blah tơgar iŏk aseh lăk-đa păng koh pơlôch đĭ lu đĭch đam hăm đao; lăp minh 'nu inh đĕch klaih năm roi ăn kơ ih.”

English: While he was still speaking, another also came and said, “Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house
Bahnar: Bơngai âu oei pơma, na minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng truh năm roi: “Lu kon drŏ-nglo păng kon drŏ-kăn ih oei et sa tơ hnam 'nhŏng kơdră lu sư.”

English: and suddenly a great wind came from across the wilderness and struck the four corners of the house, and it fell on the young people, and they are dead; and I alone have escaped to tell you!”
Bahnar: Na đei kial hơbŭt tih đơ̆ng char glă pơm kơ puăn pah mum hnam. Hnam păk glơ̆m kơtĭt lu kon ih lôch đĭ; lăp minh 'nu inh đĕch klaih, năm roi ăn kơ ih.

English: Then Job arose, tore his robe, and shaved his head; and he fell to the ground and worshiped.
Bahnar: Jop gruih iung hloi, hek ao sư hơkôih kơ̆l 'ngôch, drap bon tơ teh kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: And he said: “Naked I came from my mother’s womb, And naked shall I return there. The LORD gave, and the LORD has taken away; Blessed be the name of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Păng khan: “Mĕ inh tơpŭ kơ inh sơ̆ akâu hoh, păng inh brŏk tơ teh kư̆m gô akâu hoh mơ̆n; Kră Yang asong ăn, Kră Yang pơdrâu iŏk dơ̆ng; trŏ bơnê kơ anăn Kră Yang!”

English: In all this Job did not sin nor charge God with wrong.
Bahnar: Lăm dôm tơdrong noh, Jop ưh kơ đei pơm yoch păng ưh kơ đei pơma kư̆ kă kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Again there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them to present himself before the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr nai đơ̆ng đei lu linh jang năm akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na Satan kư̆m năm mơ̆n 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD said to Satan, “From where do you come?” Satan answered the LORD and said, “From going to and fro on the earth, and from walking back and forth on it.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet Satan: “E đơ̆ng yơ?” Satan tơl Kră Yang, “inh chă lăng nơnăm juang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.”

English: Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job, that there is none like him on the earth, a blameless and upright man, one who fears God and shuns evil? And still he holds fast to his integrity, although you incited Me against him, to destroy him without cause.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Satan: “E hăm 'bôh Jop bơngai mă hli yom kơ Inh, jơ̆p lăm teh đak ưh kơ đei bu thoi Jop minh 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng weh ataih đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆? Mă khan e apinh Inh wă kơ pơrăm sư tơdrong kơ đei, sư oei wei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.”

English: So Satan answered the LORD and said, “Skin for skin! Yes, all that a man has he will give for his life.
Bahnar: Satan tơl Kră Yang: “Akar 'mong akar. Minh 'nu bơngai kư̆m gơh jao đĭ mŭk tơmam sư đei wă tơplih iŏk tơdrong arih sư.

English: But stretch out Your hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will surely curse You to Your face!”
Bahnar: Apinh Ih chro ti pơrăm truh tơ kơting sĕch Jop sĭt sư gô hiap Ih.”

English: And the LORD said to Satan, “Behold, he is in your hand, but spare his life.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Satan: “'Nâu e gơh pơm kơ Jop mă-lei e 'nĕ kơ pơlôch sư.”

English: So Satan went out from the presence of the LORD, and struck Job with painful boils from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Satan weh đơ̆ng anăp Kră Yang, na sư pơm pơmat hloi Jop đei tơ'boch đuh đơ̆ng tơpang jơ̆ng truh tơ kơ̆l.

English: And he took for himself a potsherd with which to scrape himself while he sat in the midst of the ashes.
Bahnar: Jop iŏk đơ̆ng kơcheh gŏ pơchah na hơkôih akâu jăn sư, sư hơ-oei lăm tơnuh.

English: Then his wife said to him, “Do you still hold fast to your integrity? Curse God and die!”
Bahnar: Akăn sư khan kơ sư: “Liơ ih oei wei kơjăp lăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng? Hiap bĕ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei na lôch!”

English: But he said to her, “You speak as one of the foolish women speaks. Shall we indeed accept good from God, and shall we not accept adversity?” In all this Job did not sin with his lips.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jop khan kơ akăn sư: “Ih pơma thoi minh 'nu drŏ-kăn kơwao. Tơdrong pŭn hiôk đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn, bơ̆n sơng iŏk; na tơdrong pơmat truh, ba wă ưh kơ iŏk hă?” Lăm đĭ dôm tơdrong noh, Jop ưh kơ đei pơma kơnê̆ 'bơm Kră Yang ôh.

English: Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this adversity that had come upon him, each one came from his own place—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. For they had made an appointment together to come and mourn with him, and to comfort him.
Bahnar: Pêng 'nu buăl Jop kơtơ̆ng sư đei dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat noh lu sư pơđâu băl rim 'nu đơ̆ng tơring sư kơdih wă năm ngôi wang sơ'ngon păng wă pơlung Jop. Pêng 'nu noh anăn sư Êliphas đơ̆ng pơlei Têman, Bildat đơ̆ng char Sua păng Sôphar đơ̆ng tơring pơlei Naama.

English: And when they raised their eyes from afar, and did not recognize him, they lifted their voices and wept; and each one tore his robe and sprinkled dust on his head toward heaven.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng ataih, lu sư lăng 'bôh Jop, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ kơnăl ôh. Lăp lu sư kơnăl kơ Jop bơih na nhơ̆m ôr, hek ao lu sư kơdih, chup 'mui teh săi tơ kơpal păng săi tơ kơ̆l kơdih.

English: So they sat down with him on the ground seven days and seven nights, and no one spoke a word to him, for they saw that his grief was very great.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơ-oei tơ teh hăm Jop lăm tơpơh năr tơpơh măng; ưh kơ đei bu pơma minh nơ̆r, lu sư 'bôh Jop jĭ jăn pơmat-tat dêh.

English: After this Job opened his mouth and cursed the day of his birth.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Jop pơtơm pơma hiap năr tơpŭ kơ sư.

English: And Job spoke, and said
Bahnar: Sư khan

English: “May the day perish on which I was born, And the night in which it was said, ‘A male child is conceived.’
Bahnar: Năr tơpŭ kơ inh rŏ kơ hiong răm đĭ păng măng kư̆m khan: “Đe tơpŭ bơih kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo” ưh pă đei dơ̆ng.

English: May that day be darkness; May God above not seek it, Nor the light shine upon it.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ năr noh jing măng mu, Rŏ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng kơpal ưh kơ lăng ôh năr noh kư̆m ưh kơ đei hơdah pơchrang tơ sư.

English: May darkness and the shadow of death claim it; May a cloud settle on it; May the blackness of the day terrify it.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ măng mu păng hơmơ̆l tơdrong lôch iŏk lê̆ năr noh; rŏ kơ hơmơ̆l gom lê̆ sư, rŏ kơ măng mu kơ'năr pơm kơ sư hli.

English: As for that night, may darkness seize it; May it not rejoice among the days of the year, May it not come into the number of the months.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ măng mu hơ'bơ̆l rôp pơkơ̆ng măng noh. Rŏ kơ lê̆ pă jô̆ năr noh hơdai lăm sơnăm. Kŭm ưh pă jô̆ năr noh lăm lu khei.

English: Oh, may that night be barren! May no joyful shout come into it!
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ măng noh ưh kơ đei bu anăp. Ưh kơ đei nơ̆r chơt hiôk lăm kơplah noh.

English: May those curse it who curse the day, Those who are ready to arouse Leviathan.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ bu mă juăt kơ hiap, hiap bĕ năr noh. Rŏ kơ bu juăt kơ râu Lêwiathan,a hiap bĕ măng noh

English: May the stars of its morning be dark; May it look for light, but have none, And not see the dawning of the day
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ sơnglŏng wŏng-tar jing măng mu; rŏ kơ sư chang gô hơdah, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh 'brưch hơdah, kư̆m ưh kơ đei 'bôh hơdah lĕch.

English: Because it did not shut up the doors of my mother’s womb, Nor hide sorrow from my eyes.
Bahnar: Yua kơ măng noh ưh kơtang lê̆ măng tơpu kon mĕ inh na anăp kơ inh. Kŭm ưh kơ đei ôn lê̆ tơdrong pơmat-tat đơ̆ng măt inh.

English: “Why did I not die at birth? Why did I not perish when I came from the womb?
Bahnar: “Liơ inh ưh kơ lôch hloi lăm năr 'nao jruh. Ưh kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m hloi lăp hlôi đơ̆ng mĕ inh.

English: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breasts, that I should nurse?
Bahnar: Liơ mă kŭl-tăng mĕ inh kơ'mĭn sơng iŏk inh păng đei hloi toh tơmŏm inh?

English: For now I would have lain still and been quiet, I would have been asleep; Then I would have been at rest
Bahnar: Dah inh lôch dang ei inh 'bĭch hiôk bơih, inh tep păng pơdơh hiôk.

English: With kings and counselors of the earth, Who built ruins for themselves
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm lu yŏng păng pơtao teh đak, lu bơngai mă pơjing anih dang ei ning-mônh kơdih gô hiong răm.

English: Or with princes who had gold, Who filled their houses with silver
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r đei hu maih tah mong 'bĕnh kơ hnam lu sư.

English: Or why was I not hidden like a stillborn child, Like infants who never saw light?
Bahnar: Liơ đe ưh kơ 'bŭ inh lăm teh, thoi kon nge rơngăt Thoi nge lôch lăp 'nao hlôi jah ưh kơ 'bôh hơdah măt 'năr?

English: There the wicked cease from troubling, And there the weary are at rest.
Bahnar: Tơ bơsat noh bơngai kơnê̆ ưh pă đei pơrăm boih, păng bơngai rơdu rơmơ̆n gô pơdơh.

English: There the prisoners rest together; They do not hear the voice of the oppressor.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai đe phak rơnŭk hiôk, ưh pă kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đe wei hil hơdrăi.

English: The small and great are there, And the servant is free from his master.
Bahnar: Tơ noh bơngai mơdrŏng, dơnuh kư̆m lei-lăi, păng bơngai đĭch gơh rơngei đơ̆ng yŏng tơ'ngla sư pơgŏ pơđep.”

English: “Why is light given to him who is in misery, And life to the bitter of soul
Bahnar: “Liơ bơngai pơmat-tat rai gơh 'bôh hơdah, păng bơngai chhŭr nuih na oei gơh arih?

English: Who long for death, but it does not come, And search for it more than hidden treasures
Bahnar: Lu sư hơpơi wă kơ lôch, mă ưh kơ gơh lôch; lu sư wă kơ lôch hloh kơ chă anih đe ôn hu maih.

English: Who rejoice exceedingly, And are glad when they can find the grave?
Bahnar: Lu sư chơt hiôk 'nă hal. Hiôk-hian truh tơ đe 'bŭ lăm bơsat

English: Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden, And whom God has hedged in?
Bahnar: Liơ bơngai mă yak lăm trong đe chĭt bơih, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei war chĭt tăp dăr, mă gơh 'bôh hơdah?

English: For my sighing comes before I eat, And my groanings pour out like water.
Bahnar: Inh tơtok tơtăm truh tơpă gơh sŏng sa. Inh nhơ̆m hmoi ôr thoi đak ro.

English: For the thing I greatly feared has come upon me, And what I dreaded has happened to me.
Bahnar: Tơdrong inh hli truh tơ inh bơih. Tơdrong mă inh tơrơ krưp tuh klơ̆p tơ inh.

English: I am not at ease, nor am I quiet; I have no rest, for trouble comes.”
Bahnar: Inh tam đei arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng, Kŭm tam đei pơdơh rơhơi jơhngơ̆m tơdrong gleh pơmat truh tơ inh hloi!”

English: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said
Bahnar: Êliphas, bơngai Thêman sư tơl

English: “If one attempts a word with you, will you become weary? But who can withhold himself from speaking?
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai pơ̆n pơma dơnuh hăm ih, ih hăm hiôk ưh? “Mă-lei hăm đei bu mă kĕ ĕnh ưh kơ pơma?

English: Surely you have instructed many, And you have strengthened weak hands.
Bahnar: Ki sơ̆, ih đei bơtho pơlung lơ bơngai, Ih đei tơgŭm bơih ti rơdu jing pran.

English: Your words have upheld him who was stumbling, And you have strengthened the feeble knees
Bahnar: Nơ̆r ih pơma tơgŭm bơngai pơ̆k gơh iung dơ̆ng, Ih pơm ăn kŭl-tăng rơdu jing jăng.

English: But now it comes upon you, and you are weary; It touches you, and you are troubled.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei đei tơdrong gleh truh kơ ih, mă ih kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ chu iŏk; Ih tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong pơmat-tat, na ih hli tơrơ.

English: Is not your reverence your confidence? And the integrity of your ways your hope?
Bahnar: Ih hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, liơ ih ưh kơ lui kơjăp? Ih arih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, liơ mă ưh kơ đei hơmĕng?”

English: “Remember now, who ever perished being innocent? Or where were the upright ever cut off?
Bahnar: “Ih athei tơchĕng lăng 'mơ̆i, hăm đei bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ưh kơ pơm yoch mă wă lôch hiong? Păng hăm đei anih ayơ bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt đe pơrăm?

English: Even as I have seen, Those who plow iniquity And sow trouble reap the same.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ thoi inh 'bôh bơngai mă choh hăm tơdrong kơnê̆, lu bơngai rei tơdrong pơmat-tat đĕch, gô kĕch iŏk tơdrong noh.

English: By the blast of God they perish, And by the breath of His anger they are consumed.
Bahnar: Hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơrăm lu sư. Tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil mĭl na lu sư hiong răm.

English: The roaring of the lion, The voice of the fierce lion, And the teeth of the young lions are broken.
Bahnar: Mă khan bơngai kơnê̆ grĕnh arum thoi dăm-brang, hơnĕnh dăm-brang yŏng Kră Yang gơ̆ lê̆ bơih.

English: The old lion perishes for lack of prey, And the cubs of the lioness are scattered.
Bahnar: Dăm-brang pran kơtang lôch yua kơ ưh kơ đei sem bri wă sa. Păng khŭl dăm-brang kon lu sư tơklah tơklang.”

English: “Now a word was secretly brought to me, And my ear received a whisper of it.
Bahnar: Minh nơ̆r pơma hơgơ̆m truh tơ inh. Đon inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma mơmơnh.

English: In disquieting thoughts from the visions of the night, When deep sleep falls on men
Bahnar: Oei tep tơchĕng kơ tơdrong apo 'bôh kơmăng, kơplah tŏk-bŏk măng đĭ-đăng bơngai oei tep hlơ̆k

English: Fear came upon me, and trembling, Which made all my bones shake.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli truh tơ inh pơm kơ inh tơtơ̆, pơpơ̆ đĭ-đăng kơting.

English: Then a spirit passed before my face; The hair on my body stood up.
Bahnar: Đei hơyuh kial bah brih muh măt inh, pơm kơ inh tĭr hơdrôt sŏk sop iung!

English: It stood still, But I could not discern its appearance. A form was before my eyes; There was silence; Then I heard a voice saying
Bahnar: Đei ngôi rup noh dơ̆ng hĭ, inh lăng ưh kơ kơnăl. Đei hơbŏ bơngai lĕch dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp inh. Oei dơ̆ng hreh, inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma

English: ‘Can a mortal be more righteous than God? Can a man be more pure than his Maker?
Bahnar: ‘Kon bơngai bơ̆n hăm đei bu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei? 'Bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing hăm đei bu 'lơ̆ng rơgoh?

English: If He puts no trust in His servants, If He charges His angels with error
Bahnar: Mă lu đĭch đam Sư, Sư kư̆m ưh kơ ngeh. Lu Lĭnh Jang, Sư kư̆m oei jô̆ glăi.

English: How much more those who dwell in houses of clay, Whose foundation is in the dust, Who are crushed before a moth?
Bahnar: Pơma kiơ kơ kon bơngai đơ̆ng teh lơ̆n. Pơjing đơ̆ng 'mui teh, trŏ kơ pơjuă bơhlơ̆r thoi mua kơmot.

English: They are broken in pieces from morning till evening; They perish forever, with no one regarding.
Bahnar: Lăm minh pơgê kơsơ̆ đe pơrăm sư hĕch hoch. Lôch hiong hlŏng hloi ưh kơ đei bu băt dơ̆ng.

English: Does not their own excellence go away? They die, even without wisdom.’
Bahnar: Mưh tơlei bơsŭn plôh tơ nai. Lu sư gô lôch, pă đei bu hŏk iŏk gơh hơgei.’

English: “Call out now; Is there anyone who will answer you? And to which of the holy ones will you turn?
Bahnar: “Ih krao apinh bĕ, hăm đei bu tơl ih? Ih wă gơnang kơ bu lăm lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh?

English: For wrath kills a foolish man, And envy slays a simple one.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơtul đei jơhngơ̆m blĕk pơlôch kơdih akâu, jơhngơ̆m gar pơlôch lu bơngai kơhlôh kơwao.

English: I have seen the foolish taking root, But suddenly I cursed his dwelling place.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh bơih lu bơngai kơtul rai chăt rơh, mă-lei pă 'biơ̆ đĕch Kră Yang gô hiap anih hnam sư oei.a

English: His sons are far from safety, They are crushed in the gate, And there is no deliverer.
Bahnar: Lu kon hơ'lơ̆p sư ưh kơ đei hơđơ̆ng ôh, đe gô juă bơhlơ̆r 'bơ̆t 'măng jang, na ưh kơ đei bu dŏng lu sư.

English: Because the hungry eat up his harvest, Taking it even from the thorns, And a snare snatches their substance.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơngot sa đĭ dôm lu plei sư phĕ yuă. Lu sư kư̆m sa plei chăt đơ̆ng lăm rơ̆m jơla; păng lu bơngai rơhing, 'nhĕng kơ mŭk tơmam lu sư.

English: For affliction does not come from the dust, Nor does trouble spring from the ground
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong pơmat-tat kon bơngai ưh kơ lĕch đơ̆ng 'mui teh ôh, Hăm tơdrong rŭng răng kon bơngai kư̆m ưh kơ chăt đơ̆ng teh mơ̆n

English: Yet man is born to trouble, As the sparks fly upward.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng năr đe tơpŭ kơ kon bơngai sư đei tơdrong pơmat-tat. Tơpă gô thoi ŭnh đeh đông tơ kơpal.”b

English: “But as for me, I would seek God, And to God I would commit my cause
Bahnar: “Gah inh, inh gô krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, inh gô pơjao tơdrong inh kơ Sư

English: Who does great things, and unsearchable, Marvelous things without number.
Bahnar: Sư pơm dôm tơdrong tih-tin, ưh kơ đei bu hlôh, Tơdrong hlĭch chrơp ưh pă kĕ jô̆.

English: He gives rain on the earth, And sends waters on the fields.
Bahnar: Sư ăn đak 'mi jur tơ teh. Đak 'mi hơiuh kơ mir na.

English: He sets on high those who are lowly, And those who mourn are lifted to safety.
Bahnar: Sư tơiung lu bơngai răm-'băm. Ăn kơ lu bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi oei tơ anih hơđơ̆ng.

English: He frustrates the devices of the crafty, So that their hands cannot carry out their plans.
Bahnar: Sư pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong lu bơngai kơnê̆ chă đon wă pơm. Ăn kơ tơdrong kiơ ti lu sư wă pơm ưh kơ jing.

English: He catches the wise in their own craftiness, And the counsel of the cunning comes quickly upon them.
Bahnar: Sư rôp lu bơngai hơgei 'bơ̆r đon huŏng lăm tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư wă pơm. Sư kư̆m pơtôch lê̆ 'bônh đĕch tơdrong lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă pơm.

English: They meet with darkness in the daytime, And grope at noontime as in the night.
Bahnar: Kơ'năr lu sư yak thoi lăm măng mu. Tŏk-bŏk 'năr dơ̆ng lu sư chă hơwơ̆ thoi kơmăng.

English: But He saves the needy from the sword, From the mouth of the mighty, And from their hand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sư dŏng pơklaih lu bơngai pơmat-tat đơ̆ng đao gưm,c pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r păng ti lu bơngai pran kơtang.

English: So the poor have hope, And injustice shuts her mouth.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai dơnuh hoh đei chang hơmĕng, lu bơngai kơnê̆ Kră Yang pơŏm lê̆ 'bơ̆r.”

English: “Behold, happy is the man whom God corrects; Therefore do not despise the chastening of the Almighty.
Bahnar: “'Nâu, pŭn dêh kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei teh bơtho, thoi noh 'nĕ kơ lăng hơi, kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh teh bơtho.

English: For He bruises, but He binds up; He wounds, but His hands make whole.
Bahnar: Sư teh rơka, mă-lei Sư gô pơ̆n ming hơmet, Sư teh jĭ, mă-lei Sư gô pơklaih.

English: He shall deliver you in six troubles, Yes, in seven no evil shall touch you.
Bahnar: Ih đei tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong pơmat-tat tơdrâu tơpơh 'măng, Sư oei dŏng pơklaih ih.

English: In famine He shall redeem you from death, And in war from the power of the sword.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt, Sư dŏng pơklaih ih đơ̆ng lôch. Lăm tơdrong tơblah Sư pơklaih ih đơ̆ng đao gưm wă pơlôch ih.

English: You shall be hidden from the scourge of the tongue, And you shall not be afraid of destruction when it comes.
Bahnar: Sư pơklaih ih đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r hơpiĕt bơngai pơma kơnê̆, Ih huay kơ hli ôh mă tơdrong răm truh.

English: You shall laugh at destruction and famine, And you shall not be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
Bahnar: Ih gô hiĕk hơđơ̆ng mă tơdrong răm păng tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt truh. Mă sem bri ih kư̆m huay kơ hli.

English: For you shall have a covenant with the stones of the field, And the beasts of the field shall be at peace with you.
Bahnar: Mir chŭn ih choh huay kơ tơmo păng lu sem bri brah oei hiôk hăm ih.

English: You shall know that your tent is in peace; You shall visit your dwelling and find nothing amiss.
Bahnar: Ih gô băt sĭt bơsŭn anih ih oei hiôk jơnap. Ih gô wei rong lu khŭl triu rơmo ih, oei tôm ưh kơ đei hiong ayơ.

English: You shall also know that your descendants shall be many, And your offspring like the grass of the earth.
Bahnar: Ih gô 'bôh adrĕch adrung kon sâu lơ kơdrơ̆m, kon sâu ih lơ thoi 'nhĕt kơpal teh.

English: You shall come to the grave at a full age, As a sheaf of grain ripens in its season.
Bahnar: Ih gô brŏk tơ bơsat kơplah ih 'lŏ kră sot lơ sơnăm thoi hơchô̆ 'ba truh tơ anih preh 'ba lăp bơyan.”

English: Behold, this we have searched out; It is true. Hear it, and know for yourself.”
Bahnar: “Dôm tơdrong noh lu nhôn lăng sĭt trŏ tơpă boih. Mơ̆ng bĕ inh, na ih gô băt tơdrong noh.”

English: Then Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop khan

English: “Oh, that my grief were fully weighed, And my calamity laid with it on the scales!
Bahnar: “Ôi! Hơpơi rŏ kơ đe kŏng lăng tơdrong pơmat-tat inh, dôm tơdrong gleh pơmat inh dan kơpal 'long kŏng!

English: For then it would be heavier than the sand of the sea— Therefore my words have been rash.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh trăp hloh kơ chuơh đak dơsĭ! Yua kơ noh bơih na inh pă kĕ ĕnh pơma.

English: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me; My spirit drinks in their poison; The terrors of God are arrayed against me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'brơ̆m Tơ'ngla Kră Yang Hloh prah 'bơm inh, Jơhngơ̆m inh huch đak hơkăm, Inh hli tơrơ tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei blah inh.

English: Does the wild donkey bray when it has grass, Or does the ox low over its fodder?
Bahnar: Aseh iĕ hăm hmoi ôr tơdah sư đei 'nhĕt sa? Dah rơmo hăm hmoi tơdah sư đei 'nhĕt kro sa?

English: Can flavorless food be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
Bahnar: Tơmam sa sap, đe hăm tah 'boh ưh?a Lăm lăk kok kơtăp iĕr hăm đei 'bâu kiơ ưh?

English: My soul refuses to touch them; They are as loathsome food to me.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ wă sa tơmam noh ôh; sa rai thim jĭ jăn.”

English: “Oh, that I might have my request, That God would grant me the thing that I long for!
Bahnar: “Ơ inh wă dêh dôm tơdrong apinh noh đei; Rŏ dêh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn đei dôm tơdrong inh hơpơi wă.

English: That it would please God to crush me, That He would loose His hand and cut me off!
Bahnar: Kuă kơ kiơ Kră Yang lăp đon pơjuă bơhlơ̆r inh. Rŏ kơ Sư yua ti Sư chơ̆ng kơtĕch lê̆ chăl arih inh.

English: Then I would still have comfort; Though in anguish I would exult, He will not spare; For I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lôch noh jing tơdrong pơlung inh; păng inh gô pơplŏng chơt hiôk lăm tơdrong jĭ jăn dêh. Yua kơ inh ưh kơ đei sơngah dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh pơma.”

English: “What strength do I have, that I should hope? And what is my end, that I should prolong my life?
Bahnar: “Inh đei jơhngơ̆m pran đơ̆ng yơ mă kĕ chang gô. Chăl arih inh tôch liơ ning-mônh, na inh mah adrin?

English: Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh bronze?
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m pran inh hăm trŏ kơ thoi tơmo? Akâu inh hăm trŏ kơ thoi kong?

English: Is my help not within me? And is success driven from me?
Bahnar: Tơpă inh ưh kơ gơh tơgŭm inh kơdih ôh, păng tơm tơdrong tơgŭm dŏng inh đĭ weh ataih đơ̆ng inh.

English: “To him who is afflicted, kindness should be shown by his friend, Even though he forsakes the fear of the Almighty.
Bahnar: “Bơngai rơdu ơh sơ'ngon kăl kơ đei 'bôh buăl tơgŭm pơlung, mă khan bơngai noh hiong tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: My brothers have dealt deceitfully like a brook, Like the streams of the brooks that pass away
Bahnar: Lu 'nhŏng oh inh jing bơngai hơlĕnh, nhen thoi thong đak hrĕng kro. Thoi đak lơ̆p ro koch jăng.

English: Which are dark because of the ice, And into which the snow vanishes.
Bahnar: Đak noh gơsŏk yua kơ prĕl. Đak krong rai tŏk yua kơ prĕl hach.

English: When it is warm, they cease to flow; When it is hot, they vanish from their place.
Bahnar: Mưh đei bơyan tŏ đak hrơ̆, b mưh đei 'năr tŏ pơchrang, đak hrơ̆ kro đĭ.

English: The paths of their way turn aside, They go nowhere and perish.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơdro hao lăk-đa weh trong nai; năm jrok lăm char glă păng lôch hiong đĭ.

English: The caravans of Tema look, The travelers of Sheba hope for them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơdro đơ̆ng pơlei Têma chơchă đak Lu bơngai mơdro đơ̆ng tơring Sêba hơmĕng kơ đei đak.

English: They are disappointed because they were confident; They come there and are confused.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơwơ̆l hơwang yua kơ lui hơmĕng dêh. Truh tơ thong bơngoi sơ'ngon.

English: For now you are nothing, You see terror and are afraid.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ inh 'bôh, lu iĕm thoi lu thong noh, lu iĕm 'bôh tơdrong pơmat-tat inh, lăng krưp păng hli tơrơ.

English: Did I ever say, ‘Bring something to me’? Or, ‘Offer a bribe for me from your wealth’?
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei apinh lu iĕm: “Apinh iĕm ăn bĕ tơmam kơ inh! Apinh pơyơ̆r ăn bĕ kơ inh tơmam đơ̆ng lu iĕm đei!

English: Or, ‘Deliver me from the enemy’s hand’? Or, ‘Redeem me from the hand of oppressors’?
Bahnar: Apinh pơklaih inh đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai ayăt bĕ! Dah khan, huai iŏk inh bĕ đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep inh!”

English: “Teach me, and I will hold my tongue; Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
Bahnar: “Apinh iĕm bơtho tơ'bôh kơ inh, na inh ngăn hreh; Apinh tơ'bôh tơbăt kơ inh pơm glăi 'bơ̆t yơ.

English: How forceful are right words! But what does your arguing prove?
Bahnar: Nơ̆r chrih trŏ,c pơm jĭ jơhngơ̆m tơpă! Mă-lei lu iĕm wă chrih kơ inh tơdrong kiơ?

English: Do you intend to rebuke my words, And the speeches of a desperate one, which are as wind?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm tơchĕng gơh chrih bơtho inh, nơ̆r liơ? Kơplah lu iĕm lăng nơ̆r inh pơma gah tơdrong pơmat-tat thoi kial tơthu.

English: Yes, you overwhelm the fatherless, And you undermine your friend.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm hăm đei hlang lăng tơgar băl iŏk kon mơti, dah tơplih buăl iĕm iŏk tơmam?”

English: Now therefore, be pleased to look at me; For I would never lie to your face.
Bahnar: “Dang ei, inh apinh iĕm lăng tơpăt tơ muh măt inh, inh ưh kơ đei pơma hơlĕnh kơ lu iĕm.

English: Yield now, let there be no injustice! Yes, concede, my righteousness still stands!
Bahnar: Inh apinh lu iĕm tơchĕng lăng dơ̆ng, 'nĕ chă jâu kư̆ kă. Apinh lu iĕm lăng hơlen bĕ, inh ưh kơ đei yoch.

English: Is there injustice on my tongue? Cannot my taste discern the unsavory?
Bahnar: Hơpiĕt inh hăm lah pơma kiơ hơlĕnh? Inh ưh kơ băt dah inh hơlĕnh hă?”

English: “Is there not a time of hard service for man on earth? Are not his days also like the days of a hired man?
Bahnar: “Chăl arih kon bơngai kơpal teh thoi bơngai linh jang gleh lap, hăm trŏ năr sư arih thoi bơngai jang apah kơ năr?

English: Like a servant who earnestly desires the shade, And like a hired man who eagerly looks for his wages
Bahnar: Thoi bơngai đĭch hơpơi dêh kơ đei yơ̆p, thoi bơngai jang apah chang hơmĕng kơ jên khei

English: So I have been allotted months of futility, And wearisome nights have been appointed to me.
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh, khei năr arih inh ưh kơ đei hơmĕng kơ kiơ, inh arih pơmat-tat prăt măng.

English: When I lie down, I say, ‘When shall I arise, And the night be ended?’ For I have had my fill of tossing till dawn.
Bahnar: Mưh inh 'bĭch tep, inh jet kơdih, layơ inh iung? Mă-lei măng jing kơjung tai, inh pơpơ̆ blông đang dĭng truh 'brưch hơdah.

English: My flesh is caked with worms and dust, My skin is cracked and breaks out afresh.
Bahnar: Akâu inh hrai kuer sa, akar inh kơchap tơ'boch thoi hrŭk ao. Akar inh kro hơđang jing đuh.”

English: “My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, And are spent without hope.
Bahnar: “Chăl arih inh năm kuăng thoi kơtuăl brai đe wai, inh lôch tôch hiong ưh kơ đei hơmĕng kiơ.

English: Oh, remember that my life is a breath! My eye will never again see good.
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'blŏk chăl arih inh thoi minh hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m; Măt inh ưh pă đei 'bôh tơdrong pŭn hiôk bơih.

English: The eye of him who sees me will see me no more; While your eyes are upon me, I shall no longer be.
Bahnar: Măt bu mă lăng inh ưh pă 'bôh inh bơih; măt Ih chă lăng inh, pă đei inh bơih.

English: As the cloud disappears and vanishes away, So he who goes down to the grave does not come up.
Bahnar: Thoi hơmơ̆l păr đông hiong đĭ. Thoi noh mơ̆n kon bơngai jur năm tơ pơlei lôch ưh pă gơh brŏk dơ̆ng.

English: He shall never return to his house, Nor shall his place know him anymore.
Bahnar: Sư ưh pă brŏk tơ hnam sư dơ̆ng, tơ anih sư oei sơ̆ ưh pă 'bôh sư dơ̆ng.”

English: “Therefore I will not restrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
Bahnar: “Yua kơ noh na inh ưh kơ ĕnh nơ̆r inh wă pơma; Yua kơ jơhngơ̆m inh sơ'ngon inh gô pơma; inh gô ôr mưh jơhngơ̆m inh pơmat dêh.

English: Am I a sea, or a sea serpent, That You set a guard over me?
Bahnar: Inh hăm trŏ kơ đak dơsĭ Tih, dah 'bih Prao lăm đak dơsĭ jrŭ, Na Ih mah wei gak inh?

English: When I say, ‘My bed will comfort me, My couch will ease my complaint,’
Bahnar: Mưh inh tơchĕng, giơng inh gô pơlung inh, kơplah inh 'bĭch inh hiôk jơhngơ̆m dă 'biơ̆ tơtok

English: Then You scare me with dreams And terrify me with visions
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Ih gô pơm kơ inh hli lăm tơdrong apo, hli tơrơ krưp lăm tơdrong inh 'bôh.

English: So that my soul chooses strangling And death rather than my body.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m jah đe ket hơlŏng inh kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m, jah lôch 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ arih lăm kơting akâu âu.

English: I loathe my life; I would not live forever. Let me alone, For my days are but a breath.
Bahnar: Inh đĭ hăl bơih tơdrong arih inh; Inh đĭ ưh pă 'maih arih bơih. Apinh ih 'nĕ pă hiơ̆k kơ inh, yua kơ chăl arih âu thoi minh hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m đĕch.”

English: “What is man, that You should exalt him, That You should set Your heart on him
Bahnar: “Kon bơngai noh kiơ Ih mă gĭt kơ sư, Ih mah 'blŏk tơchĕng kơ sư

English: That You should visit him every morning, And test him every moment?
Bahnar: păng lăng hơlen rim pơgê, pơlong lăng sư ling-lang?

English: How long? Will You not look away from me, And let me alone till I swallow my saliva?
Bahnar: Dĭng dang yơ mă Ih ưh pă lăng tơ inh. Jah lê̆ inh rơhơi jơhngơ̆m gơh luăn đak hai.

English: Have I sinned? What have I done to You, O watcher of men? Why have You set me as Your target, So that I am a burden to myself?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang mă wei-lăng kon bơngai, tơdah inh đei pơm yoch, inh hăm pơm kiơ kơ Ih? Liơ Ih pơjing inh pơm tơmam Ih prah pơđam? Liơ inh tă jing bơngai pơhiơ̆k Ih?

English: Why then do You not pardon my transgression, And take away my iniquity? For now I will lie down in the dust, And You will seek me diligently, But I will no longer be.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ Ih ưh kơ mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch inh păng huay pă jô̆ tơdrong yoch inh. Ưh pă đunh bơih inh gô 'bĭch lăm 'mui teh; Ih gô chơchă inh, mă-lei pă đei inh bơih.”

English: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered and said
Bahnar: Bildat bơngai adrĕch Sua tơl Jop

English: “How long will you speak these things, And the words of your mouth be like a strong wind?
Bahnar: “Ih oei pơma thoi noh dĭng dang yơ? Nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng lăm 'bơ̆r ih thoi kial hơbŭt.

English: Does God subvert judgment? Or does the Almighty pervert justice?
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm lah pơm pơđŏng lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt? Dah Tơ'ngla Mơsêh Mơyang Tih Hloh pơm pơglăi lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt?

English: If your sons have sinned against Him, He has cast them away for their transgression.
Bahnar: Kon hơ'lơ̆p ih đei pơm yoch boih hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Kră Yang ăn kơ lu đe noh pŭ iŏk pơmat, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: If you would earnestly seek God And make your supplication to the Almighty
Bahnar: Gah ih, tơdah ih chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, păng krao apinh Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: If you were pure and upright, Surely now He would awake for you, And prosper your rightful dwelling place.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih rơgoh păng 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, sĭt tơpă Sư gô dŏng pơklaih ih, păng Sư gô tơiung dơ̆ng hnam dơnŏ, păng mŭk tơmam ih, wă apah kơ tơdrong ih tơpăt.

English: Though your beginning was small, Yet your latter end would increase abundantly.
Bahnar: Dang ei ih oei iĕ, dôm tơmam ih đei sơ̆ oei tŏ sĕt, mă-lei ning-mônh ih gô mơdrŏng tih tơpă.

English: “For inquire, please, of the former age, And consider the things discovered by their fathers
Bahnar: “Inh apinh ih hŏk iŏk lu bơngai jơhnơr adrol sơ̆, Chă lăng hơlen bĕ dôm tơdrong lu sư chă 'bôh sơ̆

English: For we were born yesterday, and know nothing, Because our days on earth are a shadow.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơ̆n bơngai nge 'nao brei tam băt tơdrong kiơ. Păng chăl arih bơ̆n kơpal teh hloh hlôi kuăng thoi yơ̆p.

English: Will they not teach you and tell you, And utter words from their heart?
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu 'bok kră sơ̆ lu sư gô bơtho tơ'bôh kơ ih, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong kiơ đêl lu sư băt hlôh

English: “Can the papyrus grow up without a marsh? Can the reeds flourish without water?
Bahnar: 'Nhĕt trang hăm gơh chăt tơ anih ưh kơ đei đak? 'Long pơm hla bơar hăm gơh chăt tơ anih ưh kơ đei trâp?

English: While it is yet green and not cut down, It withers before any other plant.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei pơkao, đe ưh tam mă koh ôh, lu sư gô jô kro 'bônh hloh kơ lu 'nhĕt nai tơdah ưh kơ đei đak.

English: So are the paths of all who forget God; And the hope of the hypocrite shall perish
Bahnar: Noh bơih tơdrong truh kơ lu bơngai mă sơngah kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; lu bơngai mă ưh kơ lui tơdrong hơmĕng lu sư hiong đĭ.

English: Whose confidence shall be cut off, And whose trust is a spider’s web.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ mă lu sư lui gơnang kơtĕch boih, nhen thoi lu sư gơnang kơ wai dŭng.

English: He leans on his house, but it does not stand. He holds it fast, but it does not endure.
Bahnar: Sư gơnang kơ hnam sư mă-lei hnam ưh kơ kĕ kơ dơ̆ng ôh; lu sư rôp pơjăng kơ hnam, kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ kơ iung.

English: He grows green in the sun, And his branches spread out in his garden.
Bahnar: Lu sư nhen 'long chăt hơdrih ala măt 'năr. Bluh tơmơ̆ng chăt jơ̆p kơ pơgar.

English: His roots wrap around the rock heap, And look for a place in the stones.
Bahnar: Rơh sư chăt kuăr tăp kơ tơmo, chăt kơchâu lăm tơmo.

English: If he is destroyed from his place, Then it will deny him, saying, ‘I have not seen you.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah buch sư đơ̆ng anih sư chăt. Anih noh gô sơngah, khan, inh ưh tam layơ 'bôh sư.

English: “Behold, this is the joy of His way, And out of the earth others will grow.
Bahnar: To tơdrong arih chơt hiôk lu bơngai sơngah kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư jô kro tôch dang noh. Na 'nhĕt 'long nai gô chăt đêl anih sư.

English: Behold, God will not cast away the blameless, Nor will He uphold the evildoers.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ achăng lê̆ ôh lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Kŭm ưh kơ wă tơgŭm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: He will yet fill your mouth with laughing, And your lips with rejoicing.
Bahnar: Sư gô ăn kơ 'bơ̆r ih hiĕk chơt păng hơkŭng ih gô jreo chơt hiôk 'nă hal.

English: Those who hate you will be clothed with shame, And the dwelling place of the wicked will come to nothing.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai areh kơ ih gô kơdơ̆ mơlâu. Bơsŭn lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô răm đĭ.”

English: Then Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl khan

English: “Truly I know it is so, But how can a man be righteous before God?
Bahnar: Inh băt sĭt tơdrong noh trŏ; Mă-lei kon bơngai liơ gơh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei?

English: If one wished to contend with Him, He could not answer Him one time out of a thousand.
Bahnar: Tơdah wă pơjah hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư jet rơbâu nơ̆r ưh kơ đei bu gơh tơl minh nơ̆r

English: God is wise in heart and mighty in strength. Who has hardened himself against Him and prospered?
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơsêh păng hơgei, hăm đei bu kĕ pơjah pơjăng hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei na jei sư?

English: He removes the mountains, and they do not know When He overturns them in His anger
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hiŏng kông, kông ưh kơ băt adrol, lăm năr Sư hil Sư bơlih plơ̆ lê̆ kông.

English: He shakes the earth out of its place, And its pillars tremble
Bahnar: Sư gơgŭ teh đơ̆ng hơnă sư, jrăng tơjră sư pơpơ̆ gĭl-gŭl

English: He commands the sun, and it does not rise; He seals off the stars
Bahnar: Sư tơtă kơ măt 'năr 'nĕ kơ lĕch Sư găn lê̆ lu sơnglŏng

English: He alone spreads out the heavens, And treads on the waves of the sea
Bahnar: Minh 'nu Sư đĕch bơlang plĕnh Păng dơ̆ng juă kơpal đak dơsĭ poh-yă.

English: He made the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades, And the chambers of the south
Bahnar: Sư pơjing kơ sơnglŏng Klang-giônga păng sơnglŏng Tung yăb. Hơnglŏng hơdrŭng iĕrc păng khŭl jơ'bôt sơnglŏng gah gơal.d

English: He does great things past finding out, Yes, wonders without number.
Bahnar: Sư pơm lu tơdrong tih-tin ưh kơ đei bu kĕ băt, tơdrong hlĭch chrơp bu kĕ jô̆.

English: If He goes by me, I do not see Him; If He moves past, I do not perceive Him
Bahnar: Dah Sư năm rok cheng inh, inh ưh kơ 'bôh Sư, dah Sư yak brih inh kư̆m ưh kơ kơnăl.

English: If He takes away, who can hinder Him? Who can say to Him, ‘What are You doing?’
Bahnar: Tơdah Sư tơgar pleh đơ̆ng bu, bu pơ̆n khă Sư? Bu pơ̆n khan kơ Sư, “Ih pơm kiơ thoi noh?”

English: God will not withdraw His anger, The allies of the proud lie prostrate beneath Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei lê̆ ôh tơdrong Sư hil; Lu bơngai tơgŭm Rahape bon drap ala jơ̆ng Sư.

English: “How then can I answer Him, And choose my words to reason with Him?
Bahnar: Thoi noh liơ inh gơh tơl nơ̆r Sư? Inh wă gơh rơih nơ̆r ayơ tơl Sư?

English: For though I were righteous, I could not answer Him; I would beg mercy of my Judge.
Bahnar: Mă inh rơgoh huay kơ yoch kư̆m ưh kơ gơh pơma dŏng dih kâu, Inh lăp apinh mơnat đĕch đơ̆ng Tơ'ngla sek tơlang inh.

English: If I called and He answered me, I would not believe that He was listening to my voice.
Bahnar: Mă Sư tơl nơ̆r inh krao apinh, inh kư̆m oei ưh kơ ngeh Sư mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh

English: For He crushes me with a tempest, And multiplies my wounds without cause.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kial hơbŭt tơpơ̆k inh, păng pơm kơ rơka rai să tơdrong kơ đei.

English: He will not allow me to catch my breath, But fills me with bitterness.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ ăn kơ inh hơya chă kial dui jơhngơ̆m, mă-lei roi ăn kơ inh sơ'ngon rai dêh.

English: If it is a matter of strength, indeed He is strong; And if of justice, who will appoint my day in court?
Bahnar: Dah pơlong lăng jơhngơ̆m pran, jei Sư! Tơdah gơnang tơdrong trŏ lăp, bu pơ̆n kêng sư?

English: Though I were righteous, my own mouth would condemn me; Though I were blameless, it would prove me perverse.
Bahnar: Mă khan inh bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt huay kơ yoch. Nơ̆r lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh gô jô̆ inh yoch; mă khan inh bơngai tơpăt Sư gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh đŏng đĕo.

English: “I am blameless, yet I do not know myself; I despise my life.
Bahnar: Inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, mă-lei inh khan kơdih ưh kơ yua kiơ; inh areh kơ tơdrong arih inh.

English: It is all one thing; Therefore I say, ‘He destroys the blameless and the wicked.’
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai lei-lăi đĕch; na inh khan, Sư pơrăm bơngai tơpăt hăm bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: If the scourge slays suddenly, He laughs at the plight of the innocent.
Bahnar: Mưh đei tơdrong truh pơlôch pơrăm ưh kơ tam băt. Sư hiĕk ăr kơ bơngai ưh kơ đei yoch.

English: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covers the faces of its judges. If it is not He, who else could it be?
Bahnar: Kơplah teh đak jao bơih kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơgơ̆r. Sư chĭt lê̆ măt lu 'bok sek tơlang lăm teh đak. Tơdah ưh kơ trŏ Sư pơm lei bu pơm?

English: “Now my days are swifter than a runner; They flee away, they see no good.
Bahnar: Năr chăl arih inh năm hrĕnh hloh kơ bơngai kơdâu năm roi tơbăt, Lu năr chăl arih inh kơdâu ôn bơih ưh kơ đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk.

English: They pass by like swift ships, Like an eagle swooping on its prey.
Bahnar: Lu sư bah kuăng thoi plŭng tanh kram, thoi klang bruh rôp sa sem.

English: If I say, ‘I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad face and wear a smile,’
Bahnar: Tơdah inh khan kơdih. “Inh ưh pă ôr tơtok bơih, inh gô pơm tơ'bôh muh măt oei hiôk hiĕk chơt.”

English: I am afraid of all my sufferings; I know that You will not hold me innocent.
Bahnar: Inh hli kơ oei pŭ dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat inh, yua kơ inh băt, Ih ưh kơ jô̆ inh bơngai tơpăt

English: If I am condemned, Why then do I labor in vain?
Bahnar: Tơdah Kră Yang oei jô̆ inh yoch, lei liơ oei nŏng kơ ming hơmet ưh kơ yua kiơ?

English: If I wash myself with snow water, And cleanse my hands with soap
Bahnar: Mă khan inh hum hơpĕch hăm 'bŏng, păng ôp ti inh păng tơnuh.

English: Yet You will plunge me into the pit, And my own clothes will abhor me.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m oei tơhuŏng inh lăm sơlŭng. Dĭng mah ao inh lăng inh 'mê̆ krưp.

English: “For He is not a man, as I am, That I may answer Him, And that we should go to court together.
Bahnar: Tơpă, Sư ưh kơ trŏ kon bơngai thoi inh, Wă kơ inh gơh tơl Sư; Wă kơ nhi gơh năm hơdai tơ anih sek tơlang.

English: Nor is there any mediator between us, Who may lay his hand on us both.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ đei bu dơ̆ng sơlam sek kơ nhi. Đei gơh sek pơđĭ 'bar pah ba.

English: Let Him take His rod away from me, And do not let dread of Him terrify me.
Bahnar: Noh boih na mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iŏk lê̆ 'long băl wă teh đơ̆ng kơdŭ rŏng inh, wă kơ inh huay pă hli tơrơ kơ Sư dơ̆ng.

English: Then I would speak and not fear Him, But it is not so with me.
Bahnar: Lei na inh gơh pơma dơnuh hăm Sư, huay pă hli bơih, yua kơ inh ưh kơ gơh pơm thoi noh ôh dang ei.

English: “My soul loathes my life; I will give free course to my complaint, I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
Bahnar: Inh hăl dêh kơ tơdrong arih inh; Na inh gô tơtok ưh kơ hli; Inh gô roi pơma kơ tơdrong, jơhngơ̆m inh chhŭr nuih.

English: I will say to God, ‘Do not condemn me; Show me why You contend with me.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'nĕ pă jô̆ inh bơngai yoch; Ăn kơ inh băt Ih jô̆ inh đei yoch kiơ.

English: Does it seem good to You that You should oppress, That You should despise the work of Your hands, And smile on the counsel of the wicked?
Bahnar: Ih hăm lăp wă pơjuă pơrăm inh, wă achăng lê̆ inh đơ̆ng ti Ih pơjing, Na hiôk iŏk tơdrong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ wă pơm hă?

English: Do You have eyes of flesh? Or do You see as man sees?
Bahnar: Ih đei măt thoi kon bơngai hă, lăng 'bôh thoi kon bơngai lăm teh đak?

English: Are Your days like the days of a mortal man? Are Your years like the days of a mighty man
Bahnar: Ih arih lăp minh 'bar 'năr thoi kon bơngai mơ̆n Dah lăp minh 'bar sơnăm thoi kon bơngai.

English: That You should seek for my iniquity And search out my sin
Bahnar: Dĭng Ih mah chơchă tơdrong yoch inh, păng chă pơpơih tơdrong glăi inh.

English: Although You know that I am not wicked, And there is no one who can deliver from Your hand?
Bahnar: Mă khan Ih băt kơ inh ưh kơ yoch ră, ưh kơ đei bu gơh dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng ti Ih.

English: ‘Your hands have made me and fashioned me, An intricate unity; Yet You would destroy me.
Bahnar: Tơpang ti Ih bơih man pơjing inh, Mă-lei dang ei ti Ih wih pơrăm inh.

English: Remember, I pray, that You have made me like clay. And will You turn me into dust again?
Bahnar: 'Blŏk bĕ kơ Ih man pơjing inh thoi đe man gŏ teh; Lei ih wă pơdrâu inh tơ 'mui teh dơ̆ng hă?

English: Did You not pour me out like milk, And curdle me like cheese
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Ih wă hling inh thoi đak toh tơ lăm klak mĕ inh. Na inh kơtuăl jing nge thoi 'bĕng tơpei đak toh 'nhŭ?

English: Clothe me with skin and flesh, And knit me together with bones and sinews?
Bahnar: Ih pơhrŭk ăn kơ inh sĕch păng akar, na tanh inh hơbĭ hơdai hăm kơting păng huan.

English: You have granted me life and favor, And Your care has preserved my spirit.
Bahnar: Ih ăn bơih kơ inh đei tơdrong arih Ih 'mêm kơ inh hăm tơdrong 'mêm kơjăp sĭt, Ih wei-lăng rong ba tơdrong arih inh

English: ‘And these things You have hidden in Your heart; I know that this was with You
Bahnar: Mă khan lei ră, Ih ôn hlơp tơdrong 'nâu lăm jơhngơ̆m Ih, inh băt Ih wă pơm tơdrong 'nâu.

English: If I sin, then You mark me, And will not acquit me of my iniquity.
Bahnar: Ih răp lăng inh hăm đei pơm yoch. Ih ưh kơ mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch inh.

English: If I am wicked, woe to me; Even if I am righteous, I cannot lift up my head. I am full of disgrace; See my misery!
Bahnar: Tơdah inh pơm kơnê̆, răm-'băm tơpă kơ inh! Mă-lei tơdah inh pơm trŏ 'lơ̆ng, inh kư̆m ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk kơ̆l, yua kơ inh 'bĕnh kơ mơlâu, tơchĕng kơ tơdrong pơmat-tat inh.

English: If my head is exalted, You hunt me like a fierce lion, And again You show Yourself awesome against me.
Bahnar: Tơdah inh pơang, Ih gô druh prah inh thoi dăm-brang, Ih gô pơm mơsêh hlĭch chrơp wă pơrăm inh.

English: You renew Your witnesses against me, And increase Your indignation toward me; Changes and war are ever with me.
Bahnar: Ih đei lơ tơdrong plơ̆ng wă pơm kơ inh, tơdrong Ih hil kơ inh rai dêh Thoi khŭl linh plơ̆ng tơplih băl blah inh.

English: ‘Why then have You brought me out of the womb? Oh, that I had perished and no eye had seen me!
Bahnar: Liơ Ih ăn kơ inh lĕch đơ̆ng klak mĕ inh? 'Lơ̆ng hloh kơ inh lôch 'bơ̆t đe tam mă 'bôh inh

English: I would have been as though I had not been. I would have been carried from the womb to the grave.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ inh jah lôch hloi huay kơ đei arih, lăp hlôi đơ̆ng mĕ inh jur hloi lăm bơsat

English: Are not my days few? Cease! Leave me alone, that I may take a little comfort
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ inh arih tŏ sĕt năr đĕch? Weh bĕ đơ̆ng inh, wă kơ inh đei hiôk 'biơ̆.

English: Before I go to the place from which I shall not return, To the land of darkness and the shadow of death
Bahnar: Adrol kơ inh năm ưh pă đei brŏk dơ̆ng, năm tơ anih măng mu găm, măng klăm hơ'bơ̆l.

English: A land as dark as darkness itself, As the shadow of death, without any order, Where even the light is like darkness.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơ anih măng mu găm, măng klăm tơdrong rŭng, anih noh ưh kơ hơdah, măng mu đĕch.

English: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered and said
Bahnar: Sôphar, bơngai Naama tơl Jop

English: “Should not the multitude of words be answered? And should a man full of talk be vindicated?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ ưh pă gơh tơl dơ̆ng bơih nơ̆r pơma noh? Bơngai 'bơ̆r hơchĕm na jei sư ngăl hah?

English: Should your empty talk make men hold their peace? And when you mock, should no one rebuke you?
Bahnar: Ih pơma kư̆ kă hăm pơm kơ đe ngăn đĕch? Wă ưh kơ đei bu chrih kơ ih, mưh ih chă pơjăm đe.

English: For you have said, ‘My doctrine is pure, And I am clean in your eyes.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: “Tơdrong lui inh trŏ; păng inh rơgoh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: But oh, that God would speak, And open His lips against you
Bahnar: Ô! Rŏ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô bơtho khan kơ ih: Păng pơma bơtho ih

English: That He would show you the secrets of wisdom! For they would double your prudence. Know therefore that God exacts from you Less than your iniquity deserves.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ Sư tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih băt tôm tơdrong hlơp gah tơdrong hơgei. Yua kơ Sư hlôh băt tôm tơdrong mă bơngai ưh kơ gơh hlôh. Thoi noh, ih gô băt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei phak ih ưh kơ mah dang tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ ih pơm.

English: “Can you search out the deep things of God? Can you find out the limits of the Almighty?
Bahnar: Ih hăm kĕ hlôh băt tơdrong jrŭ hlĭch Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Păng băt tôch hơđăl kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh?

English: They are higher than heaven— what can you do? Deeper than Sheol— what can you know?
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơgei Kră Yang kơjung hloh kơ plĕnh Na ih gơh pơm kiơ? Tơdrong hơgei Sư jrŭ hloh kơ pơlei lôch, na liơ ih kĕ băt?

English: Their measure is longer than the earth And broader than the sea.
Bahnar: Kơjung hloh kơ teh păng să hloh kơ đak dơsĭ.

English: “If He passes by, imprisons, and gathers to judgment, Then who can hinder Him?
Bahnar: Tơdah Sư năm brih, rôp ih pơm bơnă, păng sek tơlang, lei bu gơh găn khă Sư?

English: For He knows deceitful men; He sees wickedness also. Will He not then consider it?
Bahnar: Sư băt kơ lu bơngai hơlĕnh, lăng 'bôh đĭ tơdrong yoch, Lei Sư ưh kơ băt hơđăl hă?

English: For an empty-headed man will be wise, When a wild donkey’s colt is born a man.
Bahnar: Mưh bơngai kơtul gơh jing bơngai hơgei. Lei aseh bri gơh tuh kon sư jing bơngai.

English: “If you would prepare your heart, And stretch out your hands toward Him
Bahnar: Na, dah ih hơmet jơhngơ̆m chă Kră Yang. Păng yơ̆r ti ih gah Sư

English: If iniquity were in your hand, and you put it far away, And would not let wickedness dwell in your tents
Bahnar: Dah đei tơdrong yoch lăm ti ih, athei tơbral hŭt lê̆ ataih; ưh kơ lê̆ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ oei lăm bơsŭn ih

English: Then surely you could lift up your face without spot; Yes, you could be steadfast, and not fear
Bahnar: Lei ih gô ngơk muh măt ih huay kơ mơlâu, ih gô dơ̆ng kơjăp, huay pă hli.

English: Because you would forget your misery, And remember it as waters that have passed away
Bahnar: Ih gô hiơt kơ dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat ih, ưh kơ 'blŏk kơ tơdrong 'noh thoi đak ro hlôi bơih.

English: And your life would be brighter than noonday. Though you were dark, you would be like the morning.
Bahnar: Chăl arih ih gô hơdah hơdong hloh kơ 'năr dơ̆ng; măng mu gô hơdah thoi pơgê.

English: And you would be secure, because there is hope; Yes, you would dig around you, and take your rest in safety.
Bahnar: Ih gô arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng, yua kơ ih đei tơdrong chang hơmĕng; Ih gô chă đei gơnang, Kră Yang wei-lăng ih păng pơdơh gô tep hiôk hơđơ̆ng.

English: You would also lie down, and no one would make you afraid; Yes, many would court your favor.
Bahnar: Ih gô 'bĭch tep ưh kơ đei bu pơm kơ ih hli tơrơ, lơ bơngai gô chă ih wă kơ ih tơgŭm lu sư đei pŭn hiôk.

English: But the eyes of the wicked will fail, And they shall not escape, And their hope—loss of life!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô lap rơgah; sư pă đei trong wă kơdâu ôn, păng tơdrong lu sư chang hơmĕng noh lăp gô kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m đĕch.

English: Then Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl

English: “No doubt you are the people, And wisdom will die with you!
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ngeh lu iĕm bơngai hơgei, Mưh lu iĕm lôch tơdrong hơgei gô hiong hơdai lu iĕm mơ̆n.

English: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you. Indeed, who does not know such things as these?
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh kư̆m hơgei thoi lu iĕm. Inh ưh kơ lŭch kơ lu iĕm ôh; bu mă ưh kơ băt tơdrong iĕm pơma.

English: “I am one mocked by his friends, Who called on God, and He answered him, The just and blameless who is ridiculed.
Bahnar: Inh jing bơngai chă pơhiĕk kơ bôl buăl. Mă khan inh đơ̆ng bơngai juăt krao khan apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng đei Sư tơl tơwih nơ̆r inh; Inh bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt tôm tơdrong đĭ jing bơngai đe hiĕk ăr.

English: A lamp is despised in the thought of one who is at ease; It is made ready for those whose feet slip.
Bahnar: Bơngai oei hiôk 'lơ̆ng pơjăm bơngai đei gleh truh. Bơngai bu tơpling jơ̆ng gô pơ̆k hloi.

English: The tents of robbers prosper, And those who provoke God are secure— In what God provides by His hand.
Bahnar: Bơsŭn lu bơngai tơgar jing mơdrŏng, Lu bơngai che bơle kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hiôk hơđơ̆ng lăm ti lu sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn đei mŭk tơmam rơkah rơkai.

English: “But now ask the beasts, and they will teach you; And the birds of the air, and they will tell you
Bahnar: Mă-lei apinh sem bri, lu sư gô bơtho pơhrăm kơ iĕm. Apinh lu sem păr, lu sư gô roi ăn kơ iĕm

English: Or speak to the earth, and it will teach you; And the fish of the sea will explain to you.
Bahnar: Dah ih pơma dơnuh hăm teh, teh gô bơtho tơ'bôh kơ iĕm. Hăm lu ka đak dơsĭ, lu sư gô roi pơdah ăn kơ iĕm băt.

English: Who among all these does not know That the hand of the LORD has done this
Bahnar: Lăm lu sem brem 'nâu, sem brem ayơ mă khan ưh kơ băt kơ đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm ngăl dôm tơmam 'noh?

English: In whose hand is the life of every living thing, And the breath of all mankind?
Bahnar: Sư chĕp lăm ti tơdrong arih lu sem brem noh păng kial dui jơhngơ̆m kơ kon bơngai.

English: Does not the ear test words And the mouth taste its food?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ đon băt hơlen nơ̆r pơma, thoi hơpiĕt băt liah tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng kơnê̆?

English: Wisdom is with aged men, And with length of days, understanding.
Bahnar: Bơngai kră jơnei đei tơdrong hơgei, bơngai arih sot đei tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: “With Him are wisdom and strength, He has counsel and understanding.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh hơgei păng Mơsêh Mơyang gơh băt păng hlôh wao.

English: If He breaks a thing down, it cannot be rebuilt; If He imprisons a man, there can be no release.
Bahnar: Sư pơrăm, ưh pă đei bu man pơdơ̆ng ming. Sư phak ưh pă đei bu gơh tơlĕch.

English: If He withholds the waters, they dry up; If He sends them out, they overwhelm the earth.
Bahnar: Sư bơ̆ găn lê̆ đak, đak glung hrơ̆ hrĕng hloi; Sư ăn 'mi đak lơ̆p kơ teh hloi

English: With Him are strength and prudence. The deceived and the deceiver are His.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pran kơtang păng hơgei lăm Sư. Lăm Sư ngăl lu bơngai wơ̆l jrok păng lu bơngai mă pơm kơ đe wơ̆l jrok

English: He leads counselors away plundered, And makes fools of the judges.
Bahnar: Sư rôp anhăk phak lu bơngai pơthơr pơm tơdrong kơnê̆. Pơm ăn kơ lu 'bok sek tơlang jing kơtul kơwao.

English: He loosens the bonds of kings, And binds their waist with a belt.
Bahnar: Sư yaih glang đêl lu pơtao chô̆. Păng tơ̆n kơpen tơ kơiĕng lu sư.

English: He leads princes away plundered, And overthrows the mighty.
Bahnar: Sư chông ba lu 'bok soi tơ nai, blơ̆ lê̆ lu bơngai pơm 'bok soi pơgơ̆r đunh.

English: He deprives the trusted ones of speech, And takes away the discernment of the elders.
Bahnar: Sư ăn 'bơ̆r bơngai mă đe gơnang kơmlo, păng iŏk lê̆ tơdrong hơgei đơ̆ng lu kră.

English: He pours contempt on princes, And disarms the mighty.
Bahnar: Sư tuh tơdrong chhŭr nuih kơpal lu bơngai tih mơng. Yaih tơlei tơ̆n đơ̆ng lu bơngai pran.

English: He uncovers deep things out of darkness, And brings the shadow of death to light.
Bahnar: Sư tơ'bôh ăn kơ dôm tơdrong hlơp pơm lăm măng mu. Pơm ăn kơ tơdrong pơm lăm măng mu jing hơdah đe 'bôh bang.

English: He makes nations great, and destroys them; He enlarges nations, and guides them.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ adrĕch adrung bơngai rai mơdrŏng, đơ̆ng noh pơlôch pơrăm lu sư, pơih ăn kơ lu teh đak rai să păng ăn kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang.a

English: He takes away the understanding of the chiefs of the people of the earth, And makes them wander in a pathless wilderness.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk lê̆ tơdrong hơgei đơ̆ng lu yŏng kơdră lăm tơring. Pơm kơ lu sư nơnăm wơ̆l kư̆ kă chă trong ưh kơ đei thoi lăm char glă.

English: They grope in the dark without light, And He makes them stagger like a drunken man.
Bahnar: Lu sư nơnăm chă jơjơ̆ lăm măng mu, ưh kơ đei hơdah, păng Kră Yang pơm kơ lu sư yak mơngưt mơngat thoi bơngai suai.

English: “Behold, my eye has seen all this, My ear has heard and understood it.
Bahnar: 'Nâu măt inh 'bôh bơih dôm tơdrong 'noh, Đon inh kơtơ̆ng păng hlôh mơ̆n.

English: What you know, I also know; I am not inferior to you.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m dai băt; Inh ưh kơ lŭch kơ iĕm ôh.

English: But I would speak to the Almighty, And I desire to reason with God.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh wă pơma hăm Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Inh hơpơi wă roi dŏng kơdih akâu hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: But you forgers of lies, You are all worthless physicians.
Bahnar: Bĕ iĕm, lu iĕm pik bah hăm nơ̆r hơlĕnh. Đĭ-đăng tă kơ 'bok thây pơgang ưh kơ lĕch kiơ.

English: Oh, that you would be silent, And it would be your wisdom!
Bahnar: Lei na iĕm ngăn ĕnh kơ pơma! Wă tơ'bôh kơ đe iĕm hơgei.

English: Now hear my reasoning, And heed the pleadings of my lips.
Bahnar: Apinh iĕm mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh pơma dŏng kơdih, wă kơ iĕm băt inh pơma trŏ. Athei mơ̆ng bĕ mă nhen nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh pơma dŏng kơdih.

English: Will you speak wickedly for God, And talk deceitfully for Him?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Na iĕm pơ̆n pơma hơlĕnh? Hăm trŏ yua kơ Sư iĕm pơma pơdăr hă?

English: Will you show partiality for Him? Will you contend for God?
Bahnar: Iĕm hăm wă pơdê Sư? Iĕm wă pơma dŏng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ah?

English: Will it be well when He searches you out? Or can you mock Him as one mocks a man?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm hăm đei apah bơnê tơdah Sư lăng lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm? Iĕm tơchĕng gơh hơlĕnh kơ Sư thoi hơlĕnh kơ kon bơngai hă?

English: He will surely rebuke you If you secretly show partiality.
Bahnar: Sư gô hil phak iĕm tơpă. Tơdah iĕm oei pơdê Sư, mă khan hlơp lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Will not His excellence make you afraid, And the dread of Him fall upon you?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ hli tơdrong mơsêh krưp Sư hă? Tơdrong mơsêh krưp đơ̆ng Sư ưh kơ wă pơm kơ lu iĕm hli hă?

English: Your platitudes are proverbs of ashes, Your defenses are defenses of clay.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơđơ̆k iĕm thoi 'mui tơnuh đĕch. Nơ̆r iĕm dŏng kơdih 'bônh tơgơ̆ thoi teh lơ̆n.

English: “Hold your peace with me, and let me speak, Then let come on me what may!
Bahnar: Ngăn bĕ, lê̆ inh pơma. Mă khan đei tơdrong thoi yơ inh pŭ.

English: Why do I take my flesh in my teeth, And put my life in my hands?
Bahnar: Liơ inh lê̆ akâu inh kơdih lăm tơdrong hli krưp, păng chĕp tơdrong arih inh lăm ti?

English: Though He slay me, yet will I trust Him. Even so, I will defend my own ways before Him.
Bahnar: Mă Kră Yang pơlôch inh, inh kư̆m oei gơnang kơ sư; Mă-lei inh oei dŏng tơdrong arih inh 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: He also shall be my salvation, For a hypocrite could not come before Him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh bơih wă dŏng pơklaih inh. Yua kơ lu bơngai ưh kơ lui ưh kơ pơ̆n năm 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: Listen carefully to my speech, And to my declaration with your ears.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei mơ̆ng mă nhen dôm nơ̆r inh pơma, Apinh iĕm pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh roi tơblang.

English: See now, I have prepared my case, I know that I shall be vindicated.
Bahnar: Inh đei hơmet bơih nơ̆r inh wă pơma dŏng, Inh băt tơpă gô jei inh.

English: Who is he who will contend with me? If now I hold my tongue, I perish.
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu wă pơjah hăm inh khan jei sư. Dah lei inh gô pơmơ̆ng ngăn gô lôch.

English: “Only two things do not do to me, Then I will not hide myself from You
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang ăn kơ inh 'bar tơdrong đĕch wă kơ inh huay kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng Ih.

English: Withdraw Your hand far from me, And let not the dread of You make me afraid.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih dui bĕ ti Ih ataih đơ̆ng inh, apinh Ih 'nĕ pă pơm kơ inh hli tơrơ kơ Ih dơ̆ng.

English: Then call, and I will answer; Or let me speak, then You respond to me.
Bahnar: Ih Krao inh bĕ, inh gô tơl tơwih, dah mă ăn inh pơma, na Ih gô tơl nơ̆r inh.

English: How many are my iniquities and sins? Make me know my transgression and my sin.
Bahnar: Inh đei pơm yoch kơnê̆ dôm yơ bơih? Apinh Ih tơbăt ăn kơ inh pơm glăi pơm yoch noh.

English: Why do You hide Your face, And regard me as Your enemy?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ Ih ôn muh măt đơ̆ng inh, Lăng inh thoi bơngai ayăt?

English: Will You frighten a leaf driven to and fro? And will You pursue dry stubble?
Bahnar: Ih hăm wă pơm tơhli inh thoi hla mă kial pơđông bơih, păng druh rôp hơnong 'ba kro ưh?

English: For You write bitter things against me, And make me inherit the iniquities of my youth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih phak bơih inh pŭ pơmat, păng ăn kơ inh pŭ dôm tơdrong yoch mă inh pơm kơplah oei tơdăm sơ̆.

English: You put my feet in the stocks, And watch closely all my paths. You set a limit for the soles of my feet.
Bahnar: Ih hơnuh bơih jơ̆ng inh kiơ̆ wei dôm trong mă inh yak năm păng 'moi kiơ̆ đêl jơ̆ng inh yak.

English: “Man decays like a rotten thing, Like a garment that is moth-eaten.
Bahnar: Na lăm inh thoi akâu bơngai ôm răm, thoi ao mua reh hiah hiot bơih.

English: “Man who is born of woman Is of few days and full of trouble.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai đơ̆ng bơngai drŏ-kăn rơneh, arih 'nao tŏ sĕt năr đĕch ră, mă-lei 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: He comes forth like a flower and fades away; He flees like a shadow and does not continue.
Bahnar: Chăl arih kon bơngai thoi pơkao, pơgê tơlang kơsơ̆ jô kro, Sư hloh hlôi thoi ngôi, ưh kơ dơ̆ng.

English: And do You open Your eyes on such a one, And bring me to judgment with Yourself?
Bahnar: Mă khan thoi ei, măt Ih oei kiơ̆ lăng bơngai thoi noh, păng chông ba inh 'bơ̆t anăp Ih wă sek tơlang 'mơ̆i hă?

English: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? No one!
Bahnar: Bu gơh pơm đơ̆ng bơngai pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach mă jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh? Ưh kơ đei bu!

English: Since his days are determined, The number of his months is with You; You have appointed his limits, so that he cannot pass.
Bahnar: Khei 'năr kon bơngai arih Kră Yang đĭ hơgăt lê̆ bơih. Kră Yang băt đĭ kơsô̆ khei 'năr sư arih Kră Yang hơgăt lê̆ bơih năr tôch sư, lei sư ưh kơ gơh arih hloh kơ năr noh.

English: Look away from him that he may rest, Till like a hired man he finishes his day.
Bahnar: Thoi noh apinh Kră Yang lê̆ pă lăng tơ sư, lê̆ sư hiôk 'biơ̆, Wă kơ sư chơt hiôk lăm năr sư oei arih thoi bơngai jang đei apah.

English: “For there is hope for a tree, If it is cut down, that it will sprout again, And that its tender shoots will not cease.
Bahnar: Lu tơnơm 'long đe kăl bơih, kư̆m oei hơmĕng kơ wă bluh dơ̆ng, Tơnơm sư gô chăt bluh tơmơ̆ng dơ̆ng

English: Though its root may grow old in the earth, And its stump may die in the ground
Bahnar: Mă khan rơh sư rai kră lăm teh. Tơm sư lôch kro tơ lăm teh.

English: Yet at the scent of water it will bud And bring forth branches like a plant.
Bahnar: Mưh đei hơyuh đak, sư gô chăt tơ'biĕng, păng bluh dơ̆ng thoi minh tơnơm 'long.

English: But man dies and is laid away; Indeed he breathes his last And where is he?
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon bơngai dah lôch bơih, pă đei kiơ, kon bơngai kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m năm tơ yơ?

English: As water disappears from the sea, And a river becomes parched and dries up
Bahnar: Thoi đak dơnâu hơyuh păr đông, thoi đak glung hrơ̆ păng hrĕng kro.

English: So man lies down and does not rise. Till the heavens are no more, They will not awake Nor be roused from their sleep.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai lôch bơih ưh pă arih dơ̆ng. Dĭng truh tơ plĕnh teh ưh pă đei kon bơngai kư̆m tam mă iung arih 'mơ̆i. Ưh kơ đei bu mă gơh râu tơiung sư đơ̆ng lôch.

English: “Oh, that You would hide me in the grave, That You would conceal me until Your wrath is past, That You would appoint me a set time, and remember me!
Bahnar: Hơpơi rŏ kơ Ih ôn inh tơ lăm bơsat klơ̆p ôn inh dĭng truh tơblĕk Ih ngach 'mơ̆i, Truh jơ 'năr đêl hơgăt kơ inh, apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ inh dơ̆ng!

English: If a man dies, shall he live again? All the days of my hard service I will wait, Till my change comes.
Bahnar: Bơngai lôch, hăm gơh iung arih dơ̆ng? Đĭ-đăng năr jang gleh glăn inh, inh răp gô tơ̆p mă inh gơh lĕch.

English: You shall call, and I will answer You; You shall desire the work of Your hands.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang gô krao, inh gô tơl; Ih gô 'blŏk mơnat mơ̆n kơ inh đơ̆ng ti Ih đei pơjing bơih.

English: For now You number my steps, But do not watch over my sin.
Bahnar: Ih gô jô̆ dôm kơnao jơ̆ng inh yak năm. Mă-lei ưh pă jô̆ đêl yoch inh pơm.

English: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, And You cover my iniquity.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch inh Ih pơklep pơsir lê̆ lăm kơdŭng, Ih đơ̆p lê̆ tơdrong yoch inh

English: “But as a mountain falls and crumbles away, And as a rock is moved from its place
Bahnar: Mă-lei thoi kông hơlih pơchah bru bra, păng thoi tơmo grŏl đơ̆ng anih sư tơ nai.

English: As water wears away stones, And as torrents wash away the soil of the earth; So You destroy the hope of man.
Bahnar: Đak ro pơm kơ tơmo huach. Đak lơ̆p koch pơđĭ teh. Ih pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong hơmĕng kon bơngai thoi noh.

English: You prevail forever against him, and he passes on; You change his countenance and send him away.
Bahnar: Jei Ih pă minh 'măng tôm bơih, na sư jăk hiong tơ nai. Ih tơplih muh măt sư păng puh tơweh sư.

English: His sons come to honor, and he does not know it; They are brought low, and he does not perceive it.
Bahnar: Dah lu kon tơdăm sư đe pơyom, sư kư̆m ưh kơ băt; Dah đe pơjăm lu sư, sư kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh.

English: But his flesh will be in pain over it, And his soul will mourn over it.”
Bahnar: Sư hơtŏk băt băi kơ jĭ jăn kơdih akâu sư đĕch păng băt sơ'ngon pơmat kơdih akâu sư đĕch mơ̆n.

English: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said
Bahnar: Êliphas, bơngai Thêman, tơl

English: “Should a wise man answer with empty knowledge, And fill himself with the east wind?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ ih bơngai hơgei mă-lei tơl hăm nơ̆r hlôh wao mă ưh kơ yua kiơ. Păng klak 'bĕnh kơ kial hơbŭt đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch?

English: Should he reason with unprofitable talk, Or by speeches with which he can do no good?
Bahnar: Sư hăm gơh iŏk nơ̆r ưh kơ yua mă chă pơlăp Iŏk nơ̆r ưh kơ yua wă dŏng sư kơdih hă?

English: Yes, you cast off fear, And restrain prayer before God.
Bahnar: Tơpă ih pơm kơ bơngai tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Lăng ưh kơ hiơ̆k tơdrong tơchĕng pơwao 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: For your iniquity teaches your mouth, And you choose the tongue of the crafty.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch ih bơtho ăn kơ 'bơ̆r ih pơma, pơm kơ ih rơih iŏk hơpiĕt lu bơngai hơlĕnh bơkuĕch.

English: Your own mouth condemns you, and not I; Yes, your own lips testify against you.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r ih kơdih jâu ih yoch, ưh kơ sĭ kơ inh ôh; Hơkŭng ih pơm kơdranh tơ'bôh plơ̆ kơ ih.

English: “Are you the first man who was born? Or were you made before the hills?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ tơpŭ đei ih adrol hloh? Hăm trŏ kơ pơjing ih adrol kơ kông kŏ.

English: Have you heard the counsel of God? Do you limit wisdom to yourself?
Bahnar: Ih hăm mơ̆ng lăm tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơđâu? Hăm trŏ kơ minh 'nu ih đĕch gơh hơgei?

English: What do you know that we do not know? What do you understand that is not in us?
Bahnar: Đei tơdrong kiơ ih băt khan nhôn ưh kơ băt? Đei tơdrong kiơ ih hlôh khan nhôn ưh kơ hlôh?

English: Both the gray-haired and the aged are among us, Much older than your father.
Bahnar: Lăm lu nhôn âu đei bơngai sŏk ko, bơngai kră krŭng sơnăm đĭ lơ hloh kơ 'bă ih.

English: Are the consolations of God too small for you, And the word spoken gently with you?
Bahnar: Tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlung ih, Nơ̆r Sư pơma bơtho rơngơp hiôk ih mơ̆ng tam mă tôm hă?

English: Why does your heart carry you away, And what do your eyes wink at
Bahnar: Liơ đon ih tơchĕng thoi noh? Liơ măt ih bơbul lăng ưh kơ 'bôh?a

English: That you turn your spirit against God, And let such words go out of your mouth?
Bahnar: Liơ ih mah pơ̆n hil plơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, păng 'bơ̆r ih mah lĕch nơ̆r thoi noh pơma blah sư?

English: “What is man, that he could be pure? And he who is born of a woman, that he could be righteous?
Bahnar: Kon bơngai kiơ, mă gơh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh? Kon bơngai đơ̆ng drŏ-kăn rơneh liơ gơh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt?

English: If God puts no trust in His saints, And the heavens are not pure in His sight
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ưh kơ ngeh, mă lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư. Lu linh jang Sư lăng kư̆m oei jô̆ glăi.

English: How much less man, who is abominable and filthy, Who drinks iniquity like water!
Bahnar: Pơma kiơ kơ kon bơngai kơnê̆ yoch păng răm-'băm, Bơngai juăt kơ pơm yoch kơnê̆ thoi lu sư nhă đak 'blăng.

English: “I will tell you, hear me; What I have seen I will declare
Bahnar: Inh wă bơtho tơ'bôh kơ ih, apinh ih mơ̆ng inh; Inh gô roi kơ ih dôm tơdrong inh 'bôh bơih

English: What wise men have told, Not hiding anything received from their fathers
Bahnar: Tơdrong lu bơngai hơgei tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh, ưh kơ ôn ôh dôm tơdrong kiơ mă sư pơhrăm đơ̆ng 'bok lu sư

English: To whom alone the land was given, And no alien passed among them
Bahnar: Dêh char âu đei ăn đĕch kơ lu sư bơih, ưh kơ đei bơngai tơmoi ayơ gơh mơ̆t oei lăm khŭl sư.

English: The wicked man writhes with pain all his days, And the number of years is hidden from the oppressor.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ tơ'bơ̆p jĭ jăn pơmat-tat, dĭng đĭ chăl arih sư. Lăm đĭ sơnăm wă 'măn kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ oei arih đei pơmat-tat.

English: Dreadful sounds are in his ears; In prosperity the destroyer comes upon him.
Bahnar: Sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ôr hli ling-lang lăm đon; kơplah oei hiôk-hian, lu bơngai chă pơlôch pơrăm truh.

English: He does not believe that he will return from darkness, For a sword is waiting for him.
Bahnar: Ưh pă đei hơmĕng gơh klaih hlôi đơ̆ng tơdrong lôch, bơngai chĕp đao gưm răp pơlôch sư.

English: He wanders about for bread, saying, ‘Where is it?’ He knows that a day of darkness is ready at his hand.
Bahnar: Sư hoang tơ âu tơ to wă chă tơmam sa, khan tơmam sa tơ yơ. Sư băt kơ năr tơdrong răm wă jê̆

English: Trouble and anguish make him afraid; They overpower him, like a king ready for battle.
Bahnar: Sư hli tơrơ tơdrong pơmat-tat ơh sơ'ngon wă truh, Tŭn drŭt sư thoi pơtao pran kơtang wă tơblah.

English: For he stretches out his hand against God, And acts defiantly against the Almighty
Bahnar: Noh yua kơ sư yơ̆r ti blah plơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Pơm thoi nuih pran wă tơblah Kră Yang mă Mơsêh Mơyang tih.

English: Running stubbornly against Him With his strong, embossed shield.
Bahnar: Năm kơdâu bruh tơ̆m tơ Kră Yang hăm khêl hơ'bơ̆l, arăng.

English: “Though he has covered his face with his fatness, And made his waist heavy with fat
Bahnar: Mă khan muh măt sư bek, Klak kơiĕng sư tih.

English: He dwells in desolate cities, In houses which no one inhabits, Which are destined to become ruins.
Bahnar: Sư gô oei tơ lăm pơlei mă đe pơrăm bơih, tơ lăm hnam juơ, hnam rơ̆m rĕk ưh kơ đei bơngai oei.

English: He will not be rich, Nor will his wealth continue, Nor will his possessions overspread the earth.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ gơh oei mơdrŏng; mŭk tơmam sư kư̆m gô ưh kơ jơnap đunh, păng mŭk drăm phe 'ba sư kư̆m ưh kơ lanh rai să lăm teh đak.

English: He will not depart from darkness; The flame will dry out his branches, And by the breath of His mouth he will go away.
Bahnar: Sư ưh pă gơh klaih hlôi đơ̆ng măng mu; pla ŭnh gô sa pơkro tơmơ̆ng sư. Hơyuh dui jơhngơ̆m đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơđông lê̆ sư tơ nai.

English: Let him not trust in futile things, deceiving himself, For futility will be his reward.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ gơnang kơ tơdrong ưh kơ yua chă hơlĕnh kơdih akâu yua kơ tơmam ưh kơ yua noh wă apah sư.

English: It will be accomplished before his time, And his branch will not be green.
Bahnar: Sư gô apah đei tôm adrol kơ khei năr lôch wă truh. Sư thoi dơng ưh kơ hơdrih ôh.

English: He will shake off his unripe grape like a vine, And cast off his blossom like an olive tree.
Bahnar: Sư thoi tơnơm 'long hơmu hơlŭng plei gơsĕ. Thoi 'long ôliwơ pơkao hơlŭng.

English: For the company of hypocrites will be barren, And fire will consume the tents of bribery.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ưh kơ lui yom kơ Kră Yang gô hơwŏng. Ŭnh gô sa pơrăm bơsŭn lu bơngai sa pơgâm đe.

English: They conceive trouble and bring forth futility; Their womb prepares deceit.”
Bahnar: Lu sư anăp kơ tơdrong răm, tơpŭ hloi tơdrong kơnê̆. Lăm tơpu kon anăp bơih đei dôm tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: Then Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl khan

English: “I have heard many such things; Miserable comforters are you all!
Bahnar: Inh đei kơtơ̆ng lơ bơih tơdrong thoi noh: Đĭ-đăng iĕm tă kơ bơngai pơlung pơthim tơblĕk ngăl.

English: Shall words of wind have an end? Or what provokes you that you answer?
Bahnar: Dôm nơ̆r ưh kơ yua âu layơ đĭ? Dah iĕm đei tơdrong jĭ kiơ pơtrŭt iĕm pơma nơ̆r thoi 'noh?

English: I also could speak as you do, If your soul were in my soul’s place. I could heap up words against you, And shake my head at you
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm đei tơdrong gleh truh thoi inh. Inh kư̆m gơh pơma thoi iĕm mơ̆n; trŏ kơ inh kư̆m gơh pơma hil plơ̆ kơ iĕm păng tơtreh kơ̆l kơ iĕm.

English: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, And the comfort of my lips would relieve your grief.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh gô pơma pơhiôk jơhngơ̆m iĕm, pơlung iĕm wă kơ jĭ jăn iĕm rai dă 'biơ̆.

English: “Though I speak, my grief is not relieved; And if I remain silent, how am I eased?
Bahnar: Mă inh pơma, jĭ jăn inh ưh kơ đei dă 'biơ̆; Mă inh pơmơ̆ng, kư̆m ưh kơ đei weh ataih đơ̆ng inh.

English: But now He has worn me out; You have made desolate all my company.
Bahnar: Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ inh gleh lap. Ih pơrăm đĭ lăm hnam dơnŏ inh bơih

English: You have shriveled me up, And it is a witness against me; My leanness rises up against me And bears witness to my face.
Bahnar: Ih pơm kơ akar inh jô hŏnh. Akâu inh hơkĕ hơkong thoi đe chrih plơ̆ kơ inh.

English: He tears me in His wrath, and hates me; He gnashes at me with His teeth; My adversary sharpens His gaze on me.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong blĕk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hek hơđah inh; kăp hơnĕnh blĕk kơ inh thoi sem bri, Thoi bơngai ayăt kơ inh sư lăng pơglăn 'bloh tơ inh.

English: They gape at me with their mouth, They strike me reproachfully on the cheek, They gather together against me.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ha 'bơ̆r che bơle kơ inh, tap tơ'bŏk pơma pơjăm pơjuă inh. Lu sư pôm đon blah inh.

English: God has delivered me to the ungodly, And turned me over to the hands of the wicked.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jao inh kơ lu bơngai pơrăm, klơ̆m inh lăm ti bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: I was at ease, but He has shattered me; He also has taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces; He has set me up for His target
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh oei hiôk-hian, Sư teh pơchah inh, Sư rôp hơko inh klơ̆m inh pơchah hĕch hoch dan lê̆ inh pơm tơ̆r wă prah pơđam.

English: His archers surround me. He pierces my heart and does not pity; He pours out my gall on the ground.
Bahnar: Lu đe prah hră Sư wang tăp tang kơ inh, Sư 'bet klĕch boh-lăn inh, ưh pă mơnat, Sư tuh lê̆ đak kơmăt inh tơ teh.

English: He breaks me with wound upon wound; He runs at me like a warrior.
Bahnar: Sư teh inh rơka lơ 'bôt, Bruh teh inh thoi linh tơblah.

English: “I have sewn sackcloth over my skin, And laid my head in the dust.
Bahnar: Inh sĭt 'bi hrŭk pôn akâu inh, inh drap 'bŭ muh măt inh lăm teh rơpŭk.

English: My face is flushed from weeping, And on my eyelids is the shadow of death
Bahnar: Muh măt inh pơ'ngeh đum rak yua kơ inh nhơ̆m, Yơ̆p tơdrong lôch tăp kơ gơnur măt inh.

English: Although no violence is in my hands, And my prayer is pure.
Bahnar: Mă khan inh ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp ră, păng nơ̆r inh krao khan 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: “O earth, do not cover my blood, And let my cry have no resting place!
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai oei lăm teh, 'nĕ kơ 'bŭ klơ̆p lê̆ pham inh hăm teh. Rŏ kơ inh krao ôr rơngei ưh kơ đei pơgăn.

English: Surely even now my witness is in heaven, And my evidence is on high.
Bahnar: Na jơ 'nâu 'bok mă pơm kơdranh kơ inh oei tơ kơpal plĕnh ti, Đei 'Bok mă dŏng oei tơ anih kơpal ti.

English: My friends scorn me; My eyes pour out tears to God.
Bahnar: Lu buăl juăt inh che bơle kơ inh. Đak măt inh hyôi hyai krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Oh, that one might plead for a man with God, As a man pleads for his neighbor!
Bahnar: 'Bok mă pơm kơdranh oei tơ plĕnh gô dŏng tơgŭm inh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Thoi kon bơngai dŏng buăl sư.

English: For when a few years are finished, I shall go the way of no return.
Bahnar: Oei pă tŏ sĕt sơnăm đĕch bơih inh lôch, na inh gô năm mă ưh pă đei wih dơ̆ng.

English: “My spirit is broken, My days are extinguished, The grave is ready for me.
Bahnar: Tơdrong arih inh wă tôch; khei năr inh wă jê̆ truh; Bơsat oei gô inh.

English: Are not mockers with me? And does not my eye dwell on their provocation?
