Bahnar: Lu bơngai che bơle wang tăp kơ inh, inh ngăl 'bôh lu sư pơm kơ inh.

English: “Now put down a pledge for me with Yourself. Who is he who will shake hands with me?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih iŏk nơ̆r inh pơsĭt. Yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu nai gơh dŏng.

English: For You have hidden their heart from understanding; Therefore You will not exalt them.
Bahnar: Ih ăn kơ đon tơchĕng lu sư ưh kơ hlôh, Na Ih ưh kơ ăn jei lu sư.

English: He who speaks flattery to his friends, Even the eyes of his children will fail.
Bahnar: Bơngai ayơ kêng buăl sư wă lơi yua kơdih. Măt lu kon sư gô bơbôl.

English: “But He has made me a byword of the people, And I have become one in whose face men spit.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ kon pơlei pơla hiĕk ăr kơ inh. Lu sư kơ soh đak hai tơ muh măt inh.

English: My eye has also grown dim because of sorrow, And all my members are like shadows.
Bahnar: Măt inh bơbôl yua kơ ơh sơ'ngon, đĭ-đăng jơ̆ng ti hơkĕ nhen thoi yơ̆p ngôi.

English: Upright men are astonished at this, And the innocent stirs himself up against the hypocrite.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt lăng inh hlĭch kơ đon, na bơngai ưh kơ yoch iung blĕk kơ bơngai kơnê̆.

English: Yet the righteous will hold to his way, And he who has clean hands will be stronger and stronger.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt wei kơjăp trong sư kơdih, Bơngai đei tơpang ti rơgoh 'lơ̆ng rai pran kơtang.

English: “But please, come back again, all of you, For I shall not find one wise man among you.
Bahnar: Ơ, apinh lu iĕm, năm tơ âu pơma pơjah păng inh dơ̆ng Mă-lei inh ưh kơ 'bôh lăm lu iĕm đei bu hơgei.

English: My days are past, My purposes are broken off, Even the thoughts of my heart.
Bahnar: Năr lăm chăl arih inh wă jê̆ hloh bơih, Dôm tơdrong inh chă đon pơchah đĭ, dôm tơdrong inh hơpơi wă kư̆m hiong tôch.

English: They change the night into day; ‘The light is near,’ they say, in the face of darkness.
Bahnar: Buăl inh khan kơmăng gô jing kơ'năr; lu sư khan đơ̆ng rŏng kơmăng mu wă hơdah.

English: If I wait for the grave as my house, If I make my bed in the darkness
Bahnar: Dah inh chang gô arih lôch pơm hnam, Dah inh hơmet anih inh tep lăm măng mu

English: If I say to corruption, ‘You are my father,’ And to the worm, ‘You are my mother and my sister,’
Bahnar: Dah inh krao sơlŭng bơsat; “Ih bơih 'bă inh;” Khan kơ hrai: “Ih bơih mĕ hăm mŏ inh,”

English: Where then is my hope? As for my hope, who can see it?
Bahnar: Lei tơdrong chang hơmĕng inh oei tơ yơ? Bu gơh 'bôh tơdrong inh chang hơmĕng?

English: Will they go down to the gates of Sheol? Shall we have rest together in the dust?”
Bahnar: Tơdrong chang hơmĕng hăm kiơ̆ inh.a Lu nhôn gô pơdơh hiôk lăm 'mui teh ưh?

English: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered and said
Bahnar: Bildat, bơngai Sua, tơl khan

English: “How long till you put an end to words? Gain understanding, and afterward we will speak.
Bahnar: Dĭng dang yơ ih pơdơh kơ pơma? Ih tơchĕng lăng, na lu bơ̆n gô pơma dơnuh.

English: Why are we counted as beasts, And regarded as stupid in your sight?
Bahnar: Liơ ih lăng nhôn thoi sem brem, jô̆ nhôn kơtul kơwao?

English: You who tear yourself in anger, Shall the earth be forsaken for you? Or shall the rock be removed from its place?
Bahnar: Ih hek akâu kơdih, lăm năr ih blĕk Đe hăm gô achăng tŭk lê̆ teh juơ ưh kơ đei bơngai oei, dah tơlơ̆ lê̆ tơmo đơ̆ng anih sư?

English: “The light of the wicked indeed goes out, And the flame of his fire does not shine.
Bahnar: Tơpă kơđeng hơdah lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô păt, pla ŭnh sư ưh pă khơ̆ng hơdah bơih.

English: The light is dark in his tent, And his lamp beside him is put out.
Bahnar: Hơdah lăm bơsŭn sư gô măng mu, ŭnh kơđeng 'bơ̆t kơ̆l sư đe gô tơpăt.

English: The steps of his strength are shortened, And his own counsel casts him down.
Bahnar: Sư yak năm đơ̆ng pran jing tơrăn, sư gô tơpơ̆k sư kơdih lăm sư chă đon pơm kơnê̆.

English: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, And he walks into a snare.
Bahnar: Sư oei năm sư hrơ̆p tơ lăm hơnhuăl păng puh sơlŭng đe hơ'năk klơ̆p hla.

English: The net takes him by the heel, And a snare lays hold of him.
Bahnar: Hơđong 'leh kơnơl jơ̆ng sư păng kap 'leh gô rôp sư.

English: A noose is hidden for him on the ground, And a trap for him in the road.
Bahnar: Đei hơđong tơlei 'bŭ lăm teh đăk kơ sư, păng kap prăn rok trong wă kơ 'leh sư.

English: Terrors frighten him on every side, And drive him to his feet.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli krưp đơ̆ng puăn pah pơm kơ sư tơrơ. Trŏ kơ sư druh kiơ̆ jê̆ kơnơl jơ̆ng sư.

English: His strength is starved, And destruction is ready at his side.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pran sư rơdu tơrăn yua kơ pơngot. Tơdrong răm truh răp 'bơ̆t cheng sư.a

English: It devours patches of his skin; The firstborn of death devours his limbs.
Bahnar: Akar sư jô hŏnh yua kơ jĭ jăn, Kon kơdră yŏng tơdrong lôch pơrăm lê̆ jơ̆ng ti sư.

English: He is uprooted from the shelter of his tent, And they parade him before the king of terrors.
Bahnar: Đe puh sư đơ̆ng lăm bơsŭn, anih mă sư oei hơđơ̆ng. Anhăk ba sư truh tơ pơtao hli krưp.

English: They dwell in his tent who are none of his; Brimstone is scattered on his dwelling.
Bahnar: Bơngai ưh kơ khŭl sư gô oei lăm bơsŭn sư, đe tuh tơmo ŭnh tơ kơpal anih sư oei.

English: His roots are dried out below, And his branch withers above.
Bahnar: Tơ ala rơh sư jô kro, tơ kơpal dơng sư jô hŏnh.

English: The memory of him perishes from the earth, And he has no name among the renowned.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ sư gô hiong đơ̆ng teh đak, Ưh pă đei bu 'blŏk kơ anăn sư đơ̆ng kơpal teh đak.

English: He is driven from light into darkness, And chased out of the world.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anih hơdah đe klơ̆m lê̆ sư tơ lăm anih măng mu, păng puh tơweh sư đơ̆ng teh đak lu bơngai arih.

English: He has neither son nor posterity among his people, Nor any remaining in his dwellings.
Bahnar: Sư ưh pă đei kon sâu tơ lăm pơlei pơla sư, kư̆m ưh pă đei bu oei arih lăm anih sư oei.

English: Those in the west are astonished at his day, As those in the east are frightened.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai đơ̆ng char gah bơmơ̆t mah chrêu kơ đon tơdrong truh kơ sư lu bơngai đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch mah hli tơrơ.

English: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, And this is the place of him who does not know God.”
Bahnar: Tơpă, 'noh jơ̆ anih lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ oei 'Noh anih lu bơngai ưh kơ băt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl dơ̆ng

English: “How long will you torment my soul, And break me in pieces with words?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm wă pơma pơjĭ. Kơpu pơhĕch inh păng pơma pơjuă bơhlơ̆r inh dĭng dang yơ?

English: These ten times you have reproached me; You are not ashamed that you have wronged me.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm chă pơma pơjăm pơjuă mơjĭt wơ̆t kơ 'nâu bơih, lu iĕm pơm kơ inh pă đei hơkơch.

English: And if indeed I have erred, My error remains with me.
Bahnar: Mă khan inh đei pơm yoch hĭ, tơdrong yoch inh noh lăp pơrăm kơdih akâu inh đĕch.

English: If indeed you exalt yourselves against me, And plead my disgrace against me
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm tơchĕng khan lu iĕm hloh kơ inh Iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat inh pơma tơhuăi inh

English: Know then that God has wronged me, And has surrounded me with His net.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei băt 'nâu đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơmat pơrăm inh, păng dăng hơnhuăl Sư tăp kơ inh.

English: “If I cry out concerning wrong, I am not heard. If I cry aloud, there is no justice.
Bahnar: Mă inh ôr krao, “Inh đei glăi răm bơih!” Kŭm ưh kơ đei bu tơl inh; inh krao dŏng, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu sek dŏng tơpăt.

English: He has fenced up my way, so that I cannot pass; And He has set darkness in my paths.
Bahnar: Kră Yang war dur găn chĭt trong kuă ăn kơ inh năm truh. Pơm măng mu chĭt trong inh yak.

English: He has stripped me of my glory, And taken the crown from my head.
Bahnar: Sư plôh lê̆ tơdrong đe pơư kơ inh păng plôh iŏk môk pơtao đơ̆ng kơ̆l inh.

English: He breaks me down on every side, And I am gone; My hope He has uprooted like a tree.
Bahnar: Sư teh tơpăk inh đơ̆ng puăn pah dĭng inh răm đĭ; Tơdrong inh chang hơmĕng Sư buch lê̆ đơ̆ng rơh thoi đe buch tơm 'long.

English: He has also kindled His wrath against me, And He counts me as one of His enemies.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hil mĭl Sư khơ̆ng thoi ŭnh sa Sư lăng inh thoi bơngai ayăt.

English: His troops come together And build up their road against me; They encamp all around my tent.
Bahnar: Lu linh Sư iung năm, blah sir hơbong kơ'nơp năm blah inh pơm anih năm wang tăp kơ bơsŭn inh.

English: “He has removed my brothers far from me, And my acquaintances are completely estranged from me.
Bahnar: Sư pơm lê̆ kơ lu 'nhŏng oh inh weh ataih đơ̆ng inh, lu bơngai juăt kơ inh jing tơmoi nai.

English: My relatives have failed, And my close friends have forgotten me.
Bahnar: Buăl juăt tơm achăng lê̆ inh bơih, lu bơngai mă juăt dêh hăm inh kư̆m hiơt kơ inh.

English: Those who dwell in my house, and my maidservants, Count me as a stranger; I am an alien in their sight.
Bahnar: Lu buăl juăt păng lu drŏ-kăn awih awăn kơ inh lăng inh thoi bơngai nai. Inh thoi bơngai tơmoi nai lu sư ưh kơ băt kơ inh.

English: I call my servant, but he gives no answer; I beg him with my mouth.
Bahnar: Inh krao đĭch đam inh, mă-lei sư ưh kơ tơl nơ̆r inh. Mă khan inh pơih 'bơ̆r krao lung ră.

English: My breath is offensive to my wife, And I am repulsive to the children of my own body.
Bahnar: Akăn inh lăng tơdrong arih inh jing krưp 'brơ̆, 'nhŏng oh inh lăng areh kơ inh.

English: Even young children despise me; I arise, and they speak against me.
Bahnar: Truh kơ lu hơ'lơ̆p kư̆m pơjăm inh, tơwih rŏng mưh inh iung dang dơ̆ng.a

English: All my close friends abhor me, And those whom I love have turned against me.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu buăl inh juăt dêh 'brơ̆ kơ inh; Lu bơngai mă inh 'mêm kư̆m pơm plơ̆ kơ inh mơ̆n.

English: My bone clings to my skin and to my flesh, And I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.
Bahnar: Inh hơkĕ oei pă akar sĕch klep kơting, inh klaih bơih ră oei pă lin lom hơnĕnh.

English: “Have pity on me, have pity on me, O you my friends, For the hand of God has struck me!
Bahnar: Lu iĕm buăl juăt inh, apinh iĕm mơnat 'biơ̆ kơ inh, mơnat 'biơ̆ kơ inh bĕ, yua kơ ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei teh inh bơih.

English: Why do you persecute me as God does, And are not satisfied with my flesh?
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm oei wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n? Liơ iĕm jô̆ inh yoch ưh tam mă hrăp hă?

English: “Oh, that my words were written! Oh, that they were inscribed in a book!
Bahnar: Ôi, rŏ kơ đe chih răk lu nơ̆r inh pơma! Rŏ kơ đe chih lăm sơnôm hla bơar akar!

English: That they were engraved on a rock With an iron pen and lead, forever!
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ đe chrek hăm 'long chih mam pơklep bơlơ̆k. Chhơ̆ tơ tơmo lat na oei đei ling-lang.

English: For I know that my Redeemer lives, And He shall stand at last on the earth
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh băt sĭt Tơ'ngla Dŏng Pơklaih inh oei arih, Sư gô iung dơ̆ng lăm năr tôch kơnh wă pơma dŏng inh kơpal teh.

English: And after my skin is destroyed, this I know, That in my flesh I shall see God
Bahnar: Mă đơ̆ng rŏng kơ akar inh tơlŏng bơih, Inh hơpơi rŏ oei 'bôh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, hăm akâu akar âu.

English: Whom I shall see for myself, And my eyes shall behold, and not another. How my heart yearns within me!
Bahnar: Inh gô 'bôh Sư păng măt inh kơdih, Măt inh gô 'bôh Sư, păng lăng Sư ưh pă hlĭch boih inh chang gô dĭng truh mă klơm klak inh hŏnh.

English: If you should say, ‘How shall we persecute him?’— Since the root of the matter is found in me
Bahnar: Kơplah lu iĕm chă đon khan: “Bơ̆n wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư liơ 'nâu?” Păng khan, tơm tơdrong pơmat 'nâu lĕch đơ̆ng sư đĕch.

English: Be afraid of the sword for yourselves; For wrath brings the punishment of the sword, That you may know there is a judgment.”
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ hli kơ đao gưm yua kơ tơdrong hil kơ lu iĕm trŏ kơ phak hăm đao gưm Wă kơ lu iĕm băt năr sek tơlang wă jê̆ bơih.

English: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered and said
Bahnar: Sôphar bơngai Naama tơl

English: “Therefore my anxious thoughts make me answer, Because of the turmoil within me.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r inh pơm kơ, đon tơchĕng rŭng răng pơtrŭt inh athei tơl, yua kơ jơhngơ̆m inh hơwơ̆l hơwang ưh kơ hơđơ̆ng
Inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r bơtho pơjăm inh, Păng tơdrong hlôh pơtrŭt inh athei tơl.

English: “Do you not know this of old, Since man was placed on earth
Bahnar: Ih hăm băt, đơ̆ng sơ̆ ki sơ̆ kach Iŏk đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'nao pơjing kon bơngai kơpal teh sơ̆.

English: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, And the joy of the hypocrite is but for a moment?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ chhôk lăp tŏ sĕt đĕch, Păng tơdrong chơt hiôk lu bơngai ưh kơ lui kư̆m lăp minh bruh mơ̆n.

English: Though his haughtiness mounts up to the heavens, And his head reaches to the clouds
Bahnar: Mă khan lu bơngai noh sư pơang truh tơ plĕnh Mă kơ̆l lu sư hơtŭt kơ hơmơ̆l

English: Yet he will perish forever like his own refuse; Those who have seen him will say, ‘Where is he?’
Bahnar: Sư gô hiong hach ling-lang thoi ĭch sư kơdih. Lu bơngai mă juăt kơ 'bôh sư jet; “sư tơ yơ bơih?”

English: He will fly away like a dream, and not be found; Yes, he will be chased away like a vision of the night.
Bahnar: Sư gô păr hiong biŏng thoi apo 'bôh kơmăng, pă đei bu 'bôh sư dơ̆ng

English: The eye that saw him will see him no more, Nor will his place behold him anymore.
Bahnar: Măt mă đêl 'bôh sư, ưh pă 'bôh sư dơ̆ng, Tơ anih đêl sư oei kư̆m pă đei sư tơ noh.

English: His children will seek the favor of the poor, And his hands will restore his wealth.
Bahnar: Kon sâu sư gô apinh đơ̆ng bơngai dơnuh, ti lu sư athei pơdrâu 'mong tơmam mă đêl 'bă sư iŏk bơih.

English: His bones are full of his youthful vigor, But it will lie down with him in the dust.
Bahnar: Akâu sư 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong pran oei hơmuh hơmŏng mă-lei gô lôch hơdai sư jing 'mui teh.

English: “Though evil is sweet in his mouth, And he hides it under his tongue
Bahnar: Mă khan pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ mơn thoi 'ngam lăm 'bơ̆r sư, mă sư ôn hlơp lăm ala hơpiĕt sư

English: Though he spares it and does not forsake it, But still keeps it in his mouth
Bahnar: Mă khan sư 'mêm kơ tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ thoi 'mŏm pơ'ngơ̆m lăm 'bơ̆r sư, ưh kơ wă 'maih lă hŭt lê̆

English: Yet his food in his stomach turns sour; It becomes cobra venom within him.
Bahnar: Mưh sư luăn lăm klak, tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ noh gô 'bâu ôm, jing hơkăm thoi bih 'bih dong.

English: He swallows down riches And vomits them up again; God casts them out of his belly.
Bahnar: Mŭk măk sư tơtông luăn sa 'ngam gô hăk lê̆ tơ 'nguaih, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơih ăn kơ sư hăk lê̆ mŭk tơmam noh đơ̆ng hlŭng sư.

English: He will suck the poison of cobras; The viper’s tongue will slay him.
Bahnar: Noh thoi sư gô doch luăn bih 'bih dong. Hơpiĕt 'bih đei bih hơkăm gô pơlôch sư.

English: He will not see the streams, The rivers flowing with honey and cream.
Bahnar: Sư ưh pă đei 'bôh đak rơmă ôliwơ, đak sut păng đak toh rơmo ro thoi đak glung.

English: He will restore that for which he labored, And will not swallow it down; From the proceeds of business He will get no enjoyment.
Bahnar: Sư athei pơdrâu tơwih đĭ dôm mŭk lơi đơ̆ng tơdrong jang sư. Sư ưh kơ đei gơh yua iŏk mŭk tơmam mơdrŏng đơ̆ng sư mơdro sa.

English: For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor, He has violently seized a house which he did not build.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư sa pơgâm pă lăng bơngai dơnuh hoh, Tơgar iŏk hnam mă sư ưh kơ đei man.

English: “Because he knows no quietness in his heart, He will not save anything he desires.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư 'maih wă ưh kơ hrăp ôh, sư ưh kơ đei mong ôh dôm tơmam sư hơpơi wă.

English: Nothing is left for him to eat; Therefore his well-being will not last.
Bahnar: Ưh pă đei tơmam kiơ mă oei đei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư iŏk đĭ, lei na tơdrong mơdrŏng chơt hiôk sư ưh kơjăp đunh.

English: In his self-sufficiency he will be in distress; Every hand of misery will come against him.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei đei tôm tơmam rơkah rơkai tơdrong kơ'bah truh hloi Tơdrong pơmat-tat kơtang gô truh pơm kơ sư.

English: When he is about to fill his stomach, God will cast on him the fury of His wrath, And will rain it on him while he is eating.
Bahnar: Layơ sư phĭ 'bĕnh klak bơih, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tuh tơdrong hil mĭl Sư thoi đak 'mi. Pơm tơmam sa sư

English: He will flee from the iron weapon; A bronze bow will pierce him through.
Bahnar: Mă sư kơdâu hlôi kơ tơmam tơblah pơm păng mam, 'Brơ̆m păng kong gô 'bet klĕch akâu sư.

English: It is drawn, and comes out of the body; Yes, the glittering point comes out of his gall. Terrors come upon him
Bahnar: Sư toh 'brơ̆m noh đơ̆ng kơdŭ rŏng, 'Brơ̆m suĕng 'bet klĕch tơ klơm kơmăt sư. Sư hli krưp tơpă.

English: Total darkness is reserved for his treasures. An unfanned fire will consume him; It shall go ill with him who is left in his tent.
Bahnar: Măng mu hơ'bơ̆l gô gom klơ̆p lê̆ tơmam gĭt sư. Ŭnh ưh kơ đei kon bơngai dơhlu dơhlông sa lê̆ sư. Kiơ mă oei lăm bơsŭn sư ŭnh gô sa pơđĭ.

English: The heavens will reveal his iniquity, And the earth will rise up against him.
Bahnar: Lu hơtăl plĕnh thoi bơngai kơdranh gô tơ'bôh tơbăt tơdrong kơnê̆ sư, teh gô iung pơm plơ̆ kơ sư lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: The increase of his house will depart, And his goods will flow away in the day of His wrath.
Bahnar: Hơbŭt đak lơ̆p koch hoch hnam sư đĭ. Đak kơtah lôm ba mŭk tơmam noh lăm năr Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil.

English: This is the portion from God for a wicked man, The heritage appointed to him by God.”
Bahnar: Noh bơih mă tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'măn kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Mŭk tơmam mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơsư̆ kơ sư.

English: Then Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl khan

English: “Listen carefully to my speech, And let this be your consolation.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng mă nhen nơ̆r inh pơma; Noh tơdrong mă iĕm wă pơlung inh.

English: Bear with me that I may speak, And after I have spoken, keep mocking.
Bahnar: Adrin ĕnh, gô inh pơma: Đang kơ inh pơma bơih, lu iĕm gơh che bơle.

English: “As for me, is my complaint against man? And if it were, why should I not be impatient?
Bahnar: Inh hăm pơma jŏk kơ kon bơngai? Liơ inh ưh kơ gơh kơ blĕk hă?

English: Look at me and be astonished; Put your hand over your mouth.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ tơ inh, Na iĕm 'bôh hlĭch; iŏk tơpang ti đơ̆p 'bơ̆r.

English: Even when I remember I am terrified, And trembling takes hold of my flesh.
Bahnar: Layơ inh 'blŏk kơ tơdrong noh, inh hli tơrơ dêh, Akâu akar inh pơpơ̆ tơtơ̆ đĭ.

English: Why do the wicked live and become old, Yes, become mighty in power?
Bahnar: Liơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ oei arih, Rai arih sot păng rai kĕ pran?

English: Their descendants are established with them in their sight, And their offspring before their eyes.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh adrĕch adrung lu sư hiôk hơđơ̆ng. Păng kon sâu lu sư oei kơjăp 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: Their houses are safe from fear, Neither is the rod of God upon them.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei lăm hnam hiôk-hian, ưh kơ đei hli kơ kiơ, Sơnguĕt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei teh tôn lu sư.

English: Their bull breeds without failure; Their cow calves without miscarriage.
Bahnar: Rơmo tơno kiơ̆ akăn gô đei ưh kơ đei layơ hiong đĕch. Rơmo yŏng lu sư tuh ưh kơ đei 'lih.

English: They send forth their little ones like a flock, And their children dance.
Bahnar: Lu sư ăn kơ lu hơ'lơ̆p sư năm lĕch bru bra thoi khŭl triu, kon hơiĕ lu sư pơplŏng suang.

English: They sing to the tambourine and harp, And rejoice to the sound of the flute.
Bahnar: Hơri suang kiơ̆ jơwa hơgơ̆r iĕ păng brŏ tĭng-nĭng, Păng hiôk chơt kiơ̆ jơwa re 'lal.

English: They spend their days in wealth, And in a moment go down to the grave.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đei chăl arih mơdrŏng hiôk. Truh tơ lôch năm tơ bơsat 'bônh đĕch.

English: Yet they say to God, ‘Depart from us, For we do not desire the knowledge of Your ways.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Weh ataih kơ lu nhôn, lu nhôn ưh kơ wă băt trong gơlong Ih.

English: Who is the Almighty, that we should serve Him? And what profit do we have if we pray to Him?’
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh noh kiơ, mă lu nhôn athei kơkuh kơ Sư? Krao khan apinh Sư đei lơi yua kiơ kơ lu nhôn?”

English: Indeed their prosperity is not in their hand; The counsel of the wicked is far from me.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơdrŏng lu sư hăm đei oei lăm tơpang ti lu sư ưh? Inh weh ataih đơ̆ng bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơđâu.

English: “How often is the lamp of the wicked put out? How often does their destruction come upon them, The sorrows God distributes in His anger?
Bahnar: Hơdôm wơ̆t ŭnh kơđeng bơngai pơm kơnê̆ păt? Hơdôm wơ̆t tơdrong pơmat truh tuh tơ lu sư, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil phak lu sư?

English: They are like straw before the wind, And like chaff that a storm carries away.
Bahnar: Lu sư thoi hơnong 'ba anăp kial hơbŭt thoi hơkam 'ba kial hơbŭt pơđông?

English: They say, ‘God lays up one’s iniquity for his children’; Let Him recompense him, that he may know it.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'măn tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ sư ăn kơ kon hơ'lơ̆p sư.” Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơwih tơdrong noh kơ lu sư kơdih, wă kơ lu sư băt

English: Let his eyes see his destruction, And let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ măt lu sư 'bôh tơdrong pơrăm truh tơ lu sư, Ăn kơ lu sư đei huch tơdrong hil mĭl Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: For what does he care about his household after him, When the number of his months is cut in half?
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ tơtăm kiơ truh kơ hnam dơnŏ, Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư lôch.

English: “Can anyone teach God knowledge, Since He judges those on high?
Bahnar: Bu pơ̆n bơtho Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Kơplah Sư sek tơlang mă lu linh jang?

English: One dies in his full strength, Being wholly at ease and secure
Bahnar: Đei bơngai arih liĕm akâu hiôk-hian Đei jơhngơ̆m pran jăng truh kơ lôch

English: His pails are full of milk, And the marrow of his bones is moist.
Bahnar: Akâu jăn bek lơluĭnh 'bĕnh kơ rơmă păng ngăl kơting oei 'lơ̆ng hơnơ̆ng.

English: Another man dies in the bitterness of his soul, Never having eaten with pleasure.
Bahnar: Bơngai to lôch, đĭ lăm chăl arih ơh sơ'ngon pơmat-tat. Ưh tam đei mơn 'bơm tơdrong pŭn hiôk liơ.

English: They lie down alike in the dust, And worms cover them.
Bahnar: Đĭ kơ 'bar tă 'bĭch hơdai lăm 'mui teh ngăl, Hrai sa 'bĕnh-'bang pơđĭ kơ 'bar.

English: “Look, I know your thoughts, And the schemes with which you would wrong me.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, inh băt hơđăl đon iĕm tơchĕng, Lu iĕm wă pơrăm inh.

English: For you say, ‘Where is the house of the prince? And where is the tent, The dwelling place of the wicked?’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm jet: “Hnam bơngai pơm tih 'lơ̆ng oei tơ yơ? Bơsŭn lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ oei tơ yơ?”

English: Have you not asked those who travel the road? And do you not know their signs?
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm ưh kơ jet lu bơngai tơmoi rok trong? Liơ lu iĕm ưh kơ wă lui nơ̆r lu sư khan?

English: For the wicked are reserved for the day of doom; They shall be brought out on the day of wrath.
Bahnar: Lăm năr đei tơdrong truh, lu bơngai kơnê̆ oei gơh hiôk. Oei gơh klaih lăm năr hil mĭl?

English: Who condemns his way to his face? And who repays him for what he has done?
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơ̆n jô̆ bơngai kơnê̆ yoch 'bơ̆t tơm măt sư? Bơngai bu pơ̆n pơm 'mong kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong sư pơm bơih?

English: Yet he shall be brought to the grave, And a vigil kept over the tomb.
Bahnar: Dah đe năm 'bŭ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ truh tơ bơsat, Bơsat sư đei bơngai gak.

English: The clods of the valley shall be sweet to him; Everyone shall follow him, As countless have gone before him.
Bahnar: Anih teh bơsat lăm thŭng pơm kơ sư hơbôn hiôk. Rim bơngai tơdui băl kiơ̆ năm 'bŭ sư. Bơngai năm adrol năm đơ̆ng rŏng lơlap lơlang.

English: How then can you comfort me with empty words, Since falsehood remains in your answers?”
Bahnar: Na, liơ lu iĕm tơchĕng oei gơh pơlung inh mă ưh kơ yua thoi noh? Dôm nơ̆r pơma lu iĕm tă kơ hơlĕnh ngăl.

English: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said
Bahnar: Êliphas, bơngai Thêman tơl nơ̆r

English: “Can a man be profitable to God, Though he who is wise may be profitable to himself?
Bahnar: Kon bơngai hăm đei yua kiơ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh? Bơngai hơgei lăp pơyua ăn kơ sư kơdih đĕch.

English: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty that you are righteous? Or is it gain to Him that you make your ways blameless?
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh hăm đei hiôk chơt kiơ tơdah ih arih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt? Hăm đei yua kiơ kơ Sư dah trong ih yak 'lơ̆ng tôm tơdrong?

English: “Is it because of your fear of Him that He corrects you, And enters into judgment with you?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ yua kơ ih hli yom kơ Sư, na Sư chrih bơtho ih. Păng sek tơlang ih?

English: Is not your wickedness great, And your iniquity without end?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ yua kơ ih yoch tih dêh? Tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ ih pơm lơ dêh hă?

English: For you have taken pledges from your brother for no reason, And stripped the naked of their clothing.
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih pơgŏ ra đơ̆ng 'nhŏng oh ih tơmam pơkơ̆ng tơdrong kơ đei. Plôh iŏk hơbĕn ao lê̆ sư akâu hoh

English: You have not given the weary water to drink, And you have withheld bread from the hungry.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ ăn đak nhă kơ bơngai lap, Ưh kơ ăn kơ bơngai pơngot tơmam sa.

English: But the mighty man possessed the land, And the honorable man dwelt in it.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pran gơh kĕ ih ăn sư đei teh; Bơngai đei đe pơyom ih ăn oei tơ 'noh.

English: You have sent widows away empty, And the strength of the fatherless was crushed.
Bahnar: Ih pơpuh bơngai adro brŏk tơpang ti hoh. Lu bơngai mơti ih pơjuă lê̆ anih sư gơnang.

English: Therefore snares are all around you, And sudden fear troubles you
Bahnar: Kơlih thoi noh, kap đăk tăp dăr kơ ih, Tơdrong hli krưp kơnê̆ gô pơm kơ ih

English: Or darkness so that you cannot see; And an abundance of water covers you.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơdah pơm kơ ih măng mu ưh kơ 'bôh, Păng đak lơ̆p tơmôch ih.

English: “Is not God in the height of heaven? And see the highest stars, how lofty they are!
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ kơpal, tơ lu tăl plĕnh ti hă? Lăng bĕ tơ sơnglŏng kơjung hloh pă băt dang yơ!

English: And you say, ‘What does God know? Can He judge through the deep darkness?
Bahnar: Na ih khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei băt kiơ đăi? Liơ Kră Yang sek tơlang gơh 'bôh lăm măng mu hơ'bơ̆l 'noh?

English: Thick clouds cover Him, so that He cannot see, And He walks above the circle of heaven.’
Bahnar: Hơmơ̆l găm gom jum dăr kơ Sư na Sư ưh kơ 'bôh; Păng Sư yak rok rŏng kơpal plĕnh.”

English: Will you keep to the old way Which wicked men have trod
Bahnar: Ih oei wă yak rok kiơ̆ trong so, Trong mă lu bơngai kơnê̆ juăt kơ rok hă?

English: Who were cut down before their time, Whose foundations were swept away by a flood?
Bahnar: Đe rôp ba pơlôch lu sư adrol kơ năr pơkă, tơm tơdrong arih lu sư đe tơhiong hoch ro kiơ̆ đak glung

English: They said to God, ‘Depart from us! What can the Almighty do to them?’
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Ih athei weh ataih đơ̆ng lu nhôn bĕ; Kră Yang Tih Hloh gơh pơm kiơ kơ lu nhôn?”

English: Yet He filled their houses with good things; But the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ră Kră Yang đei ăn kơ hnam lu sư 'bĕnh kơ tơmam 'lơ̆ng: Tơdrong lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă pơm weh ataih đơ̆ng inh!

English: “The righteous see it and are glad, And the innocent laugh at them
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt chơt hiôk 'bôh tơdrong phak lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Na bơngai ưh kơ đei yoch gô che bơle kơ lu sư

English: ‘Surely our adversaries are cut down, And the fire consumes their remnant.’
Bahnar: “Bơngai ayăt kơ lu bơ̆n sĭt gô lôch pơđĭ. Păng tơmam kiơ mă lu sư 'măn lê̆ ŭnh gô sa pơgoh.”

English: “Now acquaint yourself with Him, and be at peace; Thereby good will come to you.
Bahnar: Athei pơgơ̆p hiôk rơnŭk hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Athei arih hiôk-hian Đơ̆ng noh ih gô đei pŭn hiôk.

English: Receive, please, instruction from His mouth, And lay up His words in your heart.
Bahnar: Athei sơng iŏk bĕ nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho, păng athei wei răk nơ̆r Sư lăm jơhngơ̆m ih.

English: If you return to the Almighty, you will be built up; You will remove iniquity far from your tents.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih wih dơ̆ng tơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lei ih gô gơh đei hơmet ming dơ̆ng. Tơdah ih hŭt lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ ataih đơ̆ng anih bơsŭn ih.

English: Then you will lay your gold in the dust, And the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih hŭt lê̆ maih tơ teh, păng klơ̆m maih ôphir tơ tơmo hơga lăm thong đak hrơ̆

English: Yes, the Almighty will be your gold And your precious silver
Bahnar: Tơdah ih gĭt kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh thoi maih. Thoi hu mă ih gĭt.

English: For then you will have your delight in the Almighty, And lift up your face to God.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh, ih gô đei tơdrong hiôk rơnŭk lăm Kră Yang Tih Hloh, ih gô hiôk ngơk muh măt tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: You will make your prayer to Him, He will hear you, And you will pay your vows.
Bahnar: Ih gô krao apinh Sư, Sư gô mơ̆ng nơ̆r ih, Păng ih gô pơkeh tơdrong ih pơkă.

English: You will also declare a thing, And it will be established for you; So light will shine on your ways.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ ih wă pơm sĭt gô jing; Tơdrong hơdah gô pơchrang lu trong ih.

English: When they cast you down, and you say, ‘Exaltation will come!’ Then He will save the humble person.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơjur lê̆ lu bơngai pơang na dŏng pơklaih bơngai iŏk đon ala.

English: He will even deliver one who is not innocent; Yes, he will be delivered by the purity of your hands.”
Bahnar: Sư dŏng pơklaih lu bơngai ưh kơ yoch; Păng ih gô đei dŏng pơklaih tơdah ti ih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: Then Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl khan

English: “Even today my complaint is bitter; My hand is listless because of my groaning.
Bahnar: Mă truh năr 'nâu, tơdrong hơdrĭ inh oei đei ơh sơ'ngon, Ti kơtĭt kơpal inh oei trăp mă khan inh krao ôr.

English: Oh, that I knew where I might find Him, That I might come to His seat!
Bahnar: Inh rŏ kơ băt anih ayơ chă tơ'bơ̆p Kră Yang, Inh gô năm kơkuh kơ Sư!

English: I would present my case before Him, And fill my mouth with arguments.
Bahnar: Inh gô ră roi pơdah tơdrong inh 'bơ̆t anăp Sư, Păng 'bơ̆r inh gô pơma dôm tơdrong trŏ lăp.

English: I would know the words which He would answer me, And understand what He would say to me.
Bahnar: Inh gô băt dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang tơl tơwih ăn kơ inh. Inh gô hlôh dôm tơdrong Kră Yang wă pơma bơtho inh.

English: Would He contend with me in His great power? No! But He would take note of me.
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Sư iŏk tơdrong mơsêh tih Sư pơjah pơjăng hăm inh? Ưh ôh, Sư gô mơ̆ng kơ inh.

English: There the upright could reason with Him, And I would be delivered forever from my Judge.
Bahnar: Tơ noh lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gơh roi pơdah tơdrong Sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Păng inh gơh klaih đơ̆ng sek tơlang ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: “Look, I go forward, but He is not there, And backward, but I cannot perceive Him
Bahnar: 'Nâu, inh năm tơ anăp, ưh kơ đei Kră Yang tơ noh; Inh kơdŭn tơ rŏng, mă-lei inh lăng kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh Sư.

English: When He works on the left hand, I cannot behold Him; When He turns to the right hand, I cannot see Him.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang jang tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, inh ưh kơ 'bôh Sư; Sư weh tơ gah gơal, inh chă lăng kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh sư.

English: But He knows the way that I take; When He has tested me, I shall come forth as gold.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang băt trong inh nơnăm; kơplah Kră Yang pơlong lăng inh, inh gô lĕch thoi maih.

English: My foot has held fast to His steps; I have kept His way and not turned aside.
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng inh kiơ̆ jê̆ yak Sư Inh bơwei yak kiơ̆ trong sư, ưh kơ weh-woh.

English: I have not departed from the commandment of His lips; I have treasured the words of His mouth More than my necessary food.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ tơklah kơ nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư. Inh răk lăm jơhngơ̆m inh nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Kră Yang hloh kơ tơmam sŏng sa.a

English: “But He is unique, and who can make Him change? And whatever His soul desires, that He does.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei tơplih ôh. Bơngai bu pơ̆n tơplih Sư? Tơdrong kiơ Sư wă, Sư pơm hloi.

English: For He performs what is appointed for me, And many such things are with Him.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư gô pơm keh tơdrong kiơ, Sư wă pơm kơ inh. Lăm jơhngơ̆m Sư tơchĕng lơ tơdrong lei-lăi thoi noh.

English: Therefore I am terrified at His presence; When I consider this, I am afraid of Him.
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh boih na inh hli krưp dêh 'bơ̆t anăp Sư; Rai tơchĕng inh rai hli kơ Sư loi.

English: For God made my heart weak, And the Almighty terrifies me
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ inh rơmơ̆n rơmok. Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơm kơ inh hli tơrơ

English: Because I was not cut off from the presence of darkness, And He did not hide deep darkness from my face.
Bahnar: Yua kơ măng mu klơ̆p gom inh ưh kơ wă ngăn ôh Măng klăm hơ'bơ̆l gom klơ̆p lê̆ muh măt inh.b

English: “Since times are not hidden from the Almighty, Why do those who know Him see not His days?
Bahnar: Liơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh ưh kơ pơkă jơ 'năr wă sek tơlang? Liơ lu bơngai băt kơ Kră Yang ưh kơ 'bôh năr sek tơlang noh?

English: “Some remove landmarks; They seize flocks violently and feed on them
Bahnar: Lu bơngai toh rĭ hơdral Plah tơgar iŏk triu rơmo puh wei rong iŏk

English: They drive away the donkey of the fatherless; They take the widow’s ox as a pledge.
Bahnar: Tơgar iŏk aseh iĕ lu bơngai mơti 'bă, Rôp pơkơ̆ng iŏk rơmo lu yă adro po.

English: They push the needy off the road; All the poor of the land are forced to hide.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơpuh lu bơngai dơnuh hin weh đơ̆ng trong tih. Lu bơngai pơmat-tat lăm teh đak chă ôn kơ'nơp.

English: Indeed, like wild donkeys in the desert, They go out to their work, searching for food. The wilderness yields food for them and for their children.
Bahnar: To, lu bơngai dơnuh hơwŏl hơwônh chă nhen thoi aseh iĕ tơ tơmăn glă; chă tơmam sa ăn kơ lu kon sư. Thoi aseh iĕ chă sa tơ lăm bri brah.

English: They gather their fodder in the field And glean in the vineyard of the wicked.
Bahnar: Lu sư chă dônh sa, hơnong 'ba tơ lăm mir chŭn, Dônh mok plei hơmu lăm pơgar lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: They spend the night naked, without clothing, And have no covering in the cold.
Bahnar: Kơmăng lu sư 'bĭch akâu hoh, ưh kơ đei hơbĕn ao, ưh kơ đei khăn su lăm măng tơngiĕt tơngiot.

English: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, And huddle around the rock for want of shelter.
Bahnar: 'Mi têh lu sư hơiuh tơngiĕt tơ kông ưh kơ đei anih wă yong, sư pơpring akâu cheng hơgơp tơmo.

English: “Some snatch the fatherless from the breast, And take a pledge from the poor.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ tơgar iŏk kon mơti kơ 'bă oei mŏm; Rôp pơkơ̆ng kon hơ'lơ̆p lu bơngai dơnuh hin

English: They cause the poor to go naked, without clothing; And they take away the sheaves from the hungry.
Bahnar: Bơngai dơnuh răm năm akâu hoh ưh kơ đei ao, Tôi hơchô̆ 'ba, na klak pơngot.

English: They press out oil within their walls, And tread winepresses, yet suffer thirst.
Bahnar: Lu sư hmĕt đak rơmă lăm mir ôliwơ, Lu sư pơjuă plei hơmu tơ lăm kơthŭng, mă hơlŏng oei rơhing.

English: The dying groan in the city, And the souls of the wounded cry out; Yet God does not charge them with wrong.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm pơlei đei nơ̆r bơngai wă lôch ôr tơngưih Lu bơngai rơka ôr hơpơi krao dŏng. Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ jô̆ noh tơdrong yoch lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: “There are those who rebel against the light; They do not know its ways Nor abide in its paths.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai blah tơdrong hơdah. Ưh kơ băt trong tơdrong hơdah, kư̆m ưh kơ yak năm lăm trong hơdah mơ̆n.

English: The murderer rises with the light; He kills the poor and needy; And in the night he is like a thief.
Bahnar: 'Nao 'brưch bơngai pơlôch đe iung, pơlôch lu bơngai dơnuh hin păng hoh răm; Tơ kơmăng lu sư thoi lĕ bơngai tơtông.

English: The eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight, Saying, ‘No eye will see me’; And he disguises his face.
Bahnar: Măt lu bơngai ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă chang gô kơsơ̆ măng, Na khan: “Ưh kơ đei măt bu gơh 'bôh inh,” Na kơlŭk muh măt sư.

English: In the dark they break into houses Which they marked for themselves in the daytime; They do not know the light.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơtông bŏk tơnăr hnam kơmăng, na kơ'năr lu sư chă ôn; Ưh kơ băt kơ hơdah.

English: For the morning is the same to them as the shadow of death; If someone recognizes them, They are in the terrors of the shadow of death.
Bahnar: Gah lu sư măng mu noh kơ 'năr. Yua kơ lu sư pơm buăl juăt hăm tơdrong hli lăm măng mu gueo

English: “They should be swift on the face of the waters, Their portion should be cursed in the earth, So that no one would turn into the way of their vineyards.
Bahnar: Lu sư thoi gơmơ̆k blôk đông hoch kơpal đak; Teh jang sa lu sư đe hiap pơtê̆ bơih; Ưh pă đei bu brŏk dơ̆ng bơih tơ pơgar hơmu lu sư.

English: As drought and heat consume the snow waters, So the grave consumes those who have sinned.
Bahnar: Tơdrong phang-ang păng tŏ pơhach lê̆ đak prĕl, Pơlei lôch kư̆m dui iŏk lu bơngai pơm yoch.

English: The womb should forget him, The worm should feed sweetly on him; He should be remembered no more, And wickedness should be broken like a tree.
Bahnar: Mĕ mă pŭ gô hiơt lê̆ kơ lu sư; Lu hrai gô sa lu sư; Đe ưh pă 'blŏk kơ lu sư dơ̆ng; Păng tơdrong kơnê̆ tơgơ̆ bŭk thoi tơm 'long.

English: For he preys on the barren who do not bear, And does no good for the widow.
Bahnar: Lu sư plah tơgar iŏk tơmam drŏ-kăn hơwŏng, Pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu yă adro po.

English: “But God draws the mighty away with His power; He rises up, but no man is sure of life.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iŏk tơdrong pran kơtang pơlôch lu bơngai kơtang Ti Kră Yang hiŏng lu sư pă hơmĕng kơ arih.

English: He gives them security, and they rely on it; Yet His eyes are on their ways.
Bahnar: Kră Yang lê̆ lu sư arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng. Măt Kră Yang oei răp lăng trong lu sư

English: They are exalted for a little while, Then they are gone. They are brought low; They are taken out of the way like all others; They dry out like the heads of grain.
Bahnar: Lu sư arih đei đe pơyom lăp minh bruh đĕch. Lu sư lôch hiong dong. Lu sư gô jô kro ruh hơlŭng thoi 'nhĕt Thoi hơie 'ba đe yuă lê̆ đơ̆ng tơm.

English: “Now if it is not so, who will prove me a liar, And make my speech worth nothing?”
Bahnar: Tơdah ưh kơ đei thoi ei bơngai bu jô̆ khan kơ inh pơma hơlĕnh. Păng pơdah nơ̆r inh tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered and said
Bahnar: Bildat, bơngai Sua, tơl khan

English: “Dominion and fear belong to Him; He makes peace in His high places.
Bahnar: Kră Yang chĕp tơdrong pơgơ̆r păng trŏ kơ hli yom: Kră Yang pơjing tơdrong rơngei hiôk-hian tơ kơpal plĕnh ti.

English: Is there any number to His armies? Upon whom does His light not rise?
Bahnar: Khŭl linh Sư hăm đei bu kĕ jô̆? Tơdrong hơdah Sư hăm đei bu mă Sư ưh kơ đei pơchrang?

English: How then can man be righteous before God? Or how can he be pure who is born of a woman?
Bahnar: Liơ mă kon bơngai gơh jô̆ 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei? Bơngai đơ̆ng drŏ-kăn tơpŭ ngăl, liơ mă gơh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh?

English: If even the moon does not shine, And the stars are not pure in His sight
Bahnar: Tơdah, mă măt khei kư̆m ưh kơ gan hơdah, Lu sơnglŏng kư̆m ưh kơ đei 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mơ̆n 'bơ̆t anăp Sư

English: How much less man, who is a maggot, And a son of man, who is a worm?”
Bahnar: Pơma kiơ kơ kon bơngai nhen thoi kơnu hơdrông, Păng kon sâu kon bơngai jơ̆ kơnu hơdrông.

English: But Job answered and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl khan

English: “How have you helped him who is without power? How have you saved the arm that has no strength?
Bahnar: Ih pơdŏng bơih bơngai ưh kơ jing jat ưh kơ tat tơdrong! Dŏng tơgŭm tơpang ti bơngai rơdu tơrăn.

English: How have you counseled one who has no wisdom? And how have you declared sound advice to many?
Bahnar: Bơtho tơ'bôh bơngai ưh kơ hlôh, Bơtho tơbăt lơ tơdrong gơh hơgei.

English: To whom have you uttered words? And whose spirit came from you?
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng bu bơtho tơgŭm ih pơma nơ̆r noh? Bơhngol bu pơma mă lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r ih?

English: “The dead tremble, Those under the waters and those inhabiting them.
Bahnar: Bơngai lôch tơtơ̆ tơtey, pơpơ̆ pơpol. Lăm ala đak păng đĭ lu kiơ arih oei tơ lăm noh hai.

English: Sheol is naked before Him, And Destruction has no covering.
Bahnar: Pơlei bơngai lôch tơlĕch pơdah bơih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Păng sơlŭng jrŭ ưh kơ đei che pĕng hlơp

English: He stretches out the north over empty space; He hangs the earth on nothing.
Bahnar: Kră Yang bơyar plĕnh tơ gah yă-nơ̆m tơ kơpal anê̆ rơwơ̆ng. Hơtol kơtuăl teh tơ kơpal rơwơ̆ng.

English: He binds up the water in His thick clouds, Yet the clouds are not broken under it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang mong đak 'mi lăm hơmơ̆l hơ'bơ̆l, Mă-lei hơmơ̆l ưh kơ đei tơhek yua kơ đơ̆ng đak lơ.

English: He covers the face of His throne, And spreads His cloud over it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pĕng klơ̆p kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao Sư păng lơ̆k hơmơ̆l klơ̆p tang-dŏ 'noh.

English: He drew a circular horizon on the face of the waters, At the boundary of light and darkness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang chhơ̆ plĕnh chro kơpal đak, 'Bơ̆t sơlam hơdah hăm măng mu păng măng mu tơ'bưh băl.

English: The pillars of heaven tremble, And are astonished at His rebuke.
Bahnar: Lu jrăng plĕnh tơdrŏ kyĭng kyơ̆ng, Hli tơrơ kơplah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chrih.

English: He stirs up the sea with His power, And by His understanding He breaks up the storm.
Bahnar: Kră Yang iŏk tơdrong mơsêh Sư pơm kơ đak dơsĭ hơđơ̆ng ngơ-ngơ̆n. Yua tơdrong gơh hơgei Sư na teh tơhuŏng lê̆ Rahap.

English: By His Spirit He adorned the heavens; His hand pierced the fleeing serpent.
Bahnar: Hăm kial dui jơhngơ̆m Sư hơmet ming lu plĕnh, Tơpang ti Kră Yang 'bet hlôh akâu 'bih oei kơdâu klĕnh.

English: Indeed these are the mere edges of His ways, And how small a whisper we hear of Him! But the thunder of His power who can understand?”
Bahnar: Noh lăng brih tŏ sĕt đĕch tơdrong jang Sư; Tơdrong mă đe roi bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng noh lăp iĕ ioch đĕch mă-lei bu hlôh rơđah jơwa grơ̆m re Mơsêh Mơyang Sư?

English: Moreover Job continued his discourse, and said
Bahnar: Jop oei pơma dơ̆ng păng khan

English: “As God lives, who has taken away my justice, And the Almighty, who has made my soul bitter
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih pơm kơdranh kơ inh, Sư ưh kơ wă sek ăn kơ inh tơpăt Kră Yang Tih Hloh, pơm kơ chăl arih inh chhŭr nuih.

English: As long as my breath is in me, And the breath of God in my nostrils
Bahnar: Dang yơ inh oei dui jơhngơ̆m, oei đei hơyuh kial arih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lăm trôm muh inh.

English: My lips will not speak wickedness, Nor my tongue utter deceit.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r inh ưh kơ đei pơma tơdrong kơnê̆, Hơpiĕt inh kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơma hơlĕnh.

English: Far be it from me That I should say you are right; Till I die I will not put away my integrity from me.
Bahnar: Tơpă sĭt inh ưh kơ đei layơ khan jô̆ lu iĕm trŏ! Mă truh kơ lôch, inh oei jô̆ inh oei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go; My heart shall not reproach me as long as I live.
Bahnar: Inh khan tơpă inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, inh ưh kơ đei tơplih nơ̆r; Đĭ lăm chăl arih inh, jơhngơ̆m inh ưh kơ đei chrih kơ inh.

English: “May my enemy be like the wicked, And he who rises up against me like the unrighteous.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ phak lu ayăt kơ inh thoi lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Lu bơngai blah inh sek phak lu sư thoi bơngai ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, Though he may gain much, If God takes away his life?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ưh kơ lui đei chang hơmĕng kiơ mưh chăl arih âu tôch, Mưh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơdrâu lê̆ tơdrong arih lu sư?

English: Will God hear his cry When trouble comes upon him?
Bahnar: Kơplah đei tơdrong răm truh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư krao ôr?

English: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? Will he always call on God?
Bahnar: Lu sư hăm đei chơchă tơdrong hiôk chơt lăm Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Hăm đei krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang ưh?

English: “I will teach you about the hand of God; What is with the Almighty I will not conceal.
Bahnar: Inh gô bơtho tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu iĕm, gah tơdrong Mơsêh Mơyang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ưh kơ đei ôn kơ lu iĕm tơdrong kiơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh wă.

English: Surely all of you have seen it; Why then do you behave with complete nonsense?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'bôh băt hlôh bơih tơdrong 'noh, Lei liơ lu iĕm oei pơma nơ̆r tơdrong kơ đei?

English: “This is the portion of a wicked man with God, And the heritage of oppressors, received from the Almighty
Bahnar: 'Nâu, tơdrong mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'măn kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Mŭk tơmam kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ iŏk đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: If his children are multiplied, it is for the sword; And his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
Bahnar: Kon sâu lu sư rai lơ kơdrơ̆m kư̆m gô pơ̆k lôch yua kơ đao gưm. Adrĕch adrung lu sư ưh kơ đei sa phĭ mah.

English: Those who survive him shall be buried in death, And their widows shall not weep
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei arih hlot lu sư kư̆m gô lôch kơ tơdrong jĭ hơbuh, Mă akăn adro lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: Though he heaps up silver like dust, And piles up clothing like clay
Bahnar: Mă lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ mong jên hu nhen thoi pơlao chuơh, Hơdrom hơbĕn ao hơlôk thoi pôi teh lơ̆n.

English: He may pile it up, but the just will wear it, And the innocent will divide the silver.
Bahnar: Hơbĕn ao lu sư chơ̆p hơdrom, mă-lei lu bơngai tơpăt sư gô hrŭk Jên hu lu sư, bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô asong băl.

English: He builds his house like a moth, Like a booth which a watchman makes.
Bahnar: Hnam lu sư pơm, nhen thoi wai dŭng Thoi pơk đe pơm gô mir.

English: The rich man will lie down, But not be gathered up; He opens his eyes, And he is no more.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bĭch tep, mơdrŏng hiôk, hnam oei 'lơ̆ng. Lăp lu sư lar măt hnam ưh pă đei dơ̆ng.

English: Terrors overtake him like a flood; A tempest steals him away in the night.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli krưp truh tơ lu sư nhen thoi đak lơ̆p; Kial hơbŭt kơmăng puh pơđông lê̆ lu sư.

English: The east wind carries him away, and he is gone; It sweeps him out of his place.
Bahnar: Kial đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch tơthu anhăk lu sư, na hiong hloi. Pơđông lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng anih lu sư oei.

English: It hurls against him and does not spare; He flees desperately from its power.
Bahnar: Huơ̆r pơdăr lu sư, ưh pă đei mơnat kơ lu sư; Lu sư adrin kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng kial tih.

English: Men shall clap their hands at him, And shall hiss him out of his place.
Bahnar: Kial oei bah tơ lu sư thoi đe tap ti che bơle Păng hơhôch pơklai puh lu sư đơ̆ng anih lu sư oei.

English: “Surely there is a mine for silver, And a place where gold is refined.
Bahnar: Hu đei lăm sơlŭng đe sir iŏk, maih đei anih đe 'buh sư.

English: Iron is taken from the earth, And copper is smelted from ore.
Bahnar: Bơsei đe iŏk đơ̆ng lăm teh, Đe rơ̆ tơmo na đei kong.

English: Man puts an end to darkness, And searches every recess For ore in the darkness and the shadow of death.
Bahnar: Bơngai jang lăm sơlŭng nhơk hơdah tơ lăm măng mu Bŏk sir jơ̆p tơ lăm sơlŭng Wă chă tơmo tơ lăm teh măng mu gueo.

English: He breaks open a shaft away from people; In places forgotten by feet They hang far away from men; They swing to and fro.
Bahnar: Đe sir trong sơlŭng ataih đơ̆ng anih kon bơngai oei, Tơ lăm anih rơwơ̆ng ưh kơ đei jơ̆ng bơngai bu năm truh; Lu sư chô̆ hơtol akâu hăm tơlei bơ̆jang ataih kơ bơngai nai.

English: As for the earth, from it comes bread, But underneath it is turned up as by fire
Bahnar: Hơnik hơnam chăt đơ̆ng teh. Mă-lei lăm ala teh đei tơplih nhen thoi đêl ŭnh oei sa tơdrŏ.

English: Its stones are the source of sapphires, And it contains gold dust.
Bahnar: Lăm lu tơmo đei tơmo gĭt, đei rang maih lăm noh.

English: That path no bird knows, Nor has the falcon’s eye seen it.
Bahnar: Sem chă choh sa ưh kơ băt trong 'nâu; Măt sem klang chă kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh

English: The proud lions have not trodden it, Nor has the fierce lion passed over it.
Bahnar: Sem bri tam mă năm juă dăm-brang kư̆m ưh kơ năm rok noh.

English: He puts his hand on the flint; He overturns the mountains at the roots.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai gơh teh blah tơmo ŭnh, Sir bơlih lu jơ̆ng kông.

English: He cuts out channels in the rocks, And his eye sees every precious thing.
Bahnar: Mưh bŏk tơmo wă pơih trong sơlŭng. Măt lu sư chă lăng lu tơmo gĭt tơ lăm noh.

English: He dams up the streams from trickling; What is hidden he brings forth to light.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai bơ̆ bơnơ̆ găn đak krong wă huay kơ ro; Wă kơ 'bôh lĕch tơ hơdah dôm tơmam kiơ mă ôn hlơp.

English: “But where can wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
Bahnar: Mă-lei chă tơdrong gơh hơgei đei đơ̆ng yơ? Tơ yơ tơm tơdrong hlôh wao?

English: Man does not know its value, Nor is it found in the land of the living.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai ưh kơ băt trong ba truh tơ tơdrong gĭt gơh hơgei.a Ưh kơ gơh chă tơdrong hơgei tơ kơpal teh âu.

English: The deep says, ‘It is not in me’; And the sea says, ‘It is not with me.’
Bahnar: Đak jrŭ khan: “Sư ưh kơ đei tơ lăm inh,” Đak dơsĭ khan: “Sư ưh kơ đei oei hơdai hăm inh.”

English: It cannot be purchased for gold, Nor can silver be weighed for its price.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ gơh iŏk kơtuăl maih wă tơplih iŏk sư, Kŭm ưh kơ gơh kŏng iŏk hu na gơh răt sư.

English: It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir, In precious onyx or sapphire.
Bahnar: Kŭm ưh kơ gơh hơgăt 'long gĭt sư hăm maih Ôphir tơmo gĭt ônik dah hăm tơmo gĭt saphir.

English: Neither gold nor crystal can equal it, Nor can it be exchanged for jewelry of fine gold.
Bahnar: Maih dah Phalê ưh kơ gơh pơting hăm sư, Tơmam pơm păng maih kư̆m ưh kơ gơh tơplih iŏk sư

English: No mention shall be made of coral or quartz, For the price of wisdom is above rubies.
Bahnar: Mă tơmo pơkao gĭt lăm đak dơsĭ păng kơmĭl, ưh pă pơma truh dơ̆ng bơih. Tơdrong gơh hơgei gĭt hloh kơ tơmo gôh.

English: The topaz of Ethiopia cannot equal it, Nor can it be valued in pure gold.
Bahnar: Jơmŏng char Êthiôpi ưh kơ gơh pơting hăm sư ôh; Kŭm ưh kơ đei layơ hơgăt 'long gĭt sư hăm maih se.

English: “From where then does wisdom come? And where is the place of understanding?
Bahnar: Lei tơdrong gơh hơgei lĕch đơ̆ng yơ? Tơm 'bơ̆r đon hlôh wao đơ̆ng yơ?

English: It is hidden from the eyes of all living, And concealed from the birds of the air.
Bahnar: Gơh hơgei oei klơ̆p ôn lê̆ măt lu bơngai arih, Mă măt lu sem păr kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh.

English: Destruction and Death say, ‘We have heard a report about it with our ears.’
Bahnar: Hơlŭng jrŭ păng tơdrong lôch khan: “Đon lu nhôn đei kơtơ̆ng ang bơih đe roi.”

English: God understands its way, And He knows its place.
Bahnar: Lăp minh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hlôh băt trong truh tơ gơh hơgei. Păng minh Sư đĕch băt kơ chă anih sư tơ yơ.

English: For He looks to the ends of the earth, And sees under the whole heavens
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư lăng 'bôh tôch kơ teh, Păng 'bôh nhen jơ̆p kơpal teh đak ala plĕnh.

English: To establish a weight for the wind, And apportion the waters by measure.
Bahnar: Layơ Sư ăn tơdrong kơtang kơ kial. Gơh kŏng tơng lăng đak.

English: When He made a law for the rain, And a path for the thunderbolt
Bahnar: Layơ Sư hơgăt ăn tơdrong juăt kơ bơyan 'mi, Pơih ăn trong kơ grơ̆m glaih.

English: Then He saw wisdom and declared it; He prepared it, indeed, He searched it out.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Kră Yang 'bôh tơdrong hơgei, păng tơbăt tơlĕch, ăn kơ đĭ-đăng rim bơngai athei mơ̆ng, Kră Yang lăng hơlen păng pơm sư kơjăp.

English: And to man He said, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom, And to depart from evil is understanding.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ kon bơngai “Hli yom kơ Kră Yang, noh bơih tơdrong gơh hơgei; Weh ataih đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆, 'noh bơih tơdrong hlôh wao.”

English: Job further continued his discourse, and said
Bahnar: Jop pơma dơ̆ng

English: “Oh, that I were as in months past, As in the days when God watched over me
Bahnar: Ôi hơpơi rŏ kơ inh gơh arih dơ̆ng thoi lĕ khei 'năr ki sơ̆, 'Bơ̆t mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei wei-lăng inh

English: When His lamp shone upon my head, And when by His light I walked through darkness
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah ŭnh kơđeng Kră Yang oei pơchrang hơdah kơpal kơ̆l inh. Đơ̆ng tơdrong hơdah Kră Yang na inh năm hlôi kơ măng mu.

English: Just as I was in the days of my prime, When the friendly counsel of God was over my tent
Bahnar: Ô! Kơplah inh oei đei 'bôh lăm inh oei mơlôh. Kơplah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm buăl juăt tơgŭm dŏng hnam inh.

English: When the Almighty was yet with me, When my children were around me
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang Tih Hloh oei oei hăm inh, lu kon hơ'lơ̆p inh tăp dăr kơ inh

English: When my steps were bathed with cream, And the rock poured out rivers of oil for me!
Bahnar: Kơplah jơ̆ng inh yak tong lăm đak toh, Păng đak rơmă ôliwơ lĕch ro thoi glung đơ̆ng tơpăl tơmo hmĕt.

English: “When I went out to the gate by the city, When I took my seat in the open square
Bahnar: Kơplah noh inh lĕch năm tơ 'măng jang pơlei, Hơmet anih hơ-oei lăm cham anih juăt akŭm.

English: The young men saw me and hid, And the aged arose and stood
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơdăm 'bôh inh lu sư kơdŭn weh, Lu bơngai kră iung dang dơ̆ng

English: The princes refrained from talking, And put their hand on their mouth
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kră pơgơ̆r pă đei pơma, lu sư kơđôp 'bơ̆r hăm tơpang ti

English: The voice of nobles was hushed, And their tongue stuck to the roof of their mouth.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai yŏng ngăn hreh thĕng. Hơpiĕt lu sư klep tơ păk-'ngơk.

English: When the ear heard, then it blessed me, And when the eye saw, then it approved me
Bahnar: Đon bu kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r inh na khan pơư inh đei pŭn hiôk. Măt bu 'bôh inh bơnê kơ inh hloi.

English: Because I delivered the poor who cried out, The fatherless and the one who had no helper.
Bahnar: 'Noh yua kơ inh dŏng pơklaih bơngai dơnuh pơmat-tat krao ôr, Păng bơngai mơti ưh kơ đei bơngai bu tơgŭm.

English: The blessing of a perishing man came upon me, And I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
Bahnar: Bơngai wă jê̆ lôch sơkat tuh ăn kơ inh pŭn hiôk. Đơ̆ng inh, jơhngơ̆m bơngai adro chơt hiôk.

English: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me; My justice was like a robe and a turban.
Bahnar: Inh hrŭk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt thoi ao. Tơdrong tơpăt inh sư thoi kơ ao tai păng che tơ̆n.

English: I was eyes to the blind, And I was feet to the lame.
Bahnar: Inh thoi lĕ măt ăn kơ lu bơngai tol, păng thoi jơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai jo.

English: I was a father to the poor, And I searched out the case that I did not know.
Bahnar: Inh pơm 'bă kơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat, Inh lăng hơlen sek dŏng lu bơngai inh tam lah băt.

English: I broke the fangs of the wicked, And plucked the victim from his teeth.
Bahnar: Inh teh tơgơ̆ lê̆ grĕng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Hek pơdŭng iŏk tơmam sa đơ̆ng hơnĕnh sư.

English: “Then I said, ‘I shall die in my nest, And multiply my days as the sand.
Bahnar: Inh tơchĕng khan: “Inh gô lôch lăm anih tơpu inh; Năr inh gô rai lơ thoi chuơh đak dơsĭ;”

English: My root is spread out to the waters, And the dew lies all night on my branch.
Bahnar: Rơh inh hro sôr kơjung truh tơ cheng đak, dơng hla hngôm kơ đak ngom kơmăng

English: My glory is fresh within me, And my bow is renewed in my hand.’
Bahnar: Inh đei ư-ang 'nao ling-lang, Jơhngơ̆m pran inh 'bĕnh-'bang thoi hră 'nao lăm ti inh.

English: “Men listened to me and waited, And kept silence for my counsel.
Bahnar: Đon đe oei mơ̆ng răp gô inh, oei hreh mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh pơđâu.

English: After my words they did not speak again, And my speech settled on them as dew.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh pơma, lu sư ưh pă đei bu pơma dơ̆ng bơih; Nơ̆r inh pơma mơ̆t jrŭ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư.

English: They waited for me as for the rain, And they opened their mouth wide as for the spring rain.
Bahnar: Lu sư chang gô inh nhen thoi chang gô đak 'mi, Lu sư bơngai ha 'bơ̆r jrŏng đak 'mi klui.

English: If I mocked at them, they did not believe it, And the light of my countenance they did not cast down.
Bahnar: Inh hiĕk yôp pơlung lu sư 'bơ̆t lu sư rơdu. Muh măt hơdah inh tơgŭm tơiung lu sư.

English: I chose the way for them, and sat as chief; So I dwelt as a king in the army, As one who comforts mourners.
Bahnar: Inh chă trong ăn kơ lu sư, inh pơgơ̆r lu sư. Inh oei hơdai lu sư thoi pơtao oei lăm lu khŭl linh. Thoi bơngai pơlung đe ơh kơ lôch.

English: “But now they mock at me, men younger than I, Whose fathers I disdained to put with the dogs of my flock.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei, lu sư hiĕk ăr kơ inh, lu sư tơdăm 'lơ̆p hloh kơ inh, Mă 'bă lu sư, inh pă jô̆ bơih, wă jang wei triu. Hơdai hăm kŏ inh.

English: Indeed, what profit is the strength of their hands to me? Their vigor has perished.
Bahnar: Ti pran kơtang lu sư hăm đei yua kiơ kơ inh, Mưh jơhngơ̆m pran lu sư, pă đei bơih?

English: They are gaunt from want and famine, Fleeing late to the wilderness, desolate and waste
Bahnar: Hơkĕ hơkong pơngot rơwĕt kơ'bah kơ'bôch, Thông hoang lăm teh hrĕng kro. Lăm bri rơwơ̆ng juơ juŏ.

English: Who pluck mallow by the bushes, And broom tree roots for their food.
Bahnar: Lu sư phĕ hla 'long pơgang, păng lu hơmŭl 'long bri. Rơh tơlei 'long bri pơm tơmam sa lu sư.

English: They were driven out from among men, They shouted at them as at a thief.
Bahnar: Đe puh tơweh lu sư đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei; Đe hil hiap lu sư thoi lu bơngai tơtông.

English: They had to live in the clefts of the valleys, In caves of the earth and the rocks.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei rok lăm thong cheng kông, Lăm trôm lăm teh, dah lăm sơlam lu hơgơp tơmo.

English: Among the bushes they brayed, Under the nettles they nestled.
Bahnar: Lu sư krao ôr tơ lăm rơ̆m tơnơm 'long, Lu sư 'bĭch hơlun băl ala lu bơmreh jơla.

English: They were sons of fools, Yes, sons of vile men; They were scourged from the land.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch ưh kơ gơh yua anăn sơnăm ưh kơ đei. Đe areh teh pơpuh tơlĕch lê̆ đơ̆ng lăm char.

English: “And now I am their taunting song; Yes, I am their byword.
Bahnar: Na dang ei kon sâu lu sư hơri jô̆ pơjăm inh, Roi 'bơm che bơle kơ inh.

English: They abhor me, they keep far from me; They do not hesitate to spit in my face.
Bahnar: Lu sư lăng inh krưp 'brơ̆, weh ataih kơ inh, Ưh pă hĕo gơsoh đak hai kơ muh măt inh.

English: Because He has loosed my bowstring and afflicted me, They have cast off restraint before me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yaih lê̆ dơhiĕng hră inh rơdu păng pơm kơ inh mơlâu. Na lu sư pă đei pơyom kiơ kơ inh.

English: At my right hand the rabble arises; They push away my feet, And they raise against me their ways of destruction.
Bahnar: Gah 'ma kơ inh, minh khŭl bơngai kơlĕl iung blah; Blah inh kơdâu tơrơ. Sir sơlŭng wă pơrăm inh.

English: They break up my path, They promote my calamity; They have no helper.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơrăm lê̆ trong inh, Inh rai răm lu sư rai tŏk. Lu sư ưh kơ kăl bơngai pơdŏng.

English: They come as broad breakers; Under the ruinous storm they roll along.
Bahnar: Lu sư blư truh hloi đơ̆ng trong đak hlôh tih. Lu sư blŭng mơ̆t grŏl rok đêl tơnăr hơlih.

English: Terrors are turned upon me; They pursue my honor as the wind, And my prosperity has passed like a cloud.
Bahnar: Lu tơdrong hli krưp năm pơm kơ inh, Đe tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong ư-ang đe pơyom kơ inh tơthu pơđông lê̆ tơ ataih. Tơdrong hiôk hơđơ̆ng inh păr đông thoi hơmơ̆l.

English: “And now my soul is poured out because of my plight; The days of affliction take hold of me.
Bahnar: Dang ei, tơdrong arih inh pơchah hach bơih, Năr pơmat-tat truh bơih tơ inh

English: My bones are pierced in me at night, And my gnawing pains take no rest.
Bahnar: Kơmăng đei tơdrong jĭ truh tơ kơting inh, Tơdrong jĭ rĕn sa inh, ưh kơ pơdơh.

English: By great force my garment is disfigured; It binds me about as the collar of my coat.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơsêh tih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, rôp pơdŭng ao inh. Chô̆ gơhret inh thoi chô̆ hơko ao.

English: He has cast me into the mire, And I have become like dust and ashes.
Bahnar: Kră Yang klơ̆m inh tơ teh trôk. Inh nhen thoi 'mui tơnuh.

English: “I cry out to You, but You do not answer me; I stand up, and You regard me.
Bahnar: Inh krao apinh, mă-lei Ih ưh kơ đei tơl; Inh dơ̆ng tơ noh, mă-lei Ih pă 'maih lăng tơ inh.

English: But You have become cruel to me; With the strength of Your hand You oppose me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jing pơm kơnê̆ hăm inh, Iŏk ti mơsêh Ih druh blah inh.

English: You lift me up to the wind and cause me to ride on it; You spoil my success.
Bahnar: Ih ăn kial pơđông lê̆ inh tơ ataih. Ih pơpuh pơđông lê̆ inh hăm kial hơbŭt.

English: For I know that You will bring me to death, And to the house appointed for all living.
Bahnar: Inh băt tơpă Ih wă ba inh tơ tơdrong lôch. Anih pơkă wă 'măn kơ lu bơngai arih.

English: “Surely He would not stretch out His hand against a heap of ruins, If they cry out when He destroys it.
Bahnar: Tơpă ưh kơ đei bu yơ̆r ti pơrăm lu bơngai đei tơdrong gleh truh. Sư krao dŏng pơklaih, kơplah oei lăm anih pơmat-tat

English: Have I not wept for him who was in trouble? Has not my soul grieved for the poor?
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei nhơ̆m kơ bơngai tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong pơmat-tat hă? Jơhngơ̆m inh ưh kơ đei sơ'ngon kơ bơngai răm-'băm hă?

English: But when I looked for good, evil came to me; And when I waited for light, then came darkness.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t mă inh răp gô tơdrong pŭn hiôk, tơdrong pơmat-tat truh; 'Bơ̆t mă inh chang tơdrong hơdah, tơdrong măng mu truh.

English: My heart is in turmoil and cannot rest; Days of affliction confront me.
Bahnar: Inh ơh sơ'ngon klơm klak inh hŏnh bop đĭ pă hiôk, Lu tơdrong pơmat truh hơlôk hơlak.

English: I go about mourning, but not in the sun; I stand up in the assembly and cry out for help.
Bahnar: Inh năm akâu găm đĭ. Ưh kơ trŏ yua kơ tŏ sa. Inh iung dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk tơpôl păng krao apinh dŏng pơklaih.

English: I am a brother of jackals, And a companion of ostriches.
Bahnar: Inh jing 'nhŏng oh hăm kŏ bri, Bôl juăt hăm sem chhơng.

English: My skin grows black and falls from me; My bones burn with fever.
Bahnar: Akar inh jing găm păng tơlŏng akâu jăn inh yuh tơtŏ kơ chĕp bơlŏ.

English: My harp is turned to mourning, And my flute to the voice of those who weep.
Bahnar: Inh reh brŏ tĭng-nĭng lăm ơh sơ'ngon. Inh hlôm 'lal hăm re nơ̆r nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: “I have made a covenant with my eyes; Why then should I look upon a young woman?
Bahnar: Inh đei pơgơ̆p hăm măt inh; Inh ưh pă lăng tơ bơngai adruh hle.

English: For what is the allotment of God from above, And the inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
Bahnar: Thoi 'noh mơ̆ng kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ăn kơ inh tơmam kiơ. Mŭk tơmam kiơ đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh?

English: Is it not destruction for the wicked, And disaster for the workers of iniquity?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong gleh truh? Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đei pơmat-tat?

English: Does He not see my ways, And count all my steps?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Sư 'bôh trong inh yak, Păng jô̆ dôm inh yak nơnăm?

English: “If I have walked with falsehood, Or if my foot has hastened to deceit
Bahnar: Tơdah inh đei năm hơdai hăm lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr Dah jơ̆ng inh hăt hot yak kiơ̆ trong lu bơngai bơkuĕch.

English: Let me be weighed on honest scales, That God may know my integrity.
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dan inh tơ kơpal 'long kŏng mă trŏ, Na Sư gô băt kơ inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: If my step has turned from the way, Or my heart walked after my eyes, Or if any spot adheres to my hands
Bahnar: Tơdah jơ̆ng inh yak weh đơ̆ng trong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Tơdah jơhngơ̆m inh năm kiơ̆ măt inh lăng, Tơdah đei mơgrĭ klep lăm ti inh

English: Then let me sow, and another eat; Yes, let my harvest be rooted out.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ bơngai nai sa mă đơ̆ng inh rei, Ăn kơ lu sư buch lê̆ đêl inh pơtăm.

English: “If my heart has been enticed by a woman, Or if I have lurked at my neighbor’s door
Bahnar: Tơdah jơhngơ̆m inh hưch huŏng kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn, Tơdah inh năm chop răp tơ 'măng hnam sư.

English: Then let my wife grind for another, And let others bow down over her.
Bahnar: Ăn akăn inh peh ăn kơ đe 'ba. Păng lê̆ kơ đe 'bĭch hơdai hăm sư.

English: For that would be wickedness; Yes, it would be iniquity deserving of judgment.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'noh glăi yoch trăp tih dêh. Trŏ kơ sek tơlang phak

English: For that would be a fire that consumes to destruction, And would root out all my increase.
Bahnar: Yoch noh bơih mă thoi ŭnh sa kơdơ̆r lăm dơnâu ŭnh. Sa pơrăm đĭ truh tơ rơh dôm hơnik hơnam mă inh đei.

English: “If I have despised the cause of my male or female servant When they complained against me
Bahnar: Tơdah inh đei pơdê tơdrong 'măn ăn kơ đĭch đam drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn inh, Kơplah lu sư pơma jŏk kơ inh.

English: What then shall I do when God rises up? When He punishes, how shall I answer Him?
Bahnar: Na inh wă pơm liơ mưh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iung sek tơlang inh? Truh tơ Sư apinh jet inh. Inh gô tơl Sư lơliơ?

English: Did not He who made me in the womb make them? Did not the same One fashion us in the womb?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Tơ'ngla pơjing inh lăm klak mĕ inh, kư̆m pơjing lu sư hai? Hăm trŏ lăp minh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch pơjing kơ lu yŏng păng lu đĭch?

English: “If I have kept the poor from their desire, Or caused the eyes of the widow to fail
Bahnar: Tơdah inh sơngah ưh kơ ăn ôh tơmam kơ bơngai dơnuh dơnan hơpơi wă, Tơdah inh lê̆ bơngai adro chang gô dĭng pă hơmĕng.

English: Or eaten my morsel by myself, So that the fatherless could not eat of it
Bahnar: Tơdah inh sa hơdrô̆ minh 'nu inh. Ưh kơ asong bơngai mơti

English: (But from my youth I reared him as a father, And from my mother’s womb I guided the widow)
Bahnar: tơpă mơti đơ̆ng oei nge inh 'me rong sư thoi 'bă. Inh chông anhăk bơtho tơ'bôh đơ̆ng mĕ sư 'nao tơpŭ kơ sư.

English: If I have seen anyone perish for lack of clothing, Or any poor man without covering
Bahnar: Tơdah inh 'bôh bơngai wă jê̆ lôch yua ưh kơ đei hơbĕn ao, Dah bơngai dơnuh kơ'bah ưh kơ đei khăn su

English: If his heart has not blessed me, And if he was not warmed with the fleece of my sheep
Bahnar: tơdah lu sư ưh kơ đĭ jơhngơ̆m sơkat pŭn hiôk kơ inh, kơplah lu sư gơh tơnŏ đơ̆ng sŏk triu inh

English: If I have raised my hand against the fatherless, When I saw I had help in the gate
Bahnar: Tơdah inh đei yơ̆r ti hơ-ô wă pơm kơ lu bơngai mơti, yua kơ inh băt bơngai dŏng inh tơ 'măng jang

English: Then let my arm fall from my shoulder, Let my arm be torn from the socket.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ hơngiĕng inh tơhleh đơ̆ng akâu inh, Păng kơkŏng ti inh tơgơ̆ kơtĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆t kŭl-keng.

English: For destruction from God is a terror to me, And because of His magnificence I cannot endure.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh hli kơ tơdrong răm truh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Inh hli krưp kơ tơdrong rang mơnhal Sư na inh ưh kơ layơ pơm tơdrong noh.

English: “If I have made gold my hope, Or said to fine gold, ‘You are my confidence’
Bahnar: Tơdah inh gơnang kơ maih păng krao maih rơgoh khan anih inh gơneh gơnơm

English: If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great, And because my hand had gained much
Bahnar: tơdah inh hiôk chơt kơ mŭk drăm lơ, dah yua kơ đơ̆ng ti inh đei chă lơ tơmam.

English: If I have observed the sun when it shines, Or the moon moving in brightness
Bahnar: Tơdah inh lăng tơ măt 'năr pơchrang hơdah Păng măt khei lĕch pơchrang hơdah hơdong rơđah

English: So that my heart has been secretly enticed, And my mouth has kissed my hand
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh đei pơhlŭ hơgơ̆m, păng 'bơ̆r inh chŭm chro ti inh rôp kơkuh pơyom

English: This also would be an iniquity deserving of judgment, For I would have denied God who is above.
Bahnar: tơdrong 'noh minh tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ trŏ kơ sek pơlôch, Yua kơ inh sơngah kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kơpal ti.

English: “If I have rejoiced at the destruction of him who hated me, Or lifted myself up when evil found him
Bahnar: Tơdah inh hiôk chơt yua kơ bơngai areh kơ inh đei tơdrong răm truh, Păng chhôk hơnôk kơplah lu sư đei tơdrong pơmat-tat

English: (Indeed I have not allowed my mouth to sin By asking for a curse on his soul)
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ ăn 'bơ̆r inh pơm yoch, Hiap pơtê̆ kơ tơdrong arih sư.

English: If the men of my tent have not said, ‘Who is there that has not been satisfied with his meat?’
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lăm hnam dơnŏ inh ưh kơ đei pơma: “Hăm đei bu mă Jop ưh kơ đei ăn sa 'nhĕm phĭ mah?”

English: (But no sojourner had to lodge in the street, For I have opened my doors to the traveler)
Bahnar: Bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ đei tep kơmăng tơ 'nguaih tơ trong; Inh pơih 'măng sơng bơngai tơmoi đơ̆ng ataih

English: If I have covered my transgressions as Adam, By hiding my iniquity in my bosom
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei ôn tơdrong yoch inh thoi Ađam. Na 'bŭ ôn tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Because I feared the great multitude, And dreaded the contempt of families, So that I kept silence And did not go out of the door
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh hli dêh kơ lu bơngai tơpôl, hli krê kơ adrĕch adrung che bơle, dĭng mah ngăn hreh, ưh kơ pơ̆n lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ 'măng.

English: Oh, that I had one to hear me! Here is my mark. Oh, that the Almighty would answer me, That my Prosecutor had written a book!
Bahnar: Ơ! Rŏ kơ đei bơngai mơ̆ng inh! 'Nâu inh chă kĭ chih anăn inh apinh Kră Yang Tih Hloh tơl nơ̆r inh; Apinh bơngai jâu inh chih tơ'bôh tơdrong yoch inh!

English: Surely I would carry it on my shoulder, And bind it on me like a crown
Bahnar: Tơpă inh gô tôi tơdrong kơnê̆ 'noh tơ kơpal hơngiĕng inh. Yơ̆l sư thoi môk pơtao.

English: I would declare to Him the number of my steps; Like a prince I would approach Him.
Bahnar: Inh gô roi pơdah ăn kơ Kră Yang dôm tơdrong inh pơm. Inh gô năm 'bơ̆t anăp Sư nhen thoi minh 'nu kon pơtao.

English: “If my land cries out against me, And its furrows weep together
Bahnar: Tơdah teh mir na inh ôr krao jâu inh, dôm trong rơuơ sư wang nhơ̆m

English: If I have eaten its fruit without money, Or caused its owners to lose their lives
Bahnar: Tơdah inh iŏk sa tơmam sư mă ưh kơ ăn jên, Pơm ăn kơ tơ'ngla sư lôch kơ pơngot

English: Then let thistles grow instead of wheat, And weeds instead of barley.” The words of Job are ended.
Bahnar: Lei apinh tơm jơla chăt tơplih kơ tơm 'ba, păng 'nhĕt tơplih ăn kơ 'ba tơ'bâu. Truh dâu đĭ nơ̆r Jop.

English: So these three men ceased answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
Bahnar: Pêng 'nu bơngai 'noh ưh pă đei tơl nơ̆r Jop, yua kơ Jop khan kơ kơdih bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Then the wrath of Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was aroused against Job; his wrath was aroused because he justified himself rather than God.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Êlihu, kon drŏ-nglo Barakel, bơngai Busit, adrĕch adrung Ram, Sư hil kơ Jop, yua kơ Jop khan sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hloh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng.

English: Also against his three friends his wrath was aroused, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
Bahnar: Êlihu kư̆m hil blĕk kơ pêng 'nu buăl Jop yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ đei wă tơl tơwih, na jâu khan Jop yoch đĕch.

English: Now because they were years older than he, Elihu had waited to speak to Job.
Bahnar: Êlihu oei răp gô wă tơl nơ̆r Jop, yua kơ pêng 'nu bơngai 'noh 'lŏ kơ sư ngăl.

English: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, his wrath was aroused.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Êlihu 'bôh pêng 'nu noh ưh pă đei tơl tơwih nơ̆r kiơ bơih, tơdrong blĕk sư iung hloi.

English: So Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, answered and said: “I am young in years, and you are very old; Therefore I was afraid, And dared not declare my opinion to you.
Bahnar: Êlihu, kon drŏ-nglo Barakel, bơngai Busit iung pơma: “Inh oei 'lơ̆p lu iĕm bơngai kră ngăl bơih inh 'nhrơ̆ hli, Ưh kơ pơ̆n roi ăn kơ lu iĕm tơdrong kiơ inh băt.

English: I said, ‘Age should speak, And multitude of years should teach wisdom.’
Bahnar: Inh tơchĕng khan: ‘Lu 'lŏ kăl kơ pơma, Lu bơngai kră gô bơtho tơdrong gơh hơgei.’

English: But there is a spirit in man, And the breath of the Almighty gives him understanding.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei Yang bơhngol 'lơ̆ng oei lăm kon bơngai, Păng hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m Kră Yang Tih Hloh ăn kơ sư tơdrong hlôh gơh hơgei.

English: Great men are not always wise, Nor do the aged always understand justice.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ bơngai 'lŏ kră khan gơh hơgei, Lu bơngai kră kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ khan băt hlôh tơdrong trŏ.

English: “Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me, I also will declare my opinion.’
Bahnar: Na inh khan: Mơ̆ng inh bĕ; Inh kư̆m wă gô tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm inh băt tơdrong kiơ.

English: Indeed I waited for your words, I listened to your reasonings, while you searched out what to say.
Bahnar: Inh răp gô mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r iĕm pơma, Pơgling đon mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r lu iĕm tơ'bôh tơdrong gơh hơgei, Kơplah iĕm chă nơ̆r ayơ wă tơl.

English: I paid close attention to you; And surely not one of you convinced Job, Or answered his words
Bahnar: Inh adrin pơgling đon mơ̆ng lu iĕm pơma, Mă-lei ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu lăm lu iĕm kĕ kơ Jop, Wă tơ'bôh kơ sư đei yoch. Dah gơh tơl nơ̆r sư.

English: Lest you say, ‘We have found wisdom’; God will vanquish him, not man.
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ 'nĕ hăt pơma khan: ‘Lu nhôn chă 'bôh bơih tơdrong gơh hơgei; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh tơ'bôh kơ Jop, kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh tơ'bôh.’

English: Now he has not directed his words against me; So I will not answer him with your words.
Bahnar: Jop ưh kơ đei pơjah pơjăng hăm inh, Na lei, inh ưh kơ tơl tơwih kơ sư thoi nơ̆r lu iĕm.

English: “They are dismayed and answer no more; Words escape them.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơdrôt hli ưh pă gơh tơl nơ̆r kiơ dơ̆ng; Lu sư đĭ pă đei nơ̆r bơih

English: And I have waited, because they did not speak, Because they stood still and answered no more.
Bahnar: Inh hăm wă gô dơ̆ng, lu sư đĭ pă pơma bơih, Lu sư oei tơ noh đĭ ưh pă đei tơl nơ̆r bơih?

English: I also will answer my part, I too will declare my opinion.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m lei-lăi gô tơl nơ̆r mơ̆n; Inh kư̆m wă roi tơdrong inh băt

English: For I am full of words; The spirit within me compels me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh đei lơ nơ̆r wă pơma, lăm jơhngơ̆m inh pơdrŭt inh pơma.

English: Indeed my belly is like wine that has no vent; It is ready to burst like new wineskins.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh nhen thoi Sik hơmu blôk ưh kơ đei trong lĕch. Wă jê̆ pơchah thoi kơdŭng sik 'nao.

English: I will speak, that I may find relief; I must open my lips and answer.
Bahnar: Inh wă 'maih pơma wă gơh rơhơi jơhngơ̆m 'biơ̆. Inh gô ha 'bơ̆r pơma păng tơl nơ̆r.

English: Let me not, I pray, show partiality to anyone; Nor let me flatter any man.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei 'mêm kơ mah kah kơ hu ôh, Kŭm ưh kơ đei pôk hơtŏk bơngai ayơ.

English: For I do not know how to flatter, Else my Maker would soon take me away.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh ưh kơ băt pôk hơtŏk bu. Tơdah đei, Tơ'ngla pơjing inh pơlôch inh hloi.”

English: “But please, Job, hear my speech, And listen to all my words.
Bahnar: “Ơ Jop, apinh ih mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh pơma. Pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ dôm nơ̆r inh pơma.

English: Now, I open my mouth; My tongue speaks in my mouth.
Bahnar: 'Nâu inh ha bơih 'bơ̆r, nơ̆r inh pơma lăm hơpiĕt inh bơih.

English: My words come from my upright heart; My lips utter pure knowledge.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r inh pơma gô lĕch tơdrong tơpăt đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m. Hơkŭng inh gô pơma hăm tơdrong hlôh wao tơpăt sĭt.

English: The Spirit of God has made me, And the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
Bahnar: Yang bơhngol 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing inh bơih, Hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m Kră Yang Tih Hloh ăn kơ inh arih.

English: If you can answer me, Set your words in order before me; Take your stand.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih gơh tơl bĕ nơ̆r inh iung dơ̆ng ră roi bĕ dôm nơ̆r trŏ wă dŏng ih 'bơ̆t anăp inh!

English: Truly I am as your spokesman before God; I also have been formed out of clay.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh kư̆m thoi ih Sư kư̆m man pơjing inh hăm teh lơ̆n.

English: Surely no fear of me will terrify you, Nor will my hand be heavy on you.
Bahnar: Apinh ih 'nĕ kơ hli kơ kiơ kiơ. Inh ưh kơ đei pơma kơtĭt trăp tơ ih.

English: “Surely you have spoken in my hearing, And I have heard the sound of your words, saying
Bahnar: Tơpă đon inh đei kơtơ̆ng bơih nơ̆r ih pơma, Inh mơ̆ng bơih nơ̆r ih pơma

English: ‘I am pure, without transgression; I am innocent, and there is no iniquity in me.
Bahnar: ‘Inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, ưh kơ đei pơm glăi; Inh ưh kơ đei yoch, ưh kơlah pơm yoch.

English: Yet He finds occasions against me, He counts me as His enemy
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chă tơdrong yoch inh, Sư pơm kơ inh thoi bơngai ayăt.

English: He puts my feet in the stocks, He watches all my paths.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang hơnuh lê̆ jơ̆ng inh. Răp lăng rim trong inh yak.’

English: “Look, in this you are not righteous. I will answer you, For God is greater than man.
Bahnar: Inh tơl, ih pơma thoi noh glăi. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tih hloh kơ kon bơngai.

English: Why do you contend with Him? For He does not give an accounting of any of His words.
Bahnar: Liơ ih pơjah pơjăng hăm Sư? Chrih kơ Sư khan ưh kơ tơl nơ̆r ih.

English: For God may speak in one way, or in another, Yet man does not perceive it.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma bơtho lơ 'măng, lơ tơdrong Mă-lei kon bơngai bơ̆n ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng

English: In a dream, in a vision of the night, When deep sleep falls upon men, While slumbering on their beds
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong apo, lăm tơdrong tơ'bôh tơ kơmăng. Kơplah kon bơngai oei tep hlơ̆k, 'Bĭch tep tơ kơpal giơng sư

English: Then He opens the ears of men, And seals their instruction.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơih đon wă kơ lu sư mơ̆ng. Pơsĭt nơ̆r chrih bơtho tơhli lu sư wă kơchăng.

English: In order to turn man from his deed, And conceal pride from man
Bahnar: Wă kơ kon bơngai weh đơ̆ng tơdrong pơm kơnê̆, păng hŭt lê̆ jơhngơ̆m juăt pơang.

English: He keeps back his soul from the Pit, And his life from perishing by the sword.
Bahnar: Wă dŏng pơklaih bơhngol lu sư đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ, Wă wei tơdrong arih huay kơ lôch răm kơ đao gưm.

English: “Man is also chastened with pain on his bed, And with strong pain in many of his bones
Bahnar: Kră Yang bơtho hơmet kon bơngai hăm tơdrong jĭ jăn dêh 'bĭch păn kơpal giơng, Kơting pơpơ̆ tơtey ling-lang

English: So that his life abhors bread, And his soul succulent food.
Bahnar: Pơm ưh kơ 'maih sŏng sa, kư̆m areh mă tơmam sa 'băt 'lơ̆ng.

English: His flesh wastes away from sight, And his bones stick out which once were not seen.
Bahnar: Akâu akar lu sư hơkĕ hơkong Lăp 'bôh kơting kơtong sĕch akar đĭ klep.

English: Yes, his soul draws near the Pit, And his life to the executioners.
Bahnar: Bơhngol truh bơih 'bơ̆t jê̆ sơlŭng jrŭ. Tơdrong arih oei gô yang lôch năm iŏk.

English: “If there is a messenger for him, A mediator, one among a thousand, To show man His uprightness
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah kơplah 'nâu đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng truh, Lăp minh 'nu lăm rơbâu hơngan linh jang. Wă pơm 'long sơlam bơtho kon bơngai pơm tơdrong trŏ.

English: Then He is gracious to him, and says, ‘Deliver him from going down to the Pit; I have found a ransom’
Bahnar: Mơnat kơ sư na apinh lung Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Dŏng pơklaih sư wă huay kơ huŏng lăm sơlŭng jrŭ, inh chă 'bôh bơih trong huai iŏk.’

English: His flesh shall be young like a child’s, He shall return to the days of his youth.
Bahnar: Na akâu sĕch akar sư rơmuăn nhen thoi oei 'lơ̆p; Jơhngơ̆m pran sư hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng thoi oei mơlôh.

English: He shall pray to God, and He will delight in him, He shall see His face with joy, For He restores to man His righteousness.
Bahnar: Sư krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Kră Yang tơl tơwih. Sư kơkuh kơ Kră Yang hăm tơdrong chơt hiôk. Yua kơ Kră Yang huai iŏk sư.

English: Then he looks at men and says, ‘I have sinned, and perverted what was right, And it did not profit me.’
Bahnar: Sư hat hơri păng roi tơbăt 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng bơngai. ‘Inh pơm yoch bơih yak đŏng đĕo weh đơ̆ng trong tơpăt. Mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei phak kiơ̆ kơ inh yoch.

English: He will redeem his soul from going down to the Pit, And his life shall see the light.
Bahnar: Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih bơhngol inh huay kơ huŏng lăm sơlŭng jrŭ, Ăn kơ tơdrong arih inh chơt hiôk 'bôh hơdah.’
