English: “Behold, God works all these things, Twice, in fact, three times with a man
Bahnar: Tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm tơdrong noh. Kơ kon bơngai kơ băt hơdôm 'măng.

English: To bring back his soul from the Pit, That he may be enlightened with the light of life.
Bahnar: Wă dui iŏk bơhngol kon bơngai klaih đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ. Wă ăn kơ kon bơngai gơh đei arih hơdah pơchrang.

English: “Give ear, Job, listen to me; Hold your peace, and I will speak.
Bahnar: Ơ Jop, mơ̆ng inh bĕ athei oei hreh, mơ̆ng inh pơma.

English: If you have anything to say, answer me; Speak, for I desire to justify you.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih đei tơdrong kiơ 'maih tơl inh; Pơma bĕ, yua kơ inh 'maih 'bôh ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: If not, listen to me; Hold your peace, and I will teach you wisdom.”
Bahnar: Tơdah ưh, athei ih mơ̆ng; Athei oei hreh mơ̆ng inh bơtho tơdrong gơh hơgei.”

English: Elihu further answered and said
Bahnar: Êlihu pơma dơ̆ng

English: “Hear my words, you wise men; Give ear to me, you who have knowledge.
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm khan iĕm bơngai gơh hơgei, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh. Lu iĕm tơchĕng khan iĕm bơngai hlôh wao, pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh pơma.

English: For the ear tests words As the palate tastes food.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đon mơ̆ng kơtơ̆ng băt kơ nơ̆r pơma, thoi hơpiĕt liah mơn 'băt kơ tơmam sa.

English: Let us choose justice for ourselves; Let us know among ourselves what is good.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n hơlen lăng hơdai tơdrong kiơ trŏ, rơih iŏk băt tơdrong kiơ 'lơ̆ng.

English: “For Job has said, ‘I am righteous, But God has taken away my justice
Bahnar: Yua kơ Jop đei khan: ‘Inh bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ jô̆ khan inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Should I lie concerning my right? My wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.’
Bahnar: Mă khan inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ră, đe jô̆ boih inh bơngai pơma hơlĕnh; Mă khan inh ưh kơ đei pơm yoch, rơka inh hơmet kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klaih,’

English: What man is like Job, Who drinks scorn like water
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu thoi Jop, nhă nơ̆r đe pơjăm che bơle thoi kơ đak?

English: Who goes in company with the workers of iniquity, And walks with wicked men?
Bahnar: Sư pơm buăl juăt hăm bơngai pơm kơnê̆ păng năm hơdai hăm bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: For he has said, ‘It profits a man nothing That he should delight in God.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ Jop khan: ‘Kon bơngai ưh kơ đei yua kiơ, Kơplah sư chơchă tơdrong hiôk chơt lăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.’

English: “Therefore listen to me, you men of understanding: Far be it from God to do wickedness, And from the Almighty to commit iniquity.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ inh lu iĕm bơngai hlôh wao. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei layơ pơm kơnê̆, Kră Yang Tih Hloh ưh đei layơ đŏng đĕo.

English: For He repays man according to his work, And makes man to find a reward according to his way.
Bahnar: Kră Yang apah kon bơngai kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang lu sư pơm, Pơm kơ rim 'nu bơngai kiơ̆ kơ lu sư oei arih sa.

English: Surely God will never do wickedly, Nor will the Almighty pervert justice.
Bahnar: Tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei pơm kơnê̆ Kră Yang Tih Hloh ưh đei pơđŏng lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt.

English: Who gave Him charge over the earth? Or who appointed Him over the whole world?
Bahnar: Bu gơh ăn kơ Kră Yang tơdrong wei-lăng plei teh? Bu pơjao ăn kơ Kră Yang pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng teh đak?

English: If He should set His heart on it, If He should gather to Himself His Spirit and His breath
Bahnar: Tơdah Kră Yang pơkă wă pơm. Tơdah Sư pơdrâu iŏk bơhngol păng hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m đơ̆ng Sư kơdih

English: All flesh would perish together, And man would return to dust.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sĕch akar gô lôch hơdai. Păng kon bơngai brŏk tơ 'mui teh.

English: “If you have understanding, hear this; Listen to the sound of my words
Bahnar: Tơdah ih đei tơdrong hlôh hơdah, apinh ih mơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu. Pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh pơma.

English: Should one who hates justice govern? Will you condemn Him who is most just?
Bahnar: Bơngai mă areh kơ tơdrong tơpăt liơ gơh pơgơ̆r? Ih hăm pơ̆n pơma kơ Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Mơsêh Mơyang?

English: Is it fitting to say to a king, ‘You are worthless,’ And to nobles, ‘You are wicked’?
Bahnar: Kră Yang chrih khan kơ pơtao: “Ih tơdrong kơ đei.” Păng khan kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r: “Bơngai pơm kơnê̆.”

English: Yet He is not partial to princes, Nor does He regard the rich more than the poor; For they are all the work of His hands.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ pơư kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r, Kŭm ưh kơ lăng kơ bơngai mơdrŏng hloh kơ bơngai dơnuh; Yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu sư đơ̆ng tơpang ti Kră Yang pơjing ngăl.

English: In a moment they die, in the middle of the night; The people are shaken and pass away; The mighty are taken away without a hand.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ tam băt tŏk-bŏk măng, lu sư lôch hloi. Lu sư pơpơ̆ na lôch. Lu bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r kư̆m lôch, ưh kơ đei đơ̆ng ti kon bơngai ôh.

English: “For His eyes are on the ways of man, And He sees all his steps.
Bahnar: Măt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei răp lăng tơ trong kon bơngai, Sư lăng 'bôh dôm yak.

English: There is no darkness nor shadow of death Where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei măng mu găm măng klăm hơ'bơ̆l ayơ ăn kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gơh ôn akâu.

English: For He need not further consider a man, That he should go before God in judgment.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei pơkă năr. Wă sek tơlang kơ kon bơngai 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: He breaks in pieces mighty men without inquiry, And sets others in their place.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơrăm đĭ lu bơngai pran kơtang ưh kơ kăl kơ jet pơnhen, Na tơplih tơmơ̆t bơngai nai 'bơ̆t anih noh.

English: Therefore He knows their works; He overthrows them in the night, And they are crushed.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang băt tôm tơdrong jang lu sư pơm. Teh lu sư kơmăng păng lu sư pơchah đĭ hloi.

English: He strikes them as wicked men In the open sight of others
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơrăm lu sư yua kơ lu sư pơm kơnê̆ Tơ anih rim 'nu gơh 'bôh.

English: Because they turned back from Him, And would not consider any of His ways
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư weh achăng lê̆ Kră Yang, Ưh kơ wă lăng ôh trong gơlong Kră Yang.

English: So that they caused the cry of the poor to come to Him; For He hears the cry of the afflicted.
Bahnar: Pơm kơ nơ̆r lu bơngai dơnuh hin ôr krao kơtơ̆ng truh tơ Kră Yang. Păng Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r bơngai pơmat-tat ôr krao.

English: When He gives quietness, who then can make trouble? And when He hides His face, who then can see Him, Whether it is against a nation or a man alone?
Bahnar: Tơdah Kră Yang oei ngăn hreh. Bu gô pơ̆n chrih kơ Sư? Tơdah Kră Yang ôn muh măt Sư, bu gơh đei 'bôh Sư? Kră Yang wei rong đĭ-đăng kon pơlei, đĭ-đăng bơngai

English: That the hypocrite should not reign, Lest the people be ensnared.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ ăn lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơgơ̆r, păng ưh kơ ăn lu sư hơ'năk kơ kon pơlei hơđong.

English: “For has anyone said to God, ‘I have borne chastening; I will offend no more
Bahnar: Hăm đei bơngai bu khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: “Inh chu pŭ tơdrong Ih phak bơtho, inh ưh pă pơm kơnê̆ dơ̆ng

English: Teach me what I do not see; If I have done iniquity, I will do no more’?
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ inh ưh kơ 'bôh, apinh Kră Yang bơtho tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh; Tơdah inh đei pơm kơnê̆, inh gô ưh pă pơm dơ̆ng?”

English: Should He repay it according to your terms, Just because you disavow it? You must choose, and not I; Therefore speak what you know.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm đei apah bơngai noh kiơ̆ kơ ih tơchĕng ưh? Yua kơ ih sơngah bơih kơ tơdrong Kră Yang bơtho pơjĭ. Na ih athei rơih iŏk, ưh kơ trŏ kơ inh ôh; Lei na tơdrong kiơ ih băt, athei pơma bĕ.

English: “Men of understanding say to me, Wise men who listen to me
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hlôh wao gô khan kơ inh. Păng lu bơngai gơh hơgei oei mơ̆ng inh, kư̆m gô khan

English: ‘Job speaks without knowledge, His words are without wisdom.’
Bahnar: ‘Jop pơma ưh kơ đei hăm tơdrong hlôh wao, păng nơ̆r sư pơma kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơchĕng tôm.’

English: Oh, that Job were tried to the utmost, Because his answers are like those of wicked men!
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ Jop chu ăn tơdrong pơlong truh kơ tôch, Yua kơ sư tơl nơ̆r thoi bơngai pơm kơnê̆

English: For he adds rebellion to his sin; He claps his hands among us, And multiplies his words against God.”
Bahnar: Sư đei pơm tơdrong yoch bơih, rai pơthim pơrŭng. Pơjăm pơjuă tap ti sư tŏk-bŏk lu nhôn, Păng rai pơma lơ nơ̆r ayăt hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Moreover Elihu answered and said
Bahnar: Êlihu pơma dơ̆ng

English: “Do you think this is right? Do you say, ‘My righteousness is more than God’s’?
Bahnar: Ih tơchĕng ih pơma trŏ hă? Ih khan: “Inh ưh kơ pơm yoch 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: For you say, ‘What advantage will it be to You? What profit shall I have, more than if I had sinned?’
Bahnar: Ih jet Kră Yang dơ̆ng, “Kră Yang đei yua kiơ? Bĕ inh đei yua kiơ, tơdah inh ưh kơ pơm yoch?”

English: “I will answer you, And your companions with you.
Bahnar: Inh wă khan dơ̆ng kơ ih, Păng lu buăl juăt ih hai.

English: Look to the heavens and see; And behold the clouds— They are higher than you.
Bahnar: Ngơk bĕ măt lăng tơ kơpal plĕnh; Lăng bĕ lu hơmơ̆l, sư kơjung hloh kơ ih.

English: If you sin, what do you accomplish against Him? Or, if your transgressions are multiplied, what do you do to Him?
Bahnar: Tơdah ih pơm yoch, đei 'bơm kiơ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei? Tơdah ih pơm yoch rai dêh, ih gơh pơm kiơ hăm Kră Yang?

English: If you are righteous, what do you give Him? Or what does He receive from your hand?
Bahnar: Tơdah ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, ih gô ăn tơdrong kiơ kơ Kră Yang? Kră Yang gô đei iŏk tơdrong kiơ đơ̆ng ti ih?

English: Your wickedness affects a man such as you, And your righteousness a son of man.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơnê̆ ih lăp gơh pơrăm bơngai thoi ih, Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ih gơh tơgŭm kơ kon bơngai đĕch.

English: “Because of the multitude of oppressions they cry out; They cry out for help because of the arm of the mighty.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai đe pơjuă pơđep trăp dêh ôr krao. Lu sư ôr krao wă kơ dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pran kơtang.

English: But no one says, ‘Where is God my Maker, Who gives songs in the night
Bahnar: Mă-lei ưh kơ đei bơngai bu jet: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă Tơ'ngla pơjing inh, tơ yơ?” Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ đe hơri hiôk chơt lăm kơmăng

English: Who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth, And makes us wiser than the birds of heaven?’
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ lu bơ̆n đei đon hơgei hloh kơ lu sem brem, Ăn kơ lu bơ̆n gơh hơgei hloh kơ lu sem păr.”

English: There they cry out, but He does not answer, Because of the pride of evil men.
Bahnar: Lu sư krao ôr, mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei tơl tơwih, Yua kơ lu sư pơang păng pơm kơnê̆.

English: Surely God will not listen to empty talk, Nor will the Almighty regard it.
Bahnar: Tơpă nơ̆r krao khan ưh kơ lui ngeh. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ 'maih mơ̆ng, Kră Yang Tih Hloh ưh kơ 'maih hiơ̆k.

English: Although you say you do not see Him, Yet justice is before Him, and you must wait for Him.
Bahnar: Pơma kiơ kơ ih, liơ mă 'bôh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh mơ̆ng ih. Mưh ih khan ih ưh kơ 'bôh Kră Yang. Tơdrong ih kêng truh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang bơih, păng ih oei răp gô Kră Yang sek tơlang!

English: And now, because He has not punished in His anger, Nor taken much notice of folly
Bahnar: Dang ei, yua kơ Sư ưh kơ sek tơlang kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong blĕk ôh. Ưh pă đei hiơ̆k bơih mă tơdrong yoch lơ

English: Therefore Job opens his mouth in vain; He multiplies words without knowledge.”
Bahnar: Na Jop pơih nơ̆r pơma ưh kơ đei kiơ. Pơma lơ mă-lei nơ̆r ưh kơ yua kiơ.

English: Elihu also proceeded and said
Bahnar: Êlihu pơma dơ̆ng

English: “Bear with me a little, and I will show you That there are yet words to speak on God’s behalf.
Bahnar: Apinh adrin mơ̆ng inh tŏ sĕt, inh gô tơblang tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih; Yua kơ inh oei đei nơ̆r pơma dŏng gah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: I will fetch my knowledge from afar; I will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
Bahnar: Inh chă pơpôi tơdrong gơh hơgei đơ̆ng lơ anih. Wă tơ'bôh Tơ'ngla pơjing inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: For truly my words are not false; One who is perfect in knowledge is with you.
Bahnar: Tơpă inh pơma ưh kơ hơlĕnh ôh; Minh 'nu bơngai gơh hơgei hlôh wao tơpă oei oei hăm lu iĕm.

English: “Behold, God is mighty, but despises no one; He is mighty in strength of understanding.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla Mơsêh Mơyang ưh kơ đei pơjăm bu. Sư hơgei hlôh wao kloh klĕch.

English: He does not preserve the life of the wicked, But gives justice to the oppressed.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ lê̆ ôh bơngai pơm kơnê̆ arih. Sư sek tơlang tơpăt hơnơ̆ng ăn kơ bơngai pơmat-tat.

English: He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous; But they are on the throne with kings, For He has seated them forever, And they are exalted.
Bahnar: Sư bơwei bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Ăn kơ lu sư hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơgơ̆r thoi lu pơtao Ăn kơ lu sư đei đe pơyom ling-lang.

English: And if they are bound in fetters, Held in the cords of affliction
Bahnar: Tơdah đe chô̆ lu sư hăm tơlei glang păng klêng lu sư hăm tơlei bră pơmat-tat.

English: Then He tells them their work and their transgressions— That they have acted defiantly.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong lu sư pơm. Dôm tơdrong yoch noh dơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m pơang.

English: He also opens their ear to instruction, And commands that they turn from iniquity.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơih ăn đon lu sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r bơtho hơmet. Tơtă athei lu sư weh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: If they obey and serve Him, They shall spend their days in prosperity, And their years in pleasures.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư chu mơ̆ng păng bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang, lei dôm năr lu sư gô arih đei tơdrong hiôk chơt, sơnăm lu sư pŭn jơnap.

English: But if they do not obey, They shall perish by the sword, And they shall die without knowledge.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng gô lôch kơ đao gưm. Lu sư gô lôch yua kơ ưh kơ hlôh kơwao.

English: “But the hypocrites in heart store up wrath; They do not cry for help when He binds them.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai ưh kơ lui răk mong tơdrong hil blĕk Kră Yang phak lu sư Kŭm oei ưh kơ krao apinh dŏng pơklaih.

English: They die in youth, And their life ends among the perverted persons.
Bahnar: Lu sư lôch kơplah oei hơmuh hơmŏng Chăl arih lu sư huŏng hiong răm hơdai hăm lu bơngai ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă, lăm anih kơkuh kơ rup yang.

English: He delivers the poor in their affliction, And opens their ears in oppression.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua tơdrong pơmat-tat na dŏng pơklaih bơngai đei pơmat-tat. Pơih đon lu sư lăm tơdrong gleh truh.

English: “Indeed He would have brought you out of dire distress, Into a broad place where there is no restraint; And what is set on your table would be full of richness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dui ih lĕch đơ̆ng anih pơmat-tat. Năm tơ anih rơhơi, jơhngơ̆m ưh pă đei hrăt-hrot. Gơ'bang ih 'bĕnh kơ tơmam sa 'băt nham.

English: But you are filled with the judgment due the wicked; Judgment and justice take hold of you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ih oei jŏk kơ tơdrong phak lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆; Tơdrong sek tơlang phak tơpăt gô rôp ih.a

English: Because there is wrath, beware lest He take you away with one blow; For a large ransom would not help you avoid it.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn tơdrong blĕk yua kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ mơdrŏng dui ba ih jrok trong. 'Nĕ kơ puh lăm tơmam đe răt iŏk ih lơ kơnh ih wơ̆l kơ trong.

English: Will your riches, Or all the mighty forces, Keep you from distress?
Bahnar: Mă ih krao apinh dŏng pơklaih kư̆m ưh kơ klaih đơ̆ng pơmat. Dôm tơdrong pran kơtang gơh kĕ ih. Kŭm ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih ih.

English: Do not desire the night, When people are cut off in their place.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ chang gô măng mu, Kơplah kon pơlei pơla đe anhăk ba pă 'bôh đơ̆ng anih sư.

English: Take heed, do not turn to iniquity, For you have chosen this rather than affliction.
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ, 'nĕ kơ wih tơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆; Ih đei tơdrong pơmat-tat wă pơjuăt ih huay kơ pơm yoch.

English: “Behold, God is exalted by His power; Who teaches like Him?
Bahnar: Âu, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei tơdrong Mơsêh Mơyang Tih Hloh kơ đĭ-đăng, Hăm đei 'bok thây ayơ bơtho tơ'bôh thoi Kră Yang ưh?

English: Who has assigned Him His way, Or who has said, ‘You have done wrong’?
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu pơ̆n bơtho tơ'bôh ăn kơ Kră Yang băt trong Sư wă năm? “Hăm đei bu pơ̆n chrih khan Ih pơm glăi?”

English: “Remember to magnify His work, Of which men have sung.
Bahnar: 'Blŏk hơri bơnê bĕ dôm tơdrong jang Kră Yang, Mă kon bơngai juăt kơ đei hơri bơnê.

English: Everyone has seen it; Man looks on it from afar.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai tă kơ 'bôh ngăl boih tơdrong jang noh, Mă-lei oei lăng 'bôh đơ̆ng ataih.

English: “Behold, God is great, and we do not know Him; Nor can the number of His years be discovered.
Bahnar: Trŏ tơpă, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih-Tin dêh, hloh kơ bơ̆n băt hlôh; Sơnăm Sư arih sot dang yơ, ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơtŏ

English: For He draws up drops of water, Which distill as rain from the mist
Bahnar: Kră Yang hiup iŏk lu đak kơtoh, Sư tuh đak ngom jing 'mi.

English: Which the clouds drop down And pour abundantly on man.
Bahnar: Lu tăl hơmơ̆l 'noh jruh đak 'mi, hơiuh hngôm kơ teh ăn kơ kon bơngai.

English: Indeed, can anyone understand the spreading of clouds, The thunder from His canopy?
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu gơh hlôh hơmơ̆l bơlang bơyar. Re jơwa grơ̆m đơ̆ng anih Sư oei?

English: Look, He scatters His light upon it, And covers the depths of the sea.
Bahnar: To, Kră Yang ăn kơmlat pơchrang hơdah jum dăr kơ Sư. Klơ̆p jơ̆p kơđĕl đak dơsĭ.

English: For by these He judges the peoples; He gives food in abundance.
Bahnar: Kră Yang yua dôm tơdrong 'noh wă pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla; Kră Yang tuh ăn tơmam sa rơkah rơkai.

English: He covers His hands with lightning, And commands it to strike.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ôn grơ̆m glaih lăm ti Sư, ăn glaih taih trŏ kơ anih.

English: His thunder declares it, The cattle also, concerning the rising storm.
Bahnar: Re grơ̆m glaih tơbăt tơdrong hơbŭt, sem dơrong kư̆m dai băt hơbŭt hơbang wă jê̆ truh.b

English: “At this also my heart trembles, And leaps from its place.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu, plei nuih inh pơpơ̆ Plei nuih inh 'bôm tĕnh thoi wă tơgloh lĕch đơ̆ng lăm kơtơh.

English: Hear attentively the thunder of His voice, And the rumbling that comes from His mouth.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ, nơ̆r Kră Yang re jơwa thoi grơ̆m, nơ̆r re jơwa lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư.

English: He sends it forth under the whole heaven, His lightning to the ends of the earth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơmlat chêr 'blêt hơdah ala kơ plĕnh. Păng kơmlat Kră Yang pơchrang truh tơ jơ̆p tôch kơ teh.

English: After it a voice roars; He thunders with His majestic voice, And He does not restrain them when His voice is heard.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh đei jơwa re Kră Yang ôr hơdrăi Grơ̆m re jơwa. Sư ưh pă kĕ pơkơ̆ng bơih kơplah đe kơtơ̆ng re jơwa grơ̆m kơmlat noh.

English: God thunders marvelously with His voice; He does great things which we cannot comprehend.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ grơ̆m re jơwa hlĭch chrơp; Kră Yang pơm dôm tơdrong jang tih-tin, lu bơ̆n ưh kơ kĕ hlôh.

English: For He says to the snow, ‘Fall on the earth’; Likewise to the gentle rain and the heavy rain of His strength.
Bahnar: Kră Yang athei prĕl: “Jruh tơ ala teh!” Păng kư̆m pơma kơ 'mi hngach: “Athei 'mi tih pru pơrach,”

English: He seals the hand of every man, That all men may know His work.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tang chĭt lê̆ ti rim 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng jang, Wă kơ rim 'nu bơngai gơh băt tơdrong jang Sư.

English: The beasts go into dens, And remain in their lairs.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh lu sem bri kơdŭn mơ̆t tơ lăm trôm sư oei pơdơh lăm tơpu lu sư.

English: From the chamber of the south comes the whirlwind, And cold from the scattering winds of the north.
Bahnar: Kial hơbŭt truh đơ̆ng gah gơal, Kial tơngiĕt truh đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: By the breath of God ice is given, And the broad waters are frozen.
Bahnar: Đak prĕl lĕch đơ̆ng hơyuh kial Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dui jơhngơ̆m. Đak glung krong tih să prĕl hơ'bơ̆l jing tơmo hơrăk.

English: Also with moisture He saturates the thick clouds; He scatters His bright clouds.
Bahnar: Kră Yang mong đak lăm hơmơ̆l hơ'bơ̆l. Bơyar bơlang hơmơ̆l hăm kơmlat.

English: And they swirl about, being turned by His guidance, That they may do whatever He commands them On the face of the whole earth.
Bahnar: Hơmơ̆l đông dăr kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang. Pơm pơkeh tơdrong jang mă Kră Yang athei Jơ̆p kơ anih kơpal teh đak.

English: He causes it to come, Whether for correction, Or for His land, Or for mercy.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm pơkeh kiơ̆ thoi Sư wă kơpal teh. Phŏ iŏk sơnguĕt teh bơtho phak, phŏ ăn kơ kon bơngai tơdrong pŭn hiôk.

English: “Listen to this, O Job; Stand still and consider the wondrous works of God.
Bahnar: Ơ Jop, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r 'nâu, Athei dơ̆ng hreh bĕ, tơchĕng gah dôm tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Do you know when God dispatches them, And causes the light of His cloud to shine?
Bahnar: Ih hăm băt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei athei tơtă ăn thoi yơ kơmlat lĕch pơchrang đơ̆ng lăm hơmơ̆l?

English: Do you know how the clouds are balanced, Those wondrous works of Him who is perfect in knowledge?
Bahnar: Ih hăm băt ưh liơ hơmơ̆l đông kơjăp hơnơ̆ng hơnong? Noh tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp đơ̆ng Tơ'ngla gơh hơgei tôm tơdrong?

English: Why are your garments hot, When He quiets the earth by the south wind?
Bahnar: Liơ hơbĕn ao ih tơtŏ, Kơplah teh oei hreh hơđơ̆ng. Kial đơ̆ng gơal tơthu?

English: With Him, have you spread out the skies, Strong as a cast metal mirror?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh lơ̆k bơlang plĕnh tơgŭm hơdai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, arăng thoi kơmĭl đe hling?

English: “Teach us what we should say to Him, For we can prepare nothing because of the darkness.
Bahnar: Apinh ih bơtho lu nhôn băt tơdrong wă pơma hăm Kră Yang; Lu nhôn oei măng mu ưh kơ hlôh, wă roi pơdah tơdrong 'nâu liơ.

English: Should He be told that I wish to speak? If a man were to speak, surely he would be swallowed up.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ pơ̆n wă pơma dơnuh hăm Kră Yang? Hăm đei bu wă kơ lôch răm.

English: Even now men cannot look at the light when it is bright in the skies, When the wind has passed and cleared them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu đe ưh kơ pơ̆n lăng rang mơnhal pơchrang đơ̆ng plĕnh. Wă kial tơthu puh pơđông lê̆ hơmơ̆l plĕnh hlăng hơđah hơdong dơ̆ng.

English: He comes from the north as golden splendor; With God is awesome majesty.
Bahnar: Kră Yang truh đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m lĕch pơchrang rang hơdah Kon bơngai hli tơrơ kơ tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Sư.

English: As for the Almighty, we cannot find Him; He is excellent in power, In judgment and abundant justice; He does not oppress.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lu bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆. Tơdrong mơsêh Sư tih krưp dêh, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư sĭt tơpă ưh kơ đei layơ wă pơjuă bơngai bu.

English: Therefore men fear Him; He shows no partiality to any who are wise of heart.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi 'noh na kon bơngai hli yom kơ Sư. Kră Yang ưh kơ đei hiơ̆k 'blŏk ôh kơ bơngai khan kơ sư kơdih gơh hơgei.

English: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, đơ̆ng lăm kial hơbŭt Kră Yang tơl Jop

English: “Who is this who darkens counsel By words without knowledge?
Bahnar: Bơngai 'nâu bu pơ̆n ưh kơ lui nơ̆r Inh wă pơm. Pơma lu nơ̆r mă ưh kơhlôh kơwao?

English: Now prepare yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall answer Me.
Bahnar: Ih athei gơhret tơlei tơ̆n thoi bơngai nuih kơtang Inh gô jet ih, na ih gô tơl tơwih kơ Inh!

English: “Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Tell Me, if you have understanding.
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh dan hơnă plei teh, ih oei tơ yơ? Tơdah ih hlôh hơdah, roi ăn kơ Inh bĕ.

English: Who determined its measurements? Surely you know! Or who stretched the line upon it?
Bahnar: Bu pơkă hơgăt bơih să iĕ plei teh? Dah bu đei dăng tơlei pơtŏ bơih plei teh ih hăm băt ưh?

English: To what were its foundations fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone
Bahnar: Jrăng sư dan kơpal kiơ? Bu đei pơtăm tơmo mum hơnă sư?

English: When the morning stars sang together, And all the sons of God shouted for joy?
Bahnar: Kơplah sơnglŏng wŏng-tar hơri hơdai. Păng lu kon drŏ-nglo Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôr jreo chơt hiôk.

English: “Or who shut in the sea with doors, When it burst forth and issued from the womb
Bahnar: Bu tang găn lê̆ 'măng đak dơsĭ. Kơplah sư ro lĕch đơ̆ng lăm teh thoi nge lĕch đơ̆ng klak mĕ sư?

English: When I made the clouds its garment, And thick darkness its swaddling band
Bahnar: Inh bơih ăn hơmơ̆l pơm hơbĕn ao kơ đak dơsĭ, iŏk măng mu pơm che wăn sư

English: When I fixed My limit for it, And set bars and doors
Bahnar: Inh bơih hơgăt hơdral ăn kơ đak dơsĭ. Tang chĭt 'măng păng tah chơkăl.

English: When I said, ‘This far you may come, but no farther, And here your proud waves must stop!’
Bahnar: Na khan: “Ih năm truh tôch dâu, ưh pă gơh năm ataih dơ̆ng ôh, Ih poh-yă athei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t dâu!”

English: “Have you commanded the morning since your days began, And caused the dawn to know its place
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr hơiơch kơ ih, ih hăm đei lah tơtă kơ 'năr đei til pơgê hloi, Tơbăt ăn kơ 'năr hơdah anih sư oei.

English: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, And the wicked be shaken out of it?
Bahnar: Athei sư rôp kơjăp lu mum teh, Gơgŭ pơpuh bơngai kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng noh.

English: It takes on form like clay under a seal, And stands out like a garment.
Bahnar: Plei teh tơplih nhen thoi teh lơ̆n đei kơtĭt tơdra Kông groi lĕch 'bôh bang tơbơ̆ng thoi trong đe chơ̆p ao.

English: From the wicked their light is withheld, And the upraised arm is broken.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơdah puh tơweh lê̆ bơih đơ̆ng bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Kơkŏng ti lu sư yơ̆r, pơm kơnê̆ tơgơ̆ bơih

English: “Have you entered the springs of the sea? Or have you walked in search of the depths?
Bahnar: Hăm đei layơ ih jur truh tơ tu đak dơsĭ? Dah yak năm tơ jrŭ ala kơđĕl đak dơsĭ?

English: Have the gates of death been revealed to you? Or have you seen the doors of the shadow of death?
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu tơ'bôh kơ ih 'măng jang pơlei lôch? Ih tam 'bôh 'măng pơlei măng mu gueo?

English: Have you comprehended the breadth of the earth? Tell Me, if you know all this.
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh băt hlôh đĭ plei teh âu să tih dang yơ? Tơdah ih băt đĭ tơdrong 'noh, roi bĕ kơ inh.

English: “Where is the way to the dwelling of light? And darkness, where is its place
Bahnar: Tơ yơ trong ba truh tơ anih tơdrong hơdah oei? Bĕ anih măng mu oei tơ yơ?

English: That you may take it to its territory, That you may know the paths to its home?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh ba sư năm tơ anih sư? Hăm băt kơ trong năm tơ hnam sư oei ưh?

English: Do you know it, because you were born then, Or because the number of your days is great?
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m băt! Yua kơ đei tơpŭ kơ ih bơih kơplah noh, Jô̆ năr ih arih lơ sơnăm tơpă.

English: “Have you entered the treasury of snow, Or have you seen the treasury of hail
Bahnar: Ih hăm đei mơ̆t lăng anih mong prĕl ưh? Ih hăm 'bôh anih mong 'mi prĕl?

English: Which I have reserved for the time of trouble, For the day of battle and war?
Bahnar: Tơmam noh Inh 'măn lê̆ bơih kơ năr rŭng răng. Ăn kơ lăm năr tơblah wang.

English: By what way is light diffused, Or the east wind scattered over the earth?
Bahnar: Tơ yơ trong anih kơmlat lĕch? Dah anih ayơ trong kial gah hơlĕch tơthu bah kơpal teh?

English: “Who has divided a channel for the overflowing water, Or a path for the thunderbolt
Bahnar: Bu pơih trong ăn kơ đak 'mi ro, Pơih trong ăn kơ kơmlat grơ̆m glaih

English: To cause it to rain on a land where there is no one, A wilderness in which there is no man
Bahnar: Ăn kơ 'mi jruh tơ teh bri brah, Lăm char glă ưh đei bơngai oei

English: To satisfy the desolate waste, And cause to spring forth the growth of tender grass?
Bahnar: Wă ruh hơiuh kơ teh hrĕng kro. Pơm ăn kơ 'nhĕt chăt bluh?

English: Has the rain a father? Or who has begotten the drops of dew?
Bahnar: 'Mi hăm đei 'bă ưh? Bu pơjing đei tŭk?

English: From whose womb comes the ice? And the frost of heaven, who gives it birth?
Bahnar: Đak prĕl lĕch đơ̆ng klak bu? Bu rơneh tơlĕch tŭk ngom đơ̆ng plĕnh?

English: The waters harden like stone, And the surface of the deep is frozen.
Bahnar: Đak krăl thoi lĕ tơmo, Hơlŭng jrŭ đak sư jing prĕl arăng.

English: “Can you bind the cluster of the Pleiades, Or loose the belt of Orion?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh iŏk tơlei chô̆ hơdruh sơnglŏng “Waining”a Dah plôh yaih tơlei đơ̆ng sơnglŏng “Hơdrŭng iĕrb”?

English: Can you bring out Mazzaroth in its season? Or can you guide the Great Bear with its cubs?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh athei sơnglŏng lĕch kiơ̆ trŏ kơ bơyan, Păng ba ăn trong kơ sơnglŏng Gŭt-'năk hăm dôm lu kon sư ưh?

English: Do you know the ordinances of the heavens? Can you set their dominion over the earth?
Bahnar: Ih hăm băt tơdrong juăt tơ kơpal plĕnh? Yua tơdrong juăt noh pơgơ̆r bĕ teh đak?

English: “Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, That an abundance of water may cover you?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh ôr pơret tơtă kơ hơmơ̆l, athei 'mi tih lơ̆p kơ akâu ih?

English: Can you send out lightnings, that they may go, And say to you, ‘Here we are!’?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh wơh kơmlat athei sư nơnăm. Na lu sư hăm tơl ih khan: “Lu nhôn tơ âu?”

English: Who has put wisdom in the mind? Or who has given understanding to the heart?
Bahnar: Bu ăn tơdrong gơh hơgei lăm jơhngơ̆m păng ăn bơih tơdrong hlôh wao lăm kơ̆l 'ngok?

English: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can pour out the bottles of heaven
Bahnar: Bu gơh yua tơdrong hơgei na jô̆ lu hơmơ̆l? Dah hăm đei bu gơh gơling tuh ge đak đơ̆ng plĕnh

English: When the dust hardens in clumps, And the clods cling together?
Bahnar: kơplah 'mi jur 'mui teh tơklep băl kơtuăl teh tơklep băl jing arăng?

English: “Can you hunt the prey for the lion, Or satisfy the appetite of the young lions
Bahnar: Ih hăm chă hơnguang tơmam sa ăn kơ dăm-brang akăn, Ăn kơ kon dăm-brang sa hrăp.

English: When they crouch in their dens, Or lurk in their lairs to lie in wait?
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei drum lăm anih trôm sư. Dah oei răp chop chă sem bri wă sa?

English: Who provides food for the raven, When its young ones cry to God, And wander about for lack of food?
Bahnar: Bu chă tơmam sa ăn kơ ak; Kơplah hơnar sư krao ôr apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Dah păr wơ̆t wih to âu yua kơ ưh kơ đei tơmam sa?

English: “Do you know the time when the wild mountain goats bear young? Or can you mark when the deer gives birth?
Bahnar: Ih hăm băt bơyan kiơ bơbe bri su ưh? Ih hăm 'bôh bơyan kiơ juei yŏng tuh kon?

English: Can you number the months that they fulfill? Or do you know the time when they bear young?
Bahnar: Ih hăm đei jô̆ sư anăp hơdôm khei? Ih hăm băt jơ 'năr sư tuh

English: They bow down, They bring forth their young, They deliver their offspring.
Bahnar: sư drum kơchôt jơ̆ng. Ôr jĭ dêh kơplah kon sư lĕch?

English: Their young ones are healthy, They grow strong with grain; They depart and do not return to them.
Bahnar: Lu kon iĕ sư pran jăng, tih wơ̆ lăm tơmăn glă; Đơ̆ng noh tơklah kơ mĕ năm ưh pă wih dơ̆ng.

English: “Who set the wild donkey free? Who loosed the bonds of the onager
Bahnar: Bu ăn kon aseh bri kơdâu pơplŏng mơ̆ng kơ wă, Bu yaih ăn kơ aseh iĕ hơbĕch hơbal to?

English: Whose home I have made the wilderness, And the barren land his dwelling?
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ sư tơmăn glă pơm hnam, Teh đei 'boh pơm anih oei.

English: He scorns the tumult of the city; He does not heed the shouts of the driver.
Bahnar: Sư hiĕk pơjăm pơlei tih hrơ̆ng hreng. Ưh kơ đei kơtơ̆ng ôh nơ̆r bơngai wei aseh iĕ ôr.

English: The range of the mountains is his pasture, And he searches after every green thing.
Bahnar: Kông groi noh tơmăn 'nhĕt sư, Sư năm jơ̆p-jang chă 'nhĕt 'nao bluh.

English: “Will the wild ox be willing to serve you? Will he bed by your manger?
Bahnar: Rơmo bri hăm chu jang kơ ih ưh? Sư hăm chu drum 'bĭch kơmăng lăm hơdrong ưh?

English: Can you bind the wild ox in the furrow with ropes? Or will he plow the valleys behind you?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh tah rơmo bri tơ 'long rơuơ na choh mir ưh? Sư hăm chu kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng ih na 'bơ tŭn tơ lăm thŭng?

English: Will you trust him because his strength is great? Or will you leave your labor to him?
Bahnar: Ih hăm wă yua rơmo bri mă pran jăng dêh? Hăm wă jao kơ sư tơdrong jang gleh lap?

English: Will you trust him to bring home your grain, And gather it to your threshing floor?
Bahnar: Ih hăm lui ngeh kơ sư wă chơ ba 'ba ih păng chơ iŏk đơ̆ng anih preh 'ba?

English: “The wings of the ostrich wave proudly, But are her wings and pinions like the kindly stork’s?
Bahnar: Grơ̆-ă tơtuh pơnăr hiôk chơt; mă-lei sŏk pơnăr sư ưh kơ đei dang sŏk pơnăr sem bŏng ko.

English: For she leaves her eggs on the ground, And warms them in the dust
Bahnar: Yua kơ grơ̆-ă pră kơtăp sư kơdih tơ lăm teh, Pơ'nơ̆m kơtăp sư tơ lăm chuơh

English: She forgets that a foot may crush them, Or that a wild beast may break them.
Bahnar: Hiơt lê̆ kơnh đei jơ̆ng juă kơpal noh. Păng đei kon sem bri pơjuă lê̆ kơtăp sư.

English: She treats her young harshly, as though they were not hers; Her labor is in vain, without concern
Bahnar: Grơ̆-ă hăm lu kon sư, nhen lĕ ưh pă kon kơdih. Ưh pă hli pơmat-tat mă sư kơtăp lơ hĭ.

English: Because God deprived her of wisdom, And did not endow her with understanding.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn tơdrong gơh hơgei kơ sư, Kŭm ưh kơ đei asong ôh tơdrong hlôh wao kơ sư.

English: When she lifts herself on high, She scorns the horse and its rider.
Bahnar: Tơdah kơplah sư iung kơdâu sư hiĕk ăr kơ aseh hăm bơngai hao aseh.

English: “Have you given the horse strength? Have you clothed his neck with thunder?
Bahnar: Ih hăm ăn kơ aseh jơhngơ̆m pran ưh Ih hăm ăn kơ hơko sư, chăt grôi?

English: Can you frighten him like a locust? His majestic snorting strikes terror.
Bahnar: Ih hăm pơm kơ sư pơplŏng thoi lep, Aseh hmoi heh heh hăm pơm kơ đe hli?

English: He paws in the valley, and rejoices in his strength; He gallops into the clash of arms.
Bahnar: Sư kôch teh lăm thŭng, hiôk chơt jơhngơ̆m pran sư; Sư drong tơ anăp lu linh chĕp khêl đao.

English: He mocks at fear, and is not frightened; Nor does he turn back from the sword.
Bahnar: Sư lăng tơdrong hli hơi đĕch, ưh kơ hli tơdrong kiơ, 'Bơ̆t anăp pla đao gưm sư ưh kơ đei kơdŭn.

English: The quiver rattles against him, The glittering spear and javelin.
Bahnar: Kơpal rŏng sư 'brơ̆m lăm jŏ re mơgrĕk mơgrŏk. Hơlă păng tơju tŏ pơchrang rang hlơ-hlêr.

English: He devours the distance with fierceness and rage; Nor does he come to a halt because the trumpet has sounded.
Bahnar: Hăm tơdrong nuih păng blĕk sư kơdâu hrĕnh. Kơplah hlôm keng re, sư ưh kơ kĕ ĕnh dơ̆ng minh 'bôt.

English: At the blast of the trumpet he says, ‘Aha!’ He smells the battle from afar, The thunder of captains and shouting.
Bahnar: Lăp kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm keng, sư ôr: Heh he, Đơ̆ng ataih sư 'bâu hơyuh tơblah, Sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu yŏng linh krao tơkĕch thoi grơ̆m.

English: “Does the hawk fly by your wisdom, And spread its wings toward the south?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ yua tơdrong hơgei ih na kon klang kơtơp păr weh. Pơđêng pơnăr sư păr tơ gah gơal?

English: Does the eagle mount up at your command, And make its nest on high?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kiơ̆ nơ̆r ih tơtă na sem klang dơsum păr tŏk, Pơm tơpu sư tơ anih kơjung?

English: On the rock it dwells and resides, On the crag of the rock and the stronghold.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơpu pơm hnam lăm trôm tơmo. Lăm trôm tơmo hơđang pơm anih kơjăp.

English: From there it spies out the prey; Its eyes observe from afar.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anih noh, sư chă rôp sem sa, Măt sư lăng 'bôh đơ̆ng ataih tơpă.

English: Its young ones suck up blood; And where the slain are, there it is.”
Bahnar: Lu hơnar sư trep sa pham, Anih ayơ đei kon sem lôch lei đei hloi sư tơ noh.

English: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Jop

English: “Shall the one who contends with the Almighty correct Him? He who rebukes God, let him answer it.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hăm pơ̆n pơma pơjah hăm Kră Yang Tih Hloh? Bơngai bu pơ̆n pơjah hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei athei tơl nơ̆r noh bĕ!

English: Then Job answered the LORD and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl Kră Yang

English: “Behold, I am vile; What shall I answer You? I lay my hand over my mouth.
Bahnar: Inh bơngai ưh kơ yua kiơ liơ inh gơh tơl Kră Yang? Inh iŏk ti đơ̆p 'bơ̆r ưh kơ pơ̆n pơma.

English: Once I have spoken, but I will not answer; Yes, twice, but I will proceed no further.”
Bahnar: Inh hơch 'bơm pơma minh 'bar wơ̆t bơih, mă-lei ưh pă pơ̆n tơl dơ̆ng.

English: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm kial hơbŭt, Kră Yang pơma hăm Jop

English: “Now prepare yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall answer Me
Bahnar: Hơmet kơchăng bĕ thoi bơngai nuih kơtang. Inh gô jet na ih gô tơl tơwih kơ Inh.

English: “Would you indeed annul My judgment? Would you condemn Me that you may be justified?
Bahnar: Ih hăm pơ̆n sơngah hŭt lê̆ tơdrong Inh sek tơlang? Khan jô̆ Inh yoch wă pôk kơdih ih khan tơpăt hă?

English: Have you an arm like God? Or can you thunder with a voice like His?
Bahnar: Ih hăm đei kơkŏng ti pran kơtang thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh? Ih hăm gơh tơlĕch nơ̆r grơ̆m re thoi Inh ưh?

English: Then adorn yourself with majesty and splendor, And array yourself with glory and beauty.
Bahnar: Pơhrôp ih kơdih hăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ pran kơtang. Hrŭk iŏk bĕ tơ akâu ih tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal.

English: Disperse the rage of your wrath; Look on everyone who is proud, and humble him.
Bahnar: Săi bĕ tơdrong blĕk ih tơ jơ̆p-jang anih. Lăng bĕ 'bôh bơngai bu pơang tơjur lê̆ sư.

English: Look on everyone who is proud, and bring him low; Tread down the wicked in their place.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ tơ lu bơngai pơang păng teh tơhuŏng lê̆ sư; Kŭm teh pơjuă bĕ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơtă anih sư.

English: Hide them in the dust together, Bind their faces in hidden darkness.
Bahnar: 'Bŭ bĕ lu sư hơdai băl lăm 'mui teh, gom klơ̆p lê̆ muh măt lu sư lăm bơsat.

English: Then I will also confess to you That your own right hand can save you.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh Inh gô pơư kơ ih, Ti 'ma ih kĕ jei gơh pơklaih ih kơdih.

English: “Look now at the behemoth, which I made along with you; He eats grass like an ox.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ kon sem brem tih krưp đak dơsĭ. Mă Inh đei pơjing sư bơih thoi Inh đei pơjing ih Sư sa 'nhĕt thoi rơmo.a

English: See now, his strength is in his hips, And his power is in his stomach muscles.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ tơdrong pran kơtang lăm blu sư. Pran jăng sư tơ lăm sĕch klak sư.

English: He moves his tail like a cedar; The sinews of his thighs are tightly knit.
Bahnar: Kiĕng sư arăng nhen thoi 'long hơngo, Huan blu sư tanh pơchuă pơchuang băl

English: His bones are like beams of bronze, His ribs like bars of iron.
Bahnar: Lu kơting sư arăng nhen thoi đing kong, Jơ̆ng sư thoi bơsei.

English: He is the first of the ways of God; Only He who made him can bring near His sword.
Bahnar: Sư bơih kon sem brem Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing blŭng-a Lăp Tơ'ngla pơjing sư đĕch mă gơh pơlôch pơrăm sư.

English: Surely the mountains yield food for him, And all the beasts of the field play there.
Bahnar: Lu kông groi đei 'nhĕt bluh ăn kơ sư sa, Anih mă lu sem bri chă hơnul chơt.

English: He lies under the lotus trees, In a covert of reeds and marsh.
Bahnar: Sư 'bĭch tep tơ ala kơ bơmreh 'long jơla. Sư ôn pur akâu lăm trâp đei 'nhĕt trang.

English: The lotus trees cover him with their shade; The willows by the brook surround him.
Bahnar: Pơkao chêh-rêh klơ̆p pơm yơ̆p sư, 'Long hla prai cheng thong tăp dăr kơ sư.

English: Indeed the river may rage, Yet he is not disturbed; He is confident, though the Jordan gushes into his mouth
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ hli mă krong ro jăng dêh thoi chơkơi. Sư oei hmă đĕch mă Krong Jôrđăn tŏk ro 'bĕnh tơ 'bơ̆r sư.

English: Though he takes it in his eyes, Or one pierces his nose with a snare.
Bahnar: Bu gơh đơ̆p lê̆ măt sư na rôp sư? Bu rôp sư hăm hơnhuăl, na tôt muh sư chô̆ tơlei dui?

English: “Can you draw out Leviathan with a hook, Or snare his tongue with a line which you lower?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh wah sem brem tiha dah yua tơlei chô̆ hơpiĕt sư kơjăp?

English: Can you put a reed through his nose, Or pierce his jaw with a hook?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh tôt muh sư hăm tơlei ưh, dah tôt kang sư hăm gơwŏk mam?

English: Will he make many supplications to you? Will he speak softly to you?
Bahnar: Sư hăm krao apinh lung ih ưh? Pơma dơnuh hăm ih hiôk ưh?

English: Will he make a covenant with you? Will you take him as a servant forever?
Bahnar: Dah apinh pơgơ̆p hăm ih, wă bơ̆jang kơ ih đĭ chăl arih ưh?

English: Will you play with him as with a bird, Or will you leash him for your maidens?
Bahnar: Ih hăm pơ̆n hơnul ngôi hăm sư nhen thoi hơnul hăm sem păr. Chô̆ sư ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-kăn ih hơnul pơchơt ngôi ưh?

English: Will your companions make a banquet of him? Will they apportion him among the merchants?
Bahnar: Khŭl bơngai chă ka hăm tơgar băl kơ sư. Blah asong 'nhĕm sư tĕch ăn kơ lu bơngai mơdro ka ưh?

English: Can you fill his skin with harpoons, Or his head with fishing spears?
Bahnar: Ih hăm gơh iŏk hok 'bet 'bĕnh kơ akar sư; Iŏk tơju hrang ka na 'bet 'bĕnh kơ kơ̆l sư hă?

English: Lay your hand on him; Remember the battle— Never do it again!
Bahnar: Tơdah ti ih pơlong hơtŭt 'bơm sư. Ih gô 'blŏk tơdrong tơblah noh ưh pă wă pơm dơ̆ng!

English: Indeed, any hope of overcoming him is false; Shall one not be overwhelmed at the sight of him?
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơmĕng wă gơh rôp sư noh hiong đĭ hloi. Lăng 'bôh sư đĕch đe tơtơ̆ pơ̆k hraih đang hloi.

English: No one is so fierce that he would dare stir him up. Who then is able to stand against Me?
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu nuih pơ̆n bơhle sư; Lei, bu pơ̆n dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Inh?

English: Who has preceded Me, that I should pay him? Everything under heaven is Mine.
Bahnar: Bu ăn kơ Inh kiơ boih adrol, na Inh gơh pơdrâu ăn kơ sư dơ̆ng? Đĭ-đăng tơmam tơ ala kơ plĕnh tă kơ tơmam Inh ngăl.

English: “I will not conceal his limbs, His mighty power, or his graceful proportions.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ kĕ kơ ĕnh ôh 'bôh jơ̆ng ti sư, Jơhngơ̆m pran păng akâu hơbŏ liĕm sư.

English: Who can remove his outer coat? Who can approach him with a double bridle?
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu pơ̆n 'bet klĕch ao tai sư 'bar tăl? Hăm đei bu pơ̆n năm jê̆ kang sư đei 'bar tŏ dam?b

English: Who can open the doors of his face, With his terrible teeth all around?
Bahnar: Bu hăm pơ̆n hek 'bơ̆r sư? 'Bĕnh kơ hơnĕnh krưp dêh.

English: His rows of scales are his pride, Shut up tightly as with a seal
Bahnar: Kơchap kơpal rŏng sư lơ.c Thoi trong khêl đe pơrĕng. Tơklep băl glĭp kơjăp

English: One is so near another That no air can come between them
Bahnar: Khêl 'nâu tơklep kơ khêl to, Kial mah ưh kơ gơh klĕch hlôi.

English: They are joined one to another, They stick together and cannot be parted.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơklep băl ưh kơ gơh pleh lê̆

English: His sneezings flash forth light, And his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
Bahnar: Sư gơseh chêr lĕch hơdah, Măt sư hơdah rang thoi 'năr lĕch til pơgê.

English: Out of his mouth go burning lights; Sparks of fire shoot out.
Bahnar: Pla ŭnh lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư, Pla ŭnh tơprah tơ puăn pah.

English: Smoke goes out of his nostrils, As from a boiling pot and burning rushes.
Bahnar: 'Nhui lĕch đơ̆ng trôm muh sư thoi gŏ tŏ blôk, yuh kơklơ̆k kơklăk.

English: His breath kindles coals, And a flame goes out of his mouth.
Bahnar: Hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m sư sa ngar khơ̆ng, Pla ŭnh lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư

English: Strength dwells in his neck, And sorrow dances before him.
Bahnar: Hơko sư đei pran kơtang, Rim 'nu bơngai hli krưp kơdâu tơklah tơklang đơ̆ng anăp sư.

English: The folds of his flesh are joined together; They are firm on him and cannot be moved.
Bahnar: Lu akar sĕch sư tơklep băl kơjăp, Klep hơrăk thoi đe tuh bơsei, ưh kơ đei tơpleh.

English: His heart is as hard as stone, Even as hard as the lower millstone.
Bahnar: Plei nuih sư arăng nhen thoi tơmo. Hơrăng thoi kơ kơdŭt tơpăl.

English: When he raises himself up, the mighty are afraid; Because of his crashings they are beside themselves.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư iung, mă lu bơngai nuih kơtang kư̆m hli tơtơ̆ ngăl; Lu sư hli tơrơ na kơdâu ôn.

English: Though the sword reaches him, it cannot avail; Nor does spear, dart, or javelin.
Bahnar: Iŏk đao 'bet sư, kư̆m ưh kơ klĕch. Mă iŏk hơlă, hok, dah tơju kư̆m lei-lăi đĕch.

English: He regards iron as straw, And bronze as rotten wood.
Bahnar: Sư lăng bơsei thoi lĕ kơ hơnong 'ba. Mam kong kư̆m thoi lĕ kơ 'long bŭk.

English: The arrow cannot make him flee; Slingstones become like stubble to him.
Bahnar: Mă 'brơ̆m hră kư̆m ưh đei pơm ăn kơ sư hli kơdâu ôn. Mă hră kaosu prah sư hăm tơmo Sư lăng thoi hơkam 'ba.

English: Darts are regarded as straw; He laughs at the threat of javelins.
Bahnar: Mă teh sư hăm 'long jra nhen thoi hơnong 'ba, Hiĕk che bơle jơwa hơlă đe hrang weo weo.

English: His undersides are like sharp potsherds; He spreads pointed marks in the mire.
Bahnar: Ala klak sư đei lu akar suĕng thoi ge pơchah. Mưh sư ah klak năm đei trong rek jrŭ lăm hlŭt nhen thoi trong kơđĭnh đe pơ̆ng kơpal tơ̆r rơmo đe dui kơpal anih đe preh 'ba.

English: He makes the deep boil like a pot; He makes the sea like a pot of ointment.
Bahnar: Sư glơi lăm anih jrŭ đak poh-yă nhen thoi đak blôk lăm gŏ. Pơm ăn kơ đak dơsĭ tơprah re nhen thoi đe rơ̆ pơgang lăm gŏ.

English: He leaves a shining wake behind him; One would think the deep had white hair.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng sư đei blô̆k gơmơ̆k rang hơdah. Lăm anih đak jrŭ kok thoi sŏk ko

English: On earth there is nothing like him, Which is made without fear.
Bahnar: Kơpal teh âu ưh kơ đei kon sem kiơ tam dang sư; Sư jing kon sem mă ưh kơ băt hli tơdrong kiơ.

English: He beholds every high thing; He is king over all the children of pride.”
Bahnar: Sư lăng lu sem brem tih ala kơ sư ngăl. Sư pơm pơtao đĭ kơ lu kon sem brem bri brah.

English: Then Job answered the LORD and said
Bahnar: Jop tơl Kră Yang

English: “I know that You can do everything, And that no purpose of Yours can be withheld from You.
Bahnar: Inh băt kơ Kră Yang gơh pơm tôm tơdrong, Ưh kơ đei bu gơh găn Ih tơdrong Ih wă pơm.

English: You asked, ‘Who is this who hides counsel without knowledge?’ Therefore I have uttered what I did not understand, Things too wonderful for me, which I did not know.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet ih bu ưh kơ băt ưh kơ hlôh kiơ, liơ mă pơ̆n ưh kơ ngeh tơdrong Kră Yang wă pơm. Tơpă inh pơma bơih dôm lu tơdrong inh ưh kơ hlôh. Lu tơdrong hlĭch chrơp dêh inh ưh kơ kĕ kơ hlôh.

English: Listen, please, and let me speak; You said, ‘I will question you, and you shall answer Me.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang athei ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư bơtho khan: Roi pơdah kơ Kră Yang dôm tơdrong Kră Yang gô jet ih.a

English: “I have heard of You by the hearing of the ear, But now my eye sees You.
Bahnar: Adrol sơ̆ đon inh lăp kơtơ̆ng ang gah Kră Yang, Mă-lei dang ei, măt inh 'bôh Ih bơih.

English: Therefore I abhor myself, And repent in dust and ashes.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh, inh mơlâu dêh kơ tơdrong inh pơma păng apinh tơbral lăm 'mui tơnuh.

English: And so it was, after the LORD had spoken these words to Job, that the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “My wrath is aroused against you and your two friends, for you have not spoken of Me what is right, as My servant Job has.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Kră Yang bơtho Jop. Kră Yang khan kơ Êliphas bơngai Thêman. “Inh blĕk kơ ih păng 'bar 'nu buăl ih, yua kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ đei pơma tơpăt gah Inh thoi Jop, đĭch đam Inh pơma bơih.

English: Now therefore, take for yourselves seven bulls and seven rams, go to My servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and My servant Job shall pray for you. For I will accept him, lest I deal with you according to your folly; because you have not spoken of Me what is right, as My servant Job has.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei, rôp bĕ tơpơh tŏ rơmo tơno păng tơpơh tŏ triu tơno năm truh tơ Jop, đĭch đam Inh, lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh; na Jop đĭch đam Inh, gô krao khan ăn kơ lu iĕm; Inh gô tơl nơ̆r sư, na Inh huay kơ phak lu iĕm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong kơtul kơmŭl lu iĕm, yua kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ đei pơma tơpăt gah Inh thoi Jop đĭch đam Inh mă pơma bơih.”

English: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did as the LORD commanded them; for the LORD had accepted Job.
Bahnar: Na, Êliphas, bơngai Thêman, Bildat, bơngai Sua, Sôpha bơngai Naama, chu păng pơm kiơ̆ hloi thoi Kră Yang bơtho pơkă ăn; Kră Yang tơl tơwih nơ̆r Jop.

English: And the LORD restored Job’s losses when he prayed for his friends. Indeed the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Jop krao khan ăn kơ buăl sư đang bơih, Kră Yang ăn kơ Jop đei pŭn hiôk păng ăn kơ Jop đei 'bar 'bar lu mŭk tơmam đei 'bar 'bar hơgrop lu sem dơrong.

English: Then all his brothers, all his sisters, and all those who had been his acquaintances before, came to him and ate food with him in his house; and they consoled him and comforted him for all the adversity that the LORD had brought upon him. Each one gave him a piece of silver and each a ring of gold.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu 'nhŏng, mŏ oh sư păng lu bơngai juăt băt kơ Jop đơ̆ng adrol sơ̆, năm ngôi hơpong păng sŏng sa hăm sư tơ lăm hnam sư. Lu sư ngôi hơpong păng pơlung sư gah lu tơdrong truh pơmat mă Kră Yang pơm kơ sư. Rim 'nu kơ lu sư ăn kơ Jop minh kơtuăl jên hub păng minh pôm tơkhiĕn maih.

English: Now the LORD blessed the latter days of Job more than his beginning; for he had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, one thousand yoke of oxen, and one thousand female donkeys.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Kră Yang tuh tơdrong pŭn hiôk ăn kơ Jop lăm sơnăm rai kră lơ hloh kơplah 'nao iung sơ̆: Sư đei mơjĭt-puăn rơbâu tŏ triu, tơdrâu-rơbâu tŏ aseh lăk-đa, minh-rơbâu hơgrop rơmo păng minh-rơbâu aseh iĕ akăn.

English: He also had seven sons and three daughters.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m đei tơpơh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng pêng 'nu kon drŏ-kăn

English: And he called the name of the first Jemimah, the name of the second Keziah, and the name of the third Keren-Happuch.
Bahnar: Sư krao anăn ăn kơ kon drŏ-kăn kơdră sư: Jêmimac kon drŏ-kăn mă 'bar Kêsia, kon drŏ-kăn mă pêng Keren Hapuch.

English: In all the land were found no women so beautiful as the daughters of Job; and their father gave them an inheritance among their brothers.
Bahnar: Lăm đĭ-đăng dêh char noh ưh kơ đei bơngai drŏ-kăn ayơ 'lơ̆ng guăng lei-lăi thoi pêng 'nu kon drŏ-kăn Jop, 'bă lu sư kư̆m asong ăn kơ lu sư mŭk tơmam lei-lăi thoi lu 'nhŏng oh drŏ-nglo lu sư.

English: After this Job lived one hundred and forty years, and saw his children and grandchildren for four generations.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh, Jop oei arih minh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt sơnăm dơ̆ng; sư 'bôh lu kon sâu i sâu ach, truh tơ puăn jơhnơr.

English: So Job died, old and full of days.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Jop lôch sơnăm đĭ sot akâu đĭ kră arih hrăp jơnap.
